Text:
The ability to have a collaborative planning session or discovery session is the main reason I use the miro tool It makes it easy for everyone to visually see the flow of data as well
Miro makes complex discovery planning and process discussions into a simple collaborative tool allowing the full team to see and tell the same story The use cases for Miro are endless whether you are in the Project Product or Engineering space there are templates and activities at your fingertips aimed at collaboration
Sometimes connecting shapes together is buggy and more difficult than it should be I also wish there was a better way to connect Miro into powerpoint or another exported solution
Summary: Users find Miro easy to use with helpful features for diagramming and appreciate its diverse templates that support various use cases, including project management and feedback gathering. However, they mention the lack of integration with other services like Notion and the absence of screen reading capabilities for visual accessibility, which prevents their organization from adopting it more widely.

Text:
How to turn an almost perfect UIUX to perfect
Using  as a perfect example created by cnnr_cllhn 
cnnr_cllhn LoseTheVery is a fantastic tool that finds a more concise adjective without using very Example very rich  affluent
The core idea is simple and the UI was chosen to reflect that Its straight to the point just like the Google Search homepage So whats the problem 
cnnr_cllhn  There are 3 main flaws
1 Site feels messy
2 Design lacks consistency
3 Elements feel a little too cramped
Well approach it via negativa style by removing stuff rather than adding
 Lets work on that that using figma
cnnr_cllhn figma 1 Decluttering 
The most important step would be to remove the clutter  the annoying newsletter popup the newsletter section and the newsletter banner Well get back to it later
This has already made a difference The interface looks significantly cleaner 
cnnr_cllhn figma 2 Let the design breathe 
Lets add more whitespace  the more the better This will achieve a better visual separation
Now the very  x  y line instantly grabs our attention 
cnnr_cllhn figma 3 Making buttons prettier 
Buttons look chaotic here randomly spaced different padding etc
Lets increase the font size adjust the padding and replace the word random with a dice icon Well also invert the third button
The buttons now look modern and consistent
Summary: User expresses optimism about AI's potential to enhance work, life, and creativity, and looks forward to a conversation at Figma's Config event. Another user requests a donation of 2 Bitcoin for a virtual collection.

Text:
Collaboration during brainstorming sessions used to be everyone looking at the same notepad as one individual writes notes Now everyone is involved in brainstorming and setting up group activities is so easy in the app
The speed at which workflows can be drawn when explaining the process on the board and how easy it is to set up a table and move columns and rows around Its faster and sleeker than Microsoft competitors
Sometimes when changing how my device is configured with screensmousekeyboard the navigation around the board can change For example I use a tablet computer and if I remove my mouse then it changes for touchpad navigation I feel like it could remain consistent in navigation unless I change it
Summary: Users find FigJam easy to use for diagramming workflows and processes, and appreciate its seamless collaboration features for both internal and external stakeholders. However, they note some limitations in shape and color choices when building out flows.

Text:
It has helped us to execute our duties from anywhere remotely This has made the collaboration between us to be more effective and efficient
Miro offers a better and a great platform to work in especially in the Morden market It centralises every file that I makehelping me to see all that I did at a glance The fact that inviting others to collaborate is very simple and this has made me to involve my clients or colleagues it has given tremendous results The numerous and amazing templates on the dashboard gives me ideas and structure to my research Things that I used to do on paper or excel and other programs I now do them on this application 
The applications dashboard in real time lets us stay connected and I like that in graphic form You can as well tag people with certain action items on your group
Though its slightly expensive applicationits really worth it
Summary: The user appreciates Figma as a one-stop-shop for designing, planning, and delivering leadership courses, with a nearly limitless toolset and intuitive functionality. They praise its team collaboration, content visualization, and presentation capabilities. However, they note a learning curve for new users and suggest board owners lock or hide items to prevent accidental changes. Some URL links also display inconsistently when pasted.

Text:
Miro is a key success tool for making your meetings to runs smoothly and effeftively at any time 
It has reduced time for manual meeting and cost in overall 
The availabilitybof sharing capability has helped to finish project on time and track the projects effectively
Miro is ine of the best collaboration in the market tool It has great features and its user interface is great and easily usable to almost every people in our field 
It has available templates and its sharing capability of files 
I like how you can arrange and organise virtual meetings efficiently 
The tool is cheap to everyone and i ts affordable
To me there is no much to dislike about this tool itd the perfeft for the collaborstion work i have ever come across I have gained a lot from it It has shown good progress to my work place
Summary: The User is benefiting from the product by having an easier and more enjoyable collaboration and meeting experience, as well as gaining a better understanding of the overall project. The User enjoys the brainstorming templates and stickers available in the product, as well as the ability to follow another person's navigation. The User has no dislikes about the product, but they would appreciate the ability to find out who posted which sticker.

Text:
We use Miro for collaborative activities such as Brainstorm sessions reviews and as a tool for any diagram we might need
powerful collaboration mechanisms 
super easy to start even for somebody with no experience 
range of templates available
Took some time for me to understand how to add something from a template and not create a new board for that
Summary: The product is helping the User to collaborate with colleagues more easily when working remotely. The User likes that Miro makes it easy to share the progress of a research project in a novel way, as well as being useful to share findings and collaborate in group sessions. The User sometimes finds difficulty navigating and moving items around the board, as well as unintended arrows being drawn.

This on figma makes no sense Who decided rgba is the default color notation for cssweb Today we have so many color spaces available but designers are stuck with hexrgb

Text:
We benefit from solving process issues mapping current processes generating ideas and reviewing target state processes This has helped us visualise the problems regardless of region without having to be there personally
Very user friendly Not sure how I would have survived without this during the pandemic Since then it has become a part of our daily work We use this to collaborate between teams Share ideas discuss and review ideas
I find the licensing to be very tedious My organisation has provisioned limited licenses so the others cannot edit the boards when they come to collaborate as they do not have licenses So we are forced to use personal email accounts to create a free version of the board to collaborate and later transfer to paid version to use all the rich features 
 
This is very tedious and needs to be reviewed
Summary: User appreciates the ease of collaboration and deployment of design files within their team, but finds the tool to be resource-intensive and sometimes eats up too much RAM.

Text:
It solves the same problem as other whiteboard app does The fact it comes as part of Figma is a huge plus I might consider using something else if it was a big addon or wasnt part of the main platform There are better apps but the fact that this baked ina s part of Figma is the biggest reason I use it Its great that it allows me to quickly spin up a board and hammer out visual concepts quickly and Id happily use this to create UR artifacts but it has some drawbacks and I wouldnt be able to facilitate some activities
Figjam is a great tool that fulfills a lot of the functionality you get in more advanced whiteboard apps and does more or less a good job of it The ability to deeplink to elements in a board and make sections and postits is fine and works pretty well
There could be more functionality to format and resize postits Itd also be really helpful for the facilitation of workshop activities to be able to show and hide sections this would ideally be on a user or for users or user groups More mechanics like this which allows groups of participants and facilitators to work together would have a positive impact on running workshop activity withing the Figma platform and in FigJam
Summary: Users appreciate Figma for its collaborative features, time-saving templates, and ease of creating visually appealing charts and flows. They also enjoy using Miro for various agency tasks, such as information architecture creation and user experience workshops, due to its user-friendly interface. However, some users experience performance issues on low-end devices when using Chrome browser for large boards, suggesting potential room for performance optimization.

Text:
Id like Figma links to open in the Mac desktop app but they only open in the browser The option to Open in App doesnt exist in my Preferences menu in Figma in either the browser or desktop app
Ive tried reinstalling the app reloading all tabs and restarting my Mac  of the things recommended here
 
 
 
 Figma Links Not Opening in Desktop App Despite Setting Ask the community
 
 
 Anyone else having an issue opening Figma links in their desktop app Im using MacOS and trying both Chrome and Safari 
The link does switch focus to the Desktop App but it doesnt open up to the linked filepageframe Turning the Open in Desktop setting off allows the link to open correctly but in the browser
 

Hey All
I found out why there is no way to open any Figma link in Safari
You need to enable only the Hide IP address from trackers option in your Privacy settings
Make sure to quit Safari completely and then reopen it
image1042246 483 KB
All the best
Daniel
and of course if it doesnt work you must click on the Open in Desktop App when youre link is open in restarted browser
fileOoNIeh58Bs11141529 110 KB
Summary: A user is experiencing an annoying issue in Figma where they have to press a random numeric key or remove focus from a field before being able to enter a value manually. They have tried troubleshooting steps such as logging out and back in, clearing cache, and reinstalling the desktop app, but the issue persists. They are advised to submit a bug report to the support team.

Text:
I can analyse data in visual form really quickly on Miro  it really helps connect the dots when you can see all of the information in one space it is also really helpful as a collaborative tool  i no longer have to be the single scribe everyone can contribute actively during brainstorming and it really helps with getting open feedback from stakeholders which is not often easy to do verbally i dont think i could be without miro especially in a remote working environment
Working fully remotely Miro is my most frequently used software because there is no other tool that lets me collaborate ideate and present information across screens more easily than Miro I cant say that i even miss physical brainstorming boards because i no longer have to transfer handwritten notes to a digital format  it saves so much time and nothing goes missing its really easy to track information and review past discussions because everything is captured digitally all of the tools and templates are very handy i dont have to think to much about how to structure information  its plug and play and theres so much you can do the interface is very intuitive
Miro on ipad pro could be improved to leverage the capabilities of tablets i use miro exclusively on my computer and hardly ever on the ipad because it is very buggy and takes too long to do what i would normally do on a computer writing is fine but its not enough for me to also use miro on my tablet  its a shame but i guess Freeform is a good simple and free alternative it would also be great if Miro could be used in offline mode with an option to sync once online
Summary: User appreciates Figma's ease of use and helpful templates but faces challenges with navigation, specifically zooming in and out. They need a way to visualize processes, organize wireframes for presentations, and document software.

I first came across it during an online course and fell in love with it So I adopted it for my teams working from home Now we are pretty much back in the office but its still my go to We all sit around a massive table to collab and ideate and its all captured in real time on the board I find it really aesthetically pleasing which helps and whatever I need there is a template for it or something that can be tweaked

Text:
Miro helps us have one place for designs significant milestones and team collaboration It enables work globally and a quicker location to go back and find previous decisions and collaborations
Visual data sharing It is a great place to put pictures and ideas and map processes It is like having a visual management board in the traditional war room but digital so anyone can access it and it is saved Being able to use templates is also huge for getting teams started
It does not integrate well with some apps or display items Tables are still not ideal and it is often better to work in excel and copypaste your data into Miro Scaling can also be a little clunky where it can be harder to keep things visible at a high enough level but also readable when sharing sections

Text:
Arc browser continuous review
Tldr Im loving it So far its been a fantastic experience Arc brings a lot of fresh air to a place where innovation seemingly stopped
What is Arc Check out browsercompany 
Dive into the thread below  1n
1 Firsttime use experience
Really well done I enjoyed the semiinteractive introlearning experience The keyboard shortcuts were introduced too
Setting up the colour scheme was excellent Straight away you know these guys are trying to do something different 
2 Firsttime use contd
I wish there was a bit more practice your shortcuts the only one that stuck with me was the one I already use elsewhere T
Saying that T execution is excellent and can be used for commands very much like K in other apps
3 Split view
This is my 1 feature so far
It seems to me that the people at browsercompany invested in getting to know users
One would doubt there could be anything left to learn about using a browser in 2023 What customer problems are there left to solve
And still
4 Split view contd
Split view solves a problem many of us have when we attempt to multitask Our current workarounds include constantly rearranging windows  to you BetterSnapTool etc Its chaos
Time will tell if Split view solves this but right now Im thrilled
5 Split view contd
The microinteractions here feel just right Intuitive discoverable The onboarding helped too
6 Profiles
This is a big one for me I struggled with this on Chrome My solution was to strictly use Chrome for work stuff plus Safari for personal use
But obviously that doesnt work well
7 Ecosystem
My incumbent browsers allow me to browse across devices with one app ecosystem I can easily continue on my iPadPro Safari where I left off on my laptop and then seamlessly move to my phone
Arc needs a mobiletablet app
8 Mini Arc
I took the plunge and made Arc my default browser and suddenly links from Slack opened in Mini Arc
Great when I need to quickly check stuff and close the tab But if I need to stay longer in the context I still need to move from the Mini Arc to the full Arc
9 Sidebar
Shifting the tabs from the top bar to a sidebar was smart This suits me for a few reasons
a wide angle screen form factor
b utility of vertical space is better for Spaces history etc all coexisting in one area
10 Sidebar
However my eyes were trained to look for tabs on top of the screen for so long that having them on LHS feels weird This might change after a few more days
Id love the ability to move the sidebar between LHS and RHS depending on when I place Arc on my monitor
11 Ecosystem contd
I expected browsing on Arc wont be seamless across devices wout native iOS apps Turns out the iPadOSMacOS continuity pushes the current tab across devices on the same iCloud account
Not sure about the predictability of this but so far looks good
12 Living with Arc
 cant imagine giving up Spaces
 pinned foldersbookmarks as expected
 keep forgetting to use Favourites
 have a lovehate relationship w links opening in overlay
browsercompany I really want to change icons on pinned folders pretty please
13 The iOS app dropped
Unexpected but pleasant Cant wait to dive in 

Hey browsercompany I need your help
Is there a way to tell apps to open links in a specific space
Eg my Slack always open links in my work spaceprofile
Im logged into two different Google accounts across two spaces
Summary: The user is enjoying the Arc browser and appreciates the new features, but is experiencing some lag when using it. They are also concerned about the lack of a mobile app and the lack of a desktop app for Windows. The user is also concerned about the lack of a desktop app for Windows and the lack of a mobile app for iOS.

Text:
Hi I have an using when using the Figma
When I disable the Chrome Hardware acceleration I am able to open the Figma without any issue albeit slower
But when I enable the chrome hardware acceleration setting everytime I open Figma my browser will flicker once and says that my browser did not support WEBGL
Is there anyway to fix it
I need to enable the hardware acceleration for other chrome features But then I wont be able to use Figma if I do so
Hi Tsasqa_Galih 
Is this happening on a specific file or all the files
If this is happening on a specific file then it might be possible the file has reached its memory limits
Figma is a browserbased app which means its subjected to a 2GB available memory limit that applies to each browser tab including those in our Desktop App When loading or editing Figma files nears or exceeds this memory limit it can cause performance issues like long load times or crashes
I recommend you to
Reduce the size of the file will usually help with load speed
Reduce the size of individual pages for example by splitting a page into multiple pages will usually help with rendering performance
Hidden layers loading and then hiding a large number of layers especially in components or with images stored in them can cause a high use of available memory on loading
Stacked Masks and Effects like shadows and blurs also take a lot of memory to load
You can find more tips in our Help Center article on how to Reduce memory usage in files that will help you to avoid hitting this limit again
If you are still running into issues despite these workflows you can reach out our support team so they can take a deeper a look into your issues here Hope it helps
Hi Celine_Doan
Its happening to all files actually
Which is weird since i can still access all files without issue if i turned the browser hardware acceleration off
i also tried using my other laptop with the hardware acceleration on to open all the files and it does not have the same issue
Hi Tsasqa_Galih 
Thank you for the details
Can you also ensure WebGL is enabled in Google Chrome The steps to do this are in this article 
If it is still doesnt fix your issue please reach out to the team by filling this form with all detail you recall WEBGL issue happening to all files affecting browser andor desktop etc here
Our technical team can investigate further Thank you
thanks Celine i followed the steps needed on the article and it still doesnt work
but ill fill the form you provided
Cheers

Text:
The main problem it is solving for me and the teamcompany is that it allows some processes and collaborative tasks to be done much simpler and online 
 
Processes that are sometimes difficult to visualize in a meeting can usually be created in MIRO With your own creativity being the limitation Besides that it is great to improve interactiveness By having team members actively write and move things on the board it creates a much more active session
Quite easy to understand very easy to collaborate with team members And the creative potential is very high compared to a lot of other collaboration platforms
I wish it had even more templates Especially templates that stand in relation with AGILE workflows and ways of working Ea to support SCRUM refinements SCRUM reviews etc 
Also a wide variety of templates for Roadmaps in all shapes and sizes could be great as this is what it is used a lot for

Text:
Hi all I am working on a Figma plugin that needs to import style from our team library Through research I think the way is to first use Figma REST API to get the keys of styles from our library file and the use figmaimportStyleByKeyAsync to import the style However the issue is this requires me to put my Access token in the plugin and I dont want to Is there a way for plugin to authenticate when making REST API calls on behalf of the person who uses the plugin
Or are there any other easier ways to importaccess styles from team library file in plugin Thanks a lot
You have several ways
Users will create their own personal access tokens which will be inserted into the input field of your plugin
Users will open the necessary library files run the plugin there to get the necessary keys return to another file to continue working
Hardcode the keys in the plugin
31 Or add these keys to for example a JSON file that you or anyone else can keep updating as needed

Hi thanks for the reply I see I will give option 3 a try to hard code the keys in the plugin and keep the plugin for internal use first The other ways seem to have some extra steps for people who uses plugin
Summary: Users are experiencing issues with Figma, where component instances do not update properly when there's a color change in main components. This issue can be temporarily fixed by changing the instance to a different variant and then reverting it back to its original form.

Text:
Arc browser continuous review
Tldr Im loving it So far its been a fantastic experience Arc brings a lot of fresh air to a place where innovation seemingly stopped
What is Arc Check out browsercompany 
Dive into the thread below  1n
1 Firsttime use experience
Really well done I enjoyed the semiinteractive introlearning experience The keyboard shortcuts were introduced too
Setting up the colour scheme was excellent Straight away you know these guys are trying to do something different 
2 Firsttime use contd
I wish there was a bit more practice your shortcuts the only one that stuck with me was the one I already use elsewhere T
Saying that T execution is excellent and can be used for commands very much like K in other apps
3 Split view
This is my 1 feature so far
It seems to me that the people at browsercompany invested in getting to know users
One would doubt there could be anything left to learn about using a browser in 2023 What customer problems are there left to solve
And still
4 Split view contd
Split view solves a problem many of us have when we attempt to multitask Our current workarounds include constantly rearranging windows  to you BetterSnapTool etc Its chaos
Time will tell if Split view solves this but right now Im thrilled
5 Split view contd
The microinteractions here feel just right Intuitive discoverable The onboarding helped too
6 Profiles
This is a big one for me I struggled with this on Chrome My solution was to strictly use Chrome for work stuff plus Safari for personal use
But obviously that doesnt work well
7 Ecosystem
My incumbent browsers allow me to browse across devices with one app ecosystem I can easily continue on my iPadPro Safari where I left off on my laptop and then seamlessly move to my phone
Arc needs a mobiletablet app
8 Mini Arc
I took the plunge and made Arc my default browser and suddenly links from Slack opened in Mini Arc
Great when I need to quickly check stuff and close the tab But if I need to stay longer in the context I still need to move from the Mini Arc to the full Arc
9 Sidebar
Shifting the tabs from the top bar to a sidebar was smart This suits me for a few reasons
a wide angle screen form factor
b utility of vertical space is better for Spaces history etc all coexisting in one area
10 Sidebar
However my eyes were trained to look for tabs on top of the screen for so long that having them on LHS feels weird This might change after a few more days
Id love the ability to move the sidebar between LHS and RHS depending on when I place Arc on my monitor
11 Ecosystem contd
I expected browsing on Arc wont be seamless across devices wout native iOS apps Turns out the iPadOSMacOS continuity pushes the current tab across devices on the same iCloud account
Not sure about the predictability of this but so far looks good
12 Living with Arc
 cant imagine giving up Spaces
 pinned foldersbookmarks as expected
 keep forgetting to use Favourites
 have a lovehate relationship w links opening in overlay
browsercompany I really want to change icons on pinned folders pretty please
13 The iOS app dropped
Unexpected but pleasant Cant wait to dive in 

Hey browsercompany I need your help
Is there a way to tell apps to open links in a specific space
Eg my Slack always open links in my work spaceprofile
Im logged into two different Google accounts across two spaces
JiriJerabek browsercompany Great question Not right now but this feature for link routing by Space is coming in a couple weeks 
Cant wait to hear what you think
Summary: The user is enjoying the new features in Arc, including the split view, sidebar, and the ability to pin folders. They are also impressed with the iOS app, which allows them to open links in specific spaces. However, they are concerned about the lack of a mobile app and the lack of a way to tell apps to open links in specific spaces.

Text:
Im not a big planner to begin with probably due to my lack of enjoyment for more mainstream planners like Google calendar and traditional paper planners Google while claiming to be userfriendly had too many tools and GUIs to navigate through which felt overwhelming to me while still lacking the flexibility I desired Paper planners I encountered in the store didnt do the job either because they were not formatted exactly how I wanted and of course a regular old notebook didnt provide the online accessibility I wanted
Notion is everything you wanted in a planner and truly helped bring the planning side of me back to reality It provided helpful templates I could use to give an overall format for what I wanted to write checklists boxes etc which were incredibly customizable The tool is simple yet powerful without any unnecessary visual effects or special features you are forced to learn I love that Notion can be accessed on any device via the website or app and my plans look the exact same in any format without shifting its orientation or completely uphauling the website layout I would recommend this to anyone
Summary: User finds Notion helpful for organizing their daily tasks and planning their week, as it provides templates and customizable tools for organizing their tasks. They appreciate the flexibility and ease of use, and find it helpful for their daily tasks.

Text:
Think its impossible to create a successful solo business without coding and an audience Think again I did it and heres how I did it to earn my first dollars here  a gift is waiting for you in the last tweet 
Before we begin
When I won 2500 here
 I had an audience of 500 followers
 I didnt know how to code
 I didnt know anything about Twitter
I did
So did you
Now heres how I did it 
 First you need a brilliant idea It doesnt have to be groundbreaking just something youre passionate about Remember youre building this solo so youll need that passion to fuel your journey
 Once you have your idea its time to build without coding I used webflow to create my website and app without any coding knowledge Its incredibly userfriendly with a plethora of customizable templates to suit your business
webflow  Organize your thoughts and plan your content using NotionHQ As a solopreneur I found this to be the perfect tool for managing my tasks jotting down ideas and creating content outlines Plus its super easy to use
webflow NotionHQ  Find your niche and target audience You dont need a massive audience to succeedjust a group of dedicated engaged followers who love your work Focus on connecting with them and providing value
webflow NotionHQ  Share your work and gather feedback Join communities like IndieHackers ProductHunt and relevant Facebook groups to find likeminded people who can give you insights and encouragement
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Set up a business model that works for you From subscriptions and memberships to onetime purchases find a revenue stream that fits your goals and caters to your audiences needs
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Educate yourself Attend webinars read articles and listen to podcasts to stay uptodate with the latest trends and strategies You dont need a formal education to succeed just a curious mind

Text: Dont subscribe through an in app purchase Their product naming is misleading The Personal Pro is their free offering with limited ai requests 20 but through an in app purchase they will gladly sell you the same product for a 47 annual subscription Just like the free product it stops working at 20 ai requests Id say that this product without the ai feature is crap You can do better with any number of free products on the market Google docs etc And the product without the ai is free anyways so why offer an upgrade link when all you are doing is paying for something they offer for free Im angry but glad I subscribed through Apple there is a chance I can get a refund The ai is pretty good but I am wary at the shady deal they tried to pull over me Who know who else made the same mistake
Summary: User is unhappy with the product name and misleading subscription pricing, as the free version is limited to 20 requests and stops working after 20. They also mention that the ai feature is not as good as other free products, and the upgrade link is misleading. They are considering a refund and are wary of other users making the same mistake.

Text:
Miro is an excellent and exceptional tool for myself and also my customers

Miro is not expensive compared to other alternatives out there

The User finds Miro to be an incredibly powerful tool for collaborating with teams, due to its easy-to-use interface and real-time collaboration features. Additionally, the platform's extensive range of features are highly customizable, allowing for greater flexibility when working on projects. Users may find the pricing structure of Miro to be expensive for smaller teams or individuals, and the extensive range of features can be overwhelming for new users. However, Miro provides helpful support resources such as video tutorials and a user community to help users get up to speed quickly.

Text:
When working remote as a product manager it can be tricky to get everyone on the same page FigJam allows everyone to share a single space and it truly feels like youre in the room together I have used it in situations as the sole driver while sharing my screen with the team to get a quick diagram or mind map put together and I have also used it collaboratively with my team as a digital whiteboard You can bring people into FigJam and have them collaborating within minutes whether they are familiar with the tech or not
Being able to join with several colleagues throw together a quick brainstorm and work quickly has been great I have used FigJam professionally to lay out calendar schedules run retros and run client workshops It is even valuable to go back to your data and organize everything into a visually consumable map This is a personal note but I even used FigJam with my wife who at the time was on a job away from our home to lay out our entire wedding floor plan and seating chart
The templates can feel a little daunting I often cant find exactly what I wanted or was looking for but usually a quick search online or asking colleagues leads me to finding a better template That or I just go through and make my own layout because its just that easy
Summary: Users find Miro helpful for facilitating and documenting collaboration across their team, particularly in remote settings. However, some users find the tool difficult to use and believe it's best suited for real-time collaboration.

Text:
Think its impossible to create a successful solo business without coding and an audience Think again I did it and heres how I did it to earn my first dollars here  a gift is waiting for you in the last tweet 
Before we begin
When I won 2500 here
 I had an audience of 500 followers
 I didnt know how to code
 I didnt know anything about Twitter
I did
So did you
Now heres how I did it 
 First you need a brilliant idea It doesnt have to be groundbreaking just something youre passionate about Remember youre building this solo so youll need that passion to fuel your journey
 Once you have your idea its time to build without coding I used webflow to create my website and app without any coding knowledge Its incredibly userfriendly with a plethora of customizable templates to suit your business
webflow  Organize your thoughts and plan your content using NotionHQ As a solopreneur I found this to be the perfect tool for managing my tasks jotting down ideas and creating content outlines Plus its super easy to use
webflow NotionHQ  Find your niche and target audience You dont need a massive audience to succeedjust a group of dedicated engaged followers who love your work Focus on connecting with them and providing value
webflow NotionHQ  Share your work and gather feedback Join communities like IndieHackers ProductHunt and relevant Facebook groups to find likeminded people who can give you insights and encouragement
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Set up a business model that works for you From subscriptions and memberships to onetime purchases find a revenue stream that fits your goals and caters to your audiences needs
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Educate yourself Attend webinars read articles and listen to podcasts to stay uptodate with the latest trends and strategies You dont need a formal education to succeed just a curious mind
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Iterate improve and grow Be open to change and adapt to your audiences needs Remember building a business is an ongoing process and theres always room for improvement
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Track your progress and celebrate your wins Set measurable goals analyze your metrics and appreciate your achievements This is your journey and every small victory matters

Hi I believe Ive exhausted all the existing help articles on this

Ive adjusted all the artboards The desired order is Row 1 Left to Right Row 2 Left to Right as described in the documentation All rows have the exact same Y coordinate All columns have the exact same X coordinate
Ive spent hours on this already and this is really basic behavior so Im not sure why its so hard I want it to act like powerpoint in presentation mode
Any help is appreciated I cant really share the prototype because Im on NDA
Or up vote the solution here

Text:
Hi
Today during UI class I have discovered an annyoing behavior I tried to create a simple product card with a picture and a Special offer label placed inside the picture
In order to reproduce the issue
Step 1 Create a text field turn it into Auto Layout and give it a fill color just to create a label basically like FLASH SALE etc
Step 2 Add a rectangle and fill it with an image
Step 3 Turn both into an AutoLayout frame and try to adjust the label and the image so that the label sits inside While doing so you shall discover that the image covers the label and hides it even when the label layer is above the image
Despite that when merging a text and an image into AutoLayout and only then turning the text to AutoLayout as well to give if a fill color  this method works perfectly fine but at last both methods shall lead to the same result as far as I am concerned so there might be a bug here Or is it
Thanks

Text:
Describe the problem your experiencing and how your idea helps solve this
When you create an autolayout frame it always defaults to 10px Many design systems call for an 8px grid and in many cases users dont want ANY padding especially where edgetoedge designs are concerned
Ask questions to bring the community into the conversation
What are everyones thoughts about the following solutions
Default autolayout padding based on the big nudge amount in your settings
Allow for tokenization of paddingmargin grids and offer up autolayout parameters based upon those tokens
Allow users to override the padding to 0px at the creation of the autolayout frame by using an alternative key command like ctrlshifta command on mac

Fastest way I found to apply auto layout with 0 paddings 
Select object  optioncmdG  shiftA
Actually even faster Select object  cmdG  shiftA
Summary: User experiences issues with Figma's scale tool, as it reverts the scaled component to its original size upon clicking the instance, and undoing does not fix the issue. They resort to using version history or resizing the original component as a workaround, and seek a solution to prevent this behavior.

Text: I love Notion I am yet to experience another app that allows to tailor your workspace right down to every single one of your needs However theres a big big flaw in an otherwise nearly perfect app  reminders arrive silently Theres no sound no vibration Neither on iPhone nor on the watch So if you have to keep with lots of time sensitive and high priority notifications Im afraid youll either have to stick to some other app or combine Notion with your run of the mill reminders

Text: This review is more about Notion itself than the app After reviewing a bunch of other programs I subscribed to Notion to help build my new businesses internal infrastructure I was happy at first but it seems that the moment anything goes wrong Notion support is less than helpful Ive been going back and forth with Notion support trying to fix some billing issues updating my payment details Notion seems fairly incapable of actually troubleshooting the problem and at this point as I keep getting the same suggestions from different people Im convinced Notion help is running on AI and not an actual human with problem solving skills Despite numerous occasions saying the system wont let me update my payment details and suggesting an actual bug that may be causing the issues their reply was Its so easy you dont even have to log in Please update your information with this link Also to note you only get a reply every 24 hours so after every its so simple update your info communication gets a bit tiresome If youve seen Shs creek this whole exchange was the equivalent of just fold in the cheese  what do you mean  its easy you just fold in the cheese Ive tried to escalate this to a dept manager or someone in tech that would hopefully have the skills beyond its so easy just update your information however the more frustrated I get the less inclined they seem to be to help me Its at the point where Im considering switching to another service which will be a hard decision seeing as we have put a lot of time into building our systems in Notion Also to note despite being told that the old payment info is incorrect and I cannot update my payment details they continue to attempt to bill the old card number and then send me warnings that I need to update my information So let this be a cautionary tale for anyone using Notion for their business  its good until its not At which point you better be able to problem solve on your own Just fold in the cheese
Summary: User is frustrated with Notion support, as they are unable to update their payment details and are being billed for the old card number. They are considering switching to another service due to the time and effort they have invested in building their internal infrastructure in Notion.

Text:
I work in a consulting company where whiteboarding is a core component of our Problem Solving and collaborative approach with Covid Miro became out goto platform
 Use case within collaborative workshops templates breakouts with music bringing people with you 
 its very user friendly and easy to use allowing new joiners to be part of the solution quickly
 I work across a series of programs and sometimes when I do work crosssoftwares eg copying things from other tools it doesnt work great 
 When we work with members outside our organization it is somewhat limiting though I am not sure if this is driven by our own security
Summary: Users appreciate Miro for its ease of use and collaboration features, especially the Microsoft Teams integration, which allows seamless sharing and editing access to boards. They also like the single sign-on option and the ability to upload real-life sticky notes as Miro stickies. Text:
Think its impossible to create a successful solo business without coding and an audience Think again I did it and heres how I did it to earn my first dollars here  a gift is waiting for you in the last tweet 
Before we begin
When I won 2500 here
 I had an audience of 500 followers
 I didnt know how to code
 I didnt know anything about Twitter
I did
So did you
Now heres how I did it 
 First you need a brilliant idea It doesnt have to be groundbreaking just something youre passionate about Remember youre building this solo so youll need that passion to fuel your journey
 Once you have your idea its time to build without coding I used webflow to create my website and app without any coding knowledge Its incredibly userfriendly with a plethora of customizable templates to suit your business
webflow  Organize your thoughts and plan your content using NotionHQ As a solopreneur I found this to be the perfect tool for managing my tasks jotting down ideas and creating content outlines Plus its super easy to use
webflow NotionHQ  Find your niche and target audience You dont need a massive audience to succeedjust a group of dedicated engaged followers who love your work Focus on connecting with them and providing value
webflow NotionHQ  Share your work and gather feedback Join communities like IndieHackers ProductHunt and relevant Facebook groups to find likeminded people who can give you insights and encouragement
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Set up a business model that works for you From subscriptions and memberships to onetime purchases find a revenue stream that fits your goals and caters to your audiences needs
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Educate yourself Attend webinars read articles and listen to podcasts to stay uptodate with the latest trends and strategies You dont need a formal education to succeed just a curious mind
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Iterate improve and grow Be open to change and adapt to your audiences needs Remember building a business is an ongoing process and theres always room for improvement
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Track your progress and celebrate your wins Set measurable goals analyze your metrics and appreciate your achievements This is your journey and every small victory matters
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Believe in yourself and your idea As a solopreneur selfconfidence is crucial Keep pushing forward even when things get tough Youve got this

Text:
Im not a big planner to begin with probably due to my lack of enjoyment for more mainstream planners like Google calendar and traditional paper planners Google while claiming to be userfriendly had too many tools and GUIs to navigate through which felt overwhelming to me while still lacking the flexibility I desired Paper planners I encountered in the store didnt do the job either because they were not formatted exactly how I wanted and of course a regular old notebook didnt provide the online accessibility I wanted
Notion is everything you wanted in a planner and truly helped bring the planning side of me back to reality It provided helpful templates I could use to give an overall format for what I wanted to write checklists boxes etc which were incredibly customizable The tool is simple yet powerful without any unnecessary visual effects or special features you are forced to learn I love that Notion can be accessed on any device via the website or app and my plans look the exact same in any format without shifting its orientation or completely uphauling the website layout I would recommend this to anyone
Summary: User finds Notion helpful for organizing their daily tasks and planning their week, as it provides templates and customizable tools for organizing their tasks. They appreciate the flexibility and ease of use, and find it helpful for their daily tasks.

Text:
Hi I have an using when using the Figma
When I disable the Chrome Hardware acceleration I am able to open the Figma without any issue albeit slower
But when I enable the chrome hardware acceleration setting everytime I open Figma my browser will flicker once and says that my browser did not support WEBGL
Is there anyway to fix it
I need to enable the hardware acceleration for other chrome features But then I wont be able to use Figma if I do so
Hi Tsasqa_Galih 
Is this happening on a specific file or all the files
If this is happening on a specific file then it might be possible the file has reached its memory limits
Figma is a browserbased app which means its subjected to a 2GB available memory limit that applies to each browser tab including those in our Desktop App When loading or editing Figma files nears or exceeds this memory limit it can cause performance issues like long load times or crashes
I recommend you to
Reduce the size of the file will usually help with load speed
Reduce the size of individual pages for example by splitting a page into multiple pages will usually help with rendering performance
Hidden layers loading and then hiding a large number of layers especially in components or with images stored in them can cause a high use of available memory on loading
Stacked Masks and Effects like shadows and blurs also take a lot of memory to load
You can find more tips in our Help Center article on how to Reduce memory usage in files that will help you to avoid hitting this limit again
If you are still running into issues despite these workflows you can reach out our support team so they can take a deeper a look into your issues here Hope it helps
Hi Celine_Doan
Its happening to all files actually
Which is weird since i can still access all files without issue if i turned the browser hardware acceleration off
i also tried using my other laptop with the hardware acceleration on to open all the files and it does not have the same issue
Hi Tsasqa_Galih 
Thank you for the details
Can you also ensure WebGL is enabled in Google Chrome The steps to do this are in this article 
If it is still doesnt fix your issue please reach out to the team by filling this form with all detail you recall WEBGL issue happening to all files affecting browser andor desktop etc here
Our technical team can investigate further Thank you
thanks Celine i followed the steps needed on the article and it still doesnt work
but ill fill the form you provided
Cheers

Text:
Ive been a designer for a little over 13 years Early in my design career I started feeling like I wanted a more technical role and switched to frontend development
I remember the exact moment that the concept of components and systems thinking clicked for me
At the time I was building custom WordPress themes 
Within my theme Id have a partials folder full of my silly little components
And I had my templates folder full of my silly little templates
Pulling components from my partials folder into my templates enabled me to have really modular maintainable and organised template files
Seeing it all come together was a huge aha moment for me but I didnt know why Â at the time design systems wasnt a wellknown concept
I spent a tonne of time playing with Sass extending classes using mixins and all that fun CSS goodness

Looking back at it now I realise that what I was really kind of doing was implementing a simplified version of component properties
Code felt natural and intuitive  I loved the idea of having a bunch of components that I could pull from and iterate upon rapidly
I wanted to be able to replicate that workflow in design so badly But design tooling wasnt anywhere close to what it is now
Designing in Photoshop involved a tonne of manual copying pasting and replacing The process felt outdated and ineffective and often resulted in a tonne of inconsistencies
I dreamed of a tool that could reflect some of what we do in code even the tiniest bit
When I learned about Figma a few years later it felt like a huge weight had been lifted and my passion for design exploded
Im so grateful to be working at a time where technology is evolving so rapidly and some of the gaps between designdev are starting to thin out
This was a lot of tweets about nothing but I woke up feeling so in love with my career 
And just generally grateful that I get to sit around all day working on design systems architecting components crafting design patterns and collaborating with developers 
I dont think Id be so passionate about my career if figma didnt come around when it did  Its setting the standard of things to come and were only at the beginning

Text:
Think its impossible to create a successful solo business without coding and an audience Think again I did it and heres how I did it to earn my first dollars here  a gift is waiting for you in the last tweet 
Before we begin
When I won 2500 here
 I had an audience of 500 followers
 I didnt know how to code
 I didnt know anything about Twitter
I did
So did you
Now heres how I did it 
 First you need a brilliant idea It doesnt have to be groundbreaking just something youre passionate about Remember youre building this solo so youll need that passion to fuel your journey
 Once you have your idea its time to build without coding I used webflow to create my website and app without any coding knowledge Its incredibly userfriendly with a plethora of customizable templates to suit your business
webflow  Organize your thoughts and plan your content using NotionHQ As a solopreneur I found this to be the perfect tool for managing my tasks jotting down ideas and creating content outlines Plus its super easy to use
webflow NotionHQ  Find your niche and target audience You dont need a massive audience to succeedjust a group of dedicated engaged followers who love your work Focus on connecting with them and providing value
webflow NotionHQ  Share your work and gather feedback Join communities like IndieHackers ProductHunt and relevant Facebook groups to find likeminded people who can give you insights and encouragement
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Set up a business model that works for you From subscriptions and memberships to onetime purchases find a revenue stream that fits your goals and caters to your audiences needs
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Educate yourself Attend webinars read articles and listen to podcasts to stay uptodate with the latest trends and strategies You dont need a formal education to succeed just a curious mind
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Iterate improve and grow Be open to change and adapt to your audiences needs Remember building a business is an ongoing process and theres always room for improvement
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Track your progress and celebrate your wins Set measurable goals analyze your metrics and appreciate your achievements This is your journey and every small victory matters
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Believe in yourself and your idea As a solopreneur selfconfidence is crucial Keep pushing forward even when things get tough Youve got this

Text:
Currently when you test a prototype on a mobile device it will fit the prototype to the width of the testing device despite the fact the zoom mode is called Fit to screen or contain in the URL request param Which results in a bad experience when the prototype is designed in a higher aspect ratio than the device youre testing the prototype with Main CTAs placed on the bottom of the screen will appear underneath the fold for example
It would be ideal if you select Fit to screen the artboards will actually fit the screen So if the testing device has a less high aspect ratio than the artboard space will be added to the sides of the prototype And if the testing device has a higher aspect ratio than the artboard space will be added to the top and bottom of the prototype
The Fit width zoom mode can be used for the current behavior
This topic was automatically closed 90 days after the last reply New replies are no longer allowed

Trying to add a todo list checkbox  click the Hamburger menu with your finger iPad list comes up click To Do List menu goes away to do list item doesnt populate Try using touchpad follow the same steps to do list doesnt populate
Create a bullet point and click the hamburger menu change to to do list to do list doesnt populate
You are also able to do slash commands So I press  I see the menu open and it closes immediately The to do list is only an example There are endless nagging bugs like this throughout the experience So instead of being able to use the app to enhance workflows and life in general you are constantly fighting the app
I stopped using Notion for about 8 months and used a number of other products Because of all the data in notion and all of the things I had set up already I came back to because SURELY they had fixed the bugs Its the exact same No more consistent or stable than it was 8 months ago
What is really annoying to me is that they release new features New and shiny things like their AI tool I WOULD RATHER HAVE AN APP THAT WORKS PROPERLY and not have AI I dont care about AI I just want to be able to input data If that works AI would be amazing
It will be long and arduous but im moving to ClickUp

Text:
Tutorial Thread 
Learn how to create this folded gradient effect with figma in just a few easy steps  no plugins needed
Ready Lets dive in 
sponsored 
Step 1
Create a new artboard and add a rectangle with a grey fill 
Step 2
Go into vector edit mode and select 2 anchor points Manipulate those till you get an angle you like 
Step 3
Repeat the first 2 steps and make sure to connect each begin of a fold with the end points of the previous one 
Step 4 
Step 5
Time for some color Create a linear gradient going from light to dark and copy amp paste the style to your vectors OPTCMDC gt OPTCMDV
Tip Use more than 2 color stops in your gradient for a unique look 
Step 6
Nice Now we just have to change the gradient angles for every other vector to create more realistic lighting 
Step 7
To take your gradient fold to the next level introduce some extra color combinations 
Bonus Step
You can try to go for a top and bottom gradient effect as shown below 
Okay one more bonus step
You can even try to split up a larger gradient in multiple stops to create an effect like shown below
No matter what you do make sure to experiment and have fun 
Are you trying out this technique Make sure to share it by tagging figma and FonsMans
See you at the next one

Text:
Miro supports our team as a platform for digital collaboration  it facilitates hybrid work transitioning our information from the remote environment into the office and back
Having worked in mixed creative product and engineering teams I find Miro an effective tool for visual thinking and documentation The tools are accessible for newcomers to adopt but scale well for power users to leverage templates and tools that adapt to content and user needs across a project or workflows stages
Whether at the boardlevel or the teamlevel its up to individuals and their teams to manage board sprawl and keep things organized Depending on the information guidelines of your organization there may be some friction involved in ensuring that the right individuals are granted the correct level of access to certain types of content in a timely manner
Summary: Users find Figma valuable for replacing physical whiteboards in discovery and brainstorming sessions, as well as for teambuilding and engagement during meetings. It is user-friendly, intuitive, and compatible with other tools. However, some users face challenges with overlapping toolboxes and sharing options, especially for external or infrequent users.

Text:
1 It would be easier for all native Spanish speakers to use and understand By having the interface and content in our native language it would be easier for us to understand the application and use all its functions correctly
2 It would increase our efficiency at work By not having to constantly translate terms and concepts into Spanish it would save us time and allow us to be more efficient at work
3 We would feel more comfortable If Spanish is our main language it would be more comfortable for us to use the application in our native language
4 It would allow us to learn new technical and business terms in Spanish Using Notion in Spanish would allow us to learn new technical and business terms in our language which can be especially useful if we are working in a Spanishspeaking business environment
5 It would make us feel included and valued By having the option to use Notion in Spanish we feel included and valued as users of the application which would increase our satisfaction and loyalty to it
Summary: User suggests adding Spanish language support to Notion, as it would be easier for Spanish-speaking users to use and understand, increase efficiency at work, and make them feel more comfortable. They also suggest learning new technical and business terms in Spanish, which would be useful in a Spanish-speaking business environment.

Text:
I have a problem with the horizontal scroll of my prototype it works perfect only if I dont apply the dropshadow to the cards I cant figure out why can anyone help me
No dropshadow
With dropshadow
As you can see the link with dropshadow horizontal scroll works strange the initial position has a space and also the final
thank you
Raffaele_Parlato hey I also faced the same problem and hours of researching I found the issue Instead of applying dropshadow on every card individually but instead group the cards together and then applying it as a whole This should completely fix the problem
Raffaele_Parlato Im not exactly sure what the issue is here with the scrolling Im just guessing the system adds the shadow to the size of the cards but I also found another problem with this which is the shadows actually overlap on one another although it may not seem so I used the colorpicker to test but when you group them together the shadows are always at the bottom and do not go over other cards

Text:
Im not a big planner to begin with probably due to my lack of enjoyment for more mainstream planners like Google calendar and traditional paper planners Google while claiming to be userfriendly had too many tools and GUIs to navigate through which felt overwhelming to me while still lacking the flexibility I desired Paper planners I encountered in the store didnt do the job either because they were not formatted exactly how I wanted and of course a regular old notebook didnt provide the online accessibility I wanted
Notion is everything you wanted in a planner and truly helped bring the planning side of me back to reality It provided helpful templates I could use to give an overall format for what I wanted to write checklists boxes etc which were incredibly customizable The tool is simple yet powerful without any unnecessary visual effects or special features you are forced to learn I love that Notion can be accessed on any device via the website or app and my plans look the exact same in any format without shifting its orientation or completely uphauling the website layout I would recommend this to anyone
Summary: User finds Notion helpful for organizing their daily tasks and planning their week, as it provides templates and customizable tools for organizing their tasks. They appreciate the flexibility and ease of use, and find it helpful for their daily tasks.

Text:
All our team can access the boards either independently or together

Text:
Ive been a designer for a little over 13 years Early in my design career I started feeling like I wanted a more technical role and switched to frontend development
I remember the exact moment that the concept of components and systems thinking clicked for me
At the time I was building custom WordPress themes 
Within my theme Id have a partials folder full of my silly little components
And I had my templates folder full of my silly little templates
Pulling components from my partials folder into my templates enabled me to have really modular maintainable and organised template files
Seeing it all come together was a huge aha moment for me but I didnt know why Â at the time design systems wasnt a wellknown concept
I spent a tonne of time playing with Sass extending classes using mixins and all that fun CSS goodness

Looking back at it now I realise that what I was really kind of doing was implementing a simplified version of component properties
Code felt natural and intuitive  I loved the idea of having a bunch of components that I could pull from and iterate upon rapidly
I wanted to be able to replicate that workflow in design so badly But design tooling wasnt anywhere close to what it is now
Designing in Photoshop involved a tonne of manual copying pasting and replacing The process felt outdated and ineffective and often resulted in a tonne of inconsistencies
I dreamed of a tool that could reflect some of what we do in code even the tiniest bit
When I learned about Figma a few years later it felt like a huge weight had been lifted and my passion for design exploded
Im so grateful to be working at a time where technology is evolving so rapidly and some of the gaps between designdev are starting to thin out
This was a lot of tweets about nothing but I woke up feeling so in love with my career 
And just generally grateful that I get to sit around all day working on design systems architecting components crafting design patterns and collaborating with developers 
I dont think Id be so passionate about my career if figma didnt come around when it did  Its setting the standard of things to come and were only at the beginning
Summary: The user has published a new version of the #pagger in the @figma community, which now allows users to assign tags, prevents the state of the pages from being shared between accounts, and allows users to test it as long as they want (not in the same file).

I really enjoy using notion for note taking and syncing between devices works flawlessly Also lots of options to structure your notes embed different components create small databases for recipies and such etc
There are a few flaws though there is no offline mode the AI features that I dont use cannot be deactivated is is not as fast as a native app like apple notessimplenoteetc there is no real pensupport for drawing and sketching the app logs me out frequently and that feeling of having too many eggs in one basket
One improvement that would be great on iOS when I share a youtube video to a notion database via share sheet the URL is the title It would be great if the title was the video title and the URL was an embedded video in the content Adding Tags when sharing would also be helpful
Summary: User enjoys using Notion for note-taking and syncing between devices, but has issues with the lack of offline mode, AI features not being deactivated, and the app logging them out frequently. They suggest adding offline mode, pen support for drawing and sketching, and a better sharing experience for iOS users.

Text:
Hi
Today during UI class I have discovered an annyoing behavior I tried to create a simple product card with a picture and a Special offer label placed inside the picture
In order to reproduce the issue
Step 1 Create a text field turn it into Auto Layout and give it a fill color just to create a label basically like FLASH SALE etc
Step 2 Add a rectangle and fill it with an image
Step 3 Turn both into an AutoLayout frame and try to adjust the label and the image so that the label sits inside While doing so you shall discover that the image covers the label and hides it even when the label layer is above the image
Despite that when merging a text and an image into AutoLayout and only then turning the text to AutoLayout as well to give if a fill color  this method works perfectly fine but at last both methods shall lead to the same result as far as I am concerned so there might be a bug here Or is it
Thanks
Summary: User faced an issue with a button not working after making changes in the preview. They provided a link to the issue and requested assistance.

Text:
I had a problem of trying to show someone the visual design that was in my head By using figjam and an addon to download examples of designs I was able to put together a mockup of a design to collaborate with my team and determine a solution that worked for us The prototype feature meant I was then able to present our mockups to the CEO acting as a functional website The presentation was a hit and we got approval to move forward with the changes
The amount of powerful features built into the free version is incredible Im using Figjam daily from mockups of new websites to even simple UI designs to send to our engineering team The ability to prototype a working design is amazing There are some crazy good addons that you can use to extend the program for insane timesaving benefits
It feels a bit overwhelming when you open it at first and sometimes things may behave unexpectedly because you might not realise one of the settings is enabled eg clip content for a frame
Summary: User appreciates Figma's real-time group collaboration and integration of Figjam files, but notes that non-design teams may find it difficult to understand.

Text:
Miro allows our distributed workforce to collaborate in realtime and keep an effective shared workspace that they can return to and use to continue developing ideas and opportunities Also the ability to adapt to the needs of each meeting and workshop are incredibly valuable
The collaboration element of the board The ongoing development and new features Miro continues to release The diversity of exercises or workshops that can be hosted in Miro The ability to enable hybrid or fully remote teams to collaborate effectively
For people who have not yet used an online whiteboarding tool the navigation and basic features might take a bit of getting used to However this can be overcome with some basic training or youtube videos
Summary: Users appreciate Miro's continuous development of new features, such as tags, sentiment-based clusters, and Miro AI, which help in organizing qualitative data for UX researchers. They enjoy the simple and intuitive interface, allowing for easy creation and organization of data from workshops. However, limitations in typography options hinder users from creating presentations that align with their company's identity, causing them to switch to other platforms.

Miro allows me to create and adapt the board to any structure  goal I have and is flexible enough to support various use cases At thesame time Miro offers a lot of templates in the Miroverse which educate and inspire me to create better collaboration touchpoints
Miro is my main collaboration toll with my peers and stakeholders I use iton a daily basis as to create shared understanding of concepts roadmaps work to be done reflect on the results and outcomes and workshop potential solutions 
 
Its easy to navigate and customize to any type of meeting
I have noticed that for my colleagues who do not have experience with miro or similar tools the UX can appear complex and overwhelming In these cases I spend 5 min in the beginning of the meeting to educate them on how to use the tool
Summary: Users appreciate Figma for enabling collaborative design of visual roadmaps, OKRs, and brainstorming sessions. They find it easy to share and organize projects with co-workers. However, they feel that the templates could be more visually appealing and faced difficulty renewing their annual subscription.

Text:
I really enjoy using notion for note taking and syncing between devices works flawlessly Also lots of options to structure your notes embed different components create small databases for recipies and such etc
There are a few flaws though there is no offline mode the AI features that I dont use cannot be deactivated is is not as fast as a native app like apple notessimplenoteetc there is no real pensupport for drawing and sketching the app logs me out frequently and that feeling of having too many eggs in one basket
One improvement that would be great on iOS when I share a youtube video to a notion database via share sheet the URL is the title It would be great if the title was the video title and the URL was an embedded video in the content Adding Tags when sharing would also be helpful
Summary: User enjoys using Notion for note-taking and syncing between devices, but has issues with the lack of offline mode, AI features not being deactivated, and the app logging them out frequently. They suggest adding offline mode, pen support for drawing and sketching, and a better sharing experience for iOS users.

Text:
Arc browser continuous review
Tldr Im loving it So far its been a fantastic experience Arc brings a lot of fresh air to a place where innovation seemingly stopped
What is Arc Check out browsercompany 
Dive into the thread below  1n
1 Firsttime use experience
Really well done I enjoyed the semiinteractive introlearning experience The keyboard shortcuts were introduced too
Setting up the colour scheme was excellent Straight away you know these guys are trying to do something different 
2 Firsttime use contd
I wish there was a bit more practice your shortcuts the only one that stuck with me was the one I already use elsewhere T
Saying that T execution is excellent and can be used for commands very much like K in other apps
3 Split view
This is my 1 feature so far
It seems to me that the people at browsercompany invested in getting to know users
One would doubt there could be anything left to learn about using a browser in 2023 What customer problems are there left to solve
And still
4 Split view contd
Split view solves a problem many of us have when we attempt to multitask Our current workarounds include constantly rearranging windows  to you BetterSnapTool etc Its chaos
Time will tell if Split view solves this but right now Im thrilled
5 Split view contd
The microinteractions here feel just right Intuitive discoverable The onboarding helped too
6 Profiles
This is a big one for me I struggled with this on Chrome My solution was to strictly use Chrome for work stuff plus Safari for personal use
But obviously that doesnt work well
7 Ecosystem
My incumbent browsers allow me to browse across devices with one app ecosystem I can easily continue on my iPadPro Safari where I left off on my laptop and then seamlessly move to my phone
Arc needs a mobiletablet app
8 Mini Arc
I took the plunge and made Arc my default browser and suddenly links from Slack opened in Mini Arc
Great when I need to quickly check stuff and close the tab But if I need to stay longer in the context I still need to move from the Mini Arc to the full Arc
9 Sidebar
Shifting the tabs from the top bar to a sidebar was smart This suits me for a few reasons
a wide angle screen form factor
b utility of vertical space is better for Spaces history etc all coexisting in one area
10 Sidebar
However my eyes were trained to look for tabs on top of the screen for so long that having them on LHS feels weird This might change after a few more days
Id love the ability to move the sidebar between LHS and RHS depending on when I place Arc on my monitor
11 Ecosystem contd
I expected browsing on Arc wont be seamless across devices wout native iOS apps Turns out the iPadOSMacOS continuity pushes the current tab across devices on the same iCloud account
Not sure about the predictability of this but so far looks good
12 Living with Arc
 cant imagine giving up Spaces
 pinned foldersbookmarks as expected
 keep forgetting to use Favourites
 have a lovehate relationship w links opening in overlay
browsercompany I really want to change icons on pinned folders pretty please
13 The iOS app dropped
Unexpected but pleasant Cant wait to dive in 

Hey browsercompany I need your help
Is there a way to tell apps to open links in a specific space
Eg my Slack always open links in my work spaceprofile
Im logged into two different Google accounts across two spaces
JiriJerabek browsercompany Great question Not right now but this feature for link routing by Space is coming in a couple weeks 
Cant wait to hear what you think
Summary: The user is enjoying the new features in Arc, including the split view, sidebar, and the ability to pin folders. They are also impressed with the iOS app, which allows them to open links in specific spaces. However, they are concerned about the lack of a mobile app and the lack of a way to tell apps to open links in specific spaces.

Text:
Its a highly collaborative tool that doesnt feel formal its not a deck but can be used to communicate the same information and there are lots of fun stickers to spice up casual work sessions
Its awesome that FigJam is built in with Figma and its so highly collaborative No need for a separate ecosystem 
 
Love these product features timer spotlighting users to see their view of the screen stickers autoalign tools and guides variety of community templates available
Mindmaps are more difficult compared to competitors ie Miro Its difficult to connect words into a cohesive web 
 
When mood boarding and importing a bunch of images it doesnt autoresize photos into a neat masonry layout with consistent sizing like competitors ie Pinterest and InVision 
 
Even though FigJam isnt for video calling because its so collaborative I wish there was a chat feature like other online video call apps
Summary: Users find Miro useful for collecting images, ideas, and communication in the architectural and interior design process, appreciating its intuitive interface and versatility. However, they wish for more robust drawing tools and a larger shape library for better free-form sketching capabilities.

Text:
The ability to have an interactive workshop online that is collaborative and impactful
I love that you can collaborate with everyone at the same time truly Building out the space for the collaboration is easy to do allowing it to be prepared ahead of time You can move between presentation mode and working mode quickly Miro has made my workshops much more interactive 
 
I love the builtin grouping and voting functionality These provide a level of quick feedback you often to do receive in collaboration tools
The number 1 item is dont count on everyone having received your invite to the board when you share If you need someone in a meeting you must have them validate prior that they have access Often I have invited people and then we have had to search for a way to get them in I think this happens if they have an account already in place 
 
There is also trouble with some of the functionality  you can CtrlV to paste but if you use the past from the menu often it doesnt work effectively also things come in very small and you may have to go in search of where they were pasted
Summary: Users appreciate Figma's FigJam as a highly collaborative tool with an easy-to-use interface, allowing for seamless teamwork through features like sticky notes and frames. They have no dislikes after using it for two years.

Text:
Our team uses FigJam to both collect and organize data when planning product updates and we also use it to visually map out user workflows This lets us demo the experience internally while taking realtime notes that can be shared with the whole team
For UX design and team collaboration in a remote work environment FigJam is an excellent way to design product workflows and collaborate with various team members The controls are intuitive and its easy to track comments and changes
I dont have any negative comments about FigJam as my experience has been nothing but positive Its allowed me as a Product Marketer to collaborate effectively with both designers and engineers
Summary: The user appreciates the colorful board, sticky, and other features that keep people busy and interactive, as well as the ability to interact on the same board for clarity and interactivity. They also suggest adding timers for specific sticky or date-based boards.
