Text:
Notion is an absolutely fantastic app for projects notes sorting and many many more due to its versatility and freedom As a single person notion is completely free with next to no restrictions Teams will require payment but it has a free trial to see how you like it and I consider it fantastic for groups However that being said mobile notion is severely lacking in certain features that the desktop version has Basic features like renaming your workspace can only be done on desktop There are also some bugs with the ui like the back arrow sometimes just straight up sending me out of the current workspace and the toolbar disappearing and requiring me to restart the app
These dont ruin the app by any means as notion is still an amazing app and is still amazing in mobile but I would consider mobile notion a great ADDITION to your desktop notion Use desktop as your main form of using notion when creating and use mobile when youre away from the desktop or need to check something Mobile as your only form of using notion isnt terrible but its definitely inferior
Notion overall is an amazing app with amazing developers who deserve lots of love and support They also gave major generosity with the app of which many other services wouldve charged the individual a large amount of money to use what notion gives for free which again is pretty much everything except very minor things like upload file size limits
Summary: User praises Notion for its versatility and freedom, but notes that mobile version lacks certain features and has bugs. They suggest using desktop as the main form of using Notion, and mobile as an addition to it.

Text:
I need a fast easy and collaborative way to wireframe and fatmarker sketch ideas with my design and engineering team We also use it for retrospective meeting whiteboards
I love that Figjam is in the Figma suite and is so simple and easy to use As a Product Manager I am not adept enough at Figma to use it as a whiteboard so I use Figjam to mock up ideas and do light wireframing before turning ideas into designs in full Figma
Figjams strength is also its weakness it is very simple and lacks some other whiteboard features found in competing whiteboard products like Miro If they continue adding features I think that Figjam will be a market leader soon
Summary: User appreciates the searchable and editable document, as it allows for easy ideation and interactive meetings. They also appreciate the fast loading time and lack of archiving features.

Text:
Arc browser continuous review
Tldr Im loving it So far its been a fantastic experience Arc brings a lot of fresh air to a place where innovation seemingly stopped
What is Arc Check out browsercompany 
Dive into the thread below  1n
1 Firsttime use experience
Really well done I enjoyed the semiinteractive introlearning experience The keyboard shortcuts were introduced too
Setting up the colour scheme was excellent Straight away you know these guys are trying to do something different 
2 Firsttime use contd
I wish there was a bit more practice your shortcuts the only one that stuck with me was the one I already use elsewhere T
Saying that T execution is excellent and can be used for commands very much like K in other apps
3 Split view
This is my 1 feature so far
It seems to me that the people at browsercompany invested in getting to know users
One would doubt there could be anything left to learn about using a browser in 2023 What customer problems are there left to solve
And still
4 Split view contd
Split view solves a problem many of us have when we attempt to multitask Our current workarounds include constantly rearranging windows  to you BetterSnapTool etc Its chaos
Time will tell if Split view solves this but right now Im thrilled
5 Split view contd
The microinteractions here feel just right Intuitive discoverable The onboarding helped too
6 Profiles
This is a big one for me I struggled with this on Chrome My solution was to strictly use Chrome for work stuff plus Safari for personal use
But obviously that doesnt work well
7 Ecosystem
My incumbent browsers allow me to browse across devices with one app ecosystem I can easily continue on my iPadPro Safari where I left off on my laptop and then seamlessly move to my phone
Arc needs a mobiletablet app
8 Mini Arc
I took the plunge and made Arc my default browser and suddenly links from Slack opened in Mini Arc
Great when I need to quickly check stuff and close the tab But if I need to stay longer in the context I still need to move from the Mini Arc to the full Arc
9 Sidebar
Shifting the tabs from the top bar to a sidebar was smart This suits me for a few reasons
a wide angle screen form factor
b utility of vertical space is better for Spaces history etc all coexisting in one area
10 Sidebar
However my eyes were trained to look for tabs on top of the screen for so long that having them on LHS feels weird This might change after a few more days
Id love the ability to move the sidebar between LHS and RHS depending on when I place Arc on my monitor
11 Ecosystem contd
I expected browsing on Arc wont be seamless across devices wout native iOS apps Turns out the iPadOSMacOS continuity pushes the current tab across devices on the same iCloud account
Not sure about the predictability of this but so far looks good
12 Living with Arc
 cant imagine giving up Spaces
 pinned foldersbookmarks as expected
 keep forgetting to use Favourites
 have a lovehate relationship w links opening in overlay
browsercompany I really want to change icons on pinned folders pretty please
13 The iOS app dropped
Unexpected but pleasant Cant wait to dive in 

Hey browsercompany I need your help
Is there a way to tell apps to open links in a specific space
Eg my Slack always open links in my work spaceprofile
Im logged into two different Google accounts across two spaces
JiriJerabek browsercompany Great question Not right now but this feature for link routing by Space is coming in a couple weeks 
Cant wait to hear what you think
Summary: The user is enjoying the new features in Arc, including the split view, sidebar, and the ability to pin folders. They are also impressed with the iOS app, which allows them to open links in specific spaces. However, they are concerned about the lack of a mobile app and the lack of a way to tell apps to open links in specific spaces.

Notion would be amazing if if it was easy to do easy things There is a lot of functionality that would make your life a lot easier What takes away from all of this potential is a buggy and nagging experience trying to input information

Text:
Lack of visual communication Traditional communication methods like emails or chats can sometimes make it difficult to convey complex ideas or visualize a concept FigJam solves this problem by providing an easytouse whiteboarding tool that allows teams to quickly create visual representations of their ideas and share them with others
FigJam is a collaborative online whiteboarding tool created by Figma that allows teams to work together in realtime to brainstorm plan and visualize ideas One of the best things about FigJam is its ease of use and intuitive interface which makes it simple for even nondesigners to quickly create diagrams flowcharts wireframes and other types of visual content
sometimes UI could be complicated if youre a user that are not familiar with the FIGMA infinite canvas system that you can scroll a lot and not find the end Aside from that is great
Summary: Users appreciate Miro for its collaboration features, enabling teams to work together on presentations and designs more efficiently than with InDesign or PowerPoint. Miro is particularly helpful for remote team members, though some users may initially feel intimidated. While it offers more design flexibility, users may need to be creative to achieve desired results.

Over the past 6 months Ive been on the hunt for a new browser that can replace Chrome for me as a writer and product engineer And I found it

I was looking for 3 things from a new browser privacy performance and productivity After testing the usual suspects like Firefox Safari and Brave and trying out some new kids like KagiHQs Orion SigmaOS and browsercompanys Arc  I eventually switched to
KagiHQ SigmaOS browsercompany Arc by the browsercompany  You can read my full reasoning and review of all the browsers on my blog  but Arc has just completely stolen my heart 
KagiHQ SigmaOS browsercompany As a writer Arcs spaces and fullscreen workflow makes me feel so organized and focused when doing research and as an engineer it provides Chromes dev tools with some added feature sugar that makes it a joy for development work
Summary: User is using the browserCO app on their phone and is enjoying the experience.

Text: Dont subscribe through an in app purchase Their product naming is misleading The Personal Pro is their free offering with limited ai requests 20 but through an in app purchase they will gladly sell you the same product for a 47 annual subscription Just like the free product it stops working at 20 ai requests Id say that this product without the ai feature is crap You can do better with any number of free products on the market Google docs etc And the product without the ai is free anyways so why offer an upgrade link when all you are doing is paying for something they offer for free Im angry but glad I subscribed through Apple there is a chance I can get a refund The ai is pretty good but I am wary at the shady deal they tried to pull over me Who know who else made the same mistake
Summary: User is unhappy with the product name and misleading subscription pricing, as the free version is limited to 20 requests and stops working after 20. They also mention that the ai feature is not as good as other free products, and the upgrade link is misleading. They are considering a refund and are wary of other users making the same mistake.

Text:
I use scale tool K key to scale design for mobile version
When I literally click the instance of the nested scaled component it discards the scale and reverts the instance to the original size
CMD  Z doesnt change it back to the scaled version and the layout stays broken So I have to use version history to revert everything back or as a work around I change size of the original component and it magically rerender the scaled instance and reverts it back until the next interaction
How to stop Figma from this behavior
Summary: Users discuss the issue of autolayout frames in Figma defaulting to 10px padding, which is not suitable for all design systems. They suggest solutions like basing default padding on the big nudge amount in settings, allowing tokenization of padding/margin grids, and using alternative key commands for 0px padding. Some users share their methods for applying auto layout with 0 padding quickly.

Text:
Miro provides an ideal software solution for collecting comments and feedback on wireframe designs showing what they would look like with elements rearranged and sharing them with others we are collaborating with 
Team members can review content in their own time and leave postit notes comments and annotations with the flexibility to be able to draw cut and paste etc to get thoughts across When we provide our feedback to others its very clear which part of the design each piece of feedback relates to and visually shows what we think it should look like
Very flexible easy to use intuitive keyboard shortcuts for adding elements to the board make it quick to get thoughts down Default colours and styles look good 
Easier to navigate than visio
Doesnt have BPMN symbols and swimlane structure where space can easily be added in the middle of a diagram so not well suited for process mapping  I still use visio for that

Text:
Think its impossible to create a successful solo business without coding and an audience Think again I did it and heres how I did it to earn my first dollars here  a gift is waiting for you in the last tweet 
Before we begin
When I won 2500 here
 I had an audience of 500 followers
 I didnt know how to code
 I didnt know anything about Twitter
I did
So did you
Now heres how I did it 
 First you need a brilliant idea It doesnt have to be groundbreaking just something youre passionate about Remember youre building this solo so youll need that passion to fuel your journey
 Once you have your idea its time to build without coding I used webflow to create my website and app without any coding knowledge Its incredibly userfriendly with a plethora of customizable templates to suit your business
webflow  Organize your thoughts and plan your content using NotionHQ As a solopreneur I found this to be the perfect tool for managing my tasks jotting down ideas and creating content outlines Plus its super easy to use
webflow NotionHQ  Find your niche and target audience You dont need a massive audience to succeedjust a group of dedicated engaged followers who love your work Focus on connecting with them and providing value
webflow NotionHQ  Share your work and gather feedback Join communities like IndieHackers ProductHunt and relevant Facebook groups to find likeminded people who can give you insights and encouragement
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Set up a business model that works for you From subscriptions and memberships to onetime purchases find a revenue stream that fits your goals and caters to your audiences needs
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Educate yourself Attend webinars read articles and listen to podcasts to stay uptodate with the latest trends and strategies You dont need a formal education to succeed just a curious mind
Summary: The user is a freelance writer and has been using Notion for a year. They are currently working on a book and are looking for a publisher. They are considering using a platform like BookBub to promote their book.

Text:
Arc browser continuous review
Tldr Im loving it So far its been a fantastic experience Arc brings a lot of fresh air to a place where innovation seemingly stopped
What is Arc Check out browsercompany 
Dive into the thread below  1n
1 Firsttime use experience
Really well done I enjoyed the semiinteractive introlearning experience The keyboard shortcuts were introduced too
Setting up the colour scheme was excellent Straight away you know these guys are trying to do something different 
2 Firsttime use contd
I wish there was a bit more practice your shortcuts the only one that stuck with me was the one I already use elsewhere T
Saying that T execution is excellent and can be used for commands very much like K in other apps
3 Split view
This is my 1 feature so far
It seems to me that the people at browsercompany invested in getting to know users
One would doubt there could be anything left to learn about using a browser in 2023 What customer problems are there left to solve
And still
4 Split view contd
Split view solves a problem many of us have when we attempt to multitask Our current workarounds include constantly rearranging windows  to you BetterSnapTool etc Its chaos
Time will tell if Split view solves this but right now Im thrilled
5 Split view contd
The microinteractions here feel just right Intuitive discoverable The onboarding helped too
6 Profiles
This is a big one for me I struggled with this on Chrome My solution was to strictly use Chrome for work stuff plus Safari for personal use
But obviously that doesnt work well
7 Ecosystem
My incumbent browsers allow me to browse across devices with one app ecosystem I can easily continue on my iPadPro Safari where I left off on my laptop and then seamlessly move to my phone
Arc needs a mobiletablet app
8 Mini Arc
I took the plunge and made Arc my default browser and suddenly links from Slack opened in Mini Arc
Great when I need to quickly check stuff and close the tab But if I need to stay longer in the context I still need to move from the Mini Arc to the full Arc
9 Sidebar
Shifting the tabs from the top bar to a sidebar was smart This suits me for a few reasons
a wide angle screen form factor
b utility of vertical space is better for Spaces history etc all coexisting in one area
10 Sidebar
However my eyes were trained to look for tabs on top of the screen for so long that having them on LHS feels weird This might change after a few more days
Id love the ability to move the sidebar between LHS and RHS depending on when I place Arc on my monitor
11 Ecosystem contd
I expected browsing on Arc wont be seamless across devices wout native iOS apps Turns out the iPadOSMacOS continuity pushes the current tab across devices on the same iCloud account
Not sure about the predictability of this but so far looks good
12 Living with Arc
 cant imagine giving up Spaces
 pinned foldersbookmarks as expected
 keep forgetting to use Favourites
 have a lovehate relationship w links opening in overlay
browsercompany I really want to change icons on pinned folders pretty please
13 The iOS app dropped
Unexpected but pleasant Cant wait to dive in 

Hey browsercompany I need your help
Is there a way to tell apps to open links in a specific space
Eg my Slack always open links in my work spaceprofile
Im logged into two different Google accounts across two spaces
Summary: The user is enjoying the Arc browser and appreciates the new features, but is experiencing some lag when using it. They are also concerned about the lack of a mobile app and the lack of a desktop app for Windows. The user is also concerned about the lack of a desktop app for Windows and the lack of a mobile app for iOS.

We have used other platforms in the past with similar capabilities but FigJam is very easy to use It helps us diagram out our workflows and processes but internally and externally for clients The important thing is that someone outside of our organization that doesnt use FigJam every day can easily use it and collaborate
Being able to collaborate with both internal and external stakeholders is very easy The UI makes it easy to create and ideate our processes and sharing the FigJam with others is seamless They dont need to download anything to hop in and start editing
There isnt much I would say I dislike about FigJam There are some limitations in choices when building out flows such as shapes or colors but it hasnt effected me from being able to create what I need

Text:
Arc browser continuous review
Tldr Im loving it So far its been a fantastic experience Arc brings a lot of fresh air to a place where innovation seemingly stopped
What is Arc Check out browsercompany 
Dive into the thread below  1n
1 Firsttime use experience
Really well done I enjoyed the semiinteractive introlearning experience The keyboard shortcuts were introduced too
Setting up the colour scheme was excellent Straight away you know these guys are trying to do something different 
2 Firsttime use contd
I wish there was a bit more practice your shortcuts the only one that stuck with me was the one I already use elsewhere T
Saying that T execution is excellent and can be used for commands very much like K in other apps
3 Split view
This is my 1 feature so far
It seems to me that the people at browsercompany invested in getting to know users
One would doubt there could be anything left to learn about using a browser in 2023 What customer problems are there left to solve
And still
4 Split view contd
Split view solves a problem many of us have when we attempt to multitask Our current workarounds include constantly rearranging windows  to you BetterSnapTool etc Its chaos
Time will tell if Split view solves this but right now Im thrilled
5 Split view contd
The microinteractions here feel just right Intuitive discoverable The onboarding helped too
6 Profiles
This is a big one for me I struggled with this on Chrome My solution was to strictly use Chrome for work stuff plus Safari for personal use
But obviously that doesnt work well
7 Ecosystem
My incumbent browsers allow me to browse across devices with one app ecosystem I can easily continue on my iPadPro Safari where I left off on my laptop and then seamlessly move to my phone
Arc needs a mobiletablet app
8 Mini Arc
I took the plunge and made Arc my default browser and suddenly links from Slack opened in Mini Arc
Great when I need to quickly check stuff and close the tab But if I need to stay longer in the context I still need to move from the Mini Arc to the full Arc
9 Sidebar
Shifting the tabs from the top bar to a sidebar was smart This suits me for a few reasons
a wide angle screen form factor
b utility of vertical space is better for Spaces history etc all coexisting in one area
10 Sidebar
However my eyes were trained to look for tabs on top of the screen for so long that having them on LHS feels weird This might change after a few more days
Id love the ability to move the sidebar between LHS and RHS depending on when I place Arc on my monitor
11 Ecosystem contd
I expected browsing on Arc wont be seamless across devices wout native iOS apps Turns out the iPadOSMacOS continuity pushes the current tab across devices on the same iCloud account
Not sure about the predictability of this but so far looks good
12 Living with Arc
 cant imagine giving up Spaces
 pinned foldersbookmarks as expected
 keep forgetting to use Favourites
 have a lovehate relationship w links opening in overlay
browsercompany I really want to change icons on pinned folders pretty please
13 The iOS app dropped
Unexpected but pleasant Cant wait to dive in 

Hey browsercompany I need your help
Is there a way to tell apps to open links in a specific space
Eg my Slack always open links in my work spaceprofile
Im logged into two different Google accounts across two spaces
JiriJerabek browsercompany Great question Not right now but this feature for link routing by Space is coming in a couple weeks 
Cant wait to hear what you think
Summary: The user is enjoying the new features in Arc, including the split view, sidebar, and the ability to pin folders. They are also impressed with the iOS app, which allows them to open links in specific spaces. However, they are concerned about the lack of a mobile app and the lack of a way to tell apps to open links in specific spaces.

Text:
All our team can access the boards either independently or together 
This enables everyone to work on items when it is best for them 
 
Having everyone able to provide input or comments directly in the Miro boards means that there is less indirect  administrative load
Great compatibility with other programs Microsoft Teams and Office tie ins work well 
Duplicated copied in data means no location links to maintain 
Large number of templates that can be leveraged to kick start your layouts
Sometimes you want to preserve links to the data and be able to automatically update 
This is not a strength of the platform as generally speaking the data become separate from the source when pulled in
Summary: The user appreciates the ability to organize their project in one place and share it with collaborators, as well as the ability to add comments and sticky notes. They also appreciate the endless board feature and the ability to follow themselves around the board for critiques. The user finds the platform easy to use and appreciates the hidden features.

Text:
FigJam is solving the problem of communicating about technical system layouts with people who are not accustomed to verbally processing such layouts
FigJam makes creating diagrams and flowcharts very easy In my job I often need visual aids to explain technical systems and I need to create those aids more or less on the fly FigJam has been a lifesaver in that regard
My only complaints about FigJam are very small the biggest of which is that I wish it were simpler to create multiple wire attachment points on one side of a shape using a snaptogrid alignment There are times when I need 4 discrete wires running into one side of a shape and I dont necessarily want them all going to the central point
Summary: Users appreciate Figma's ability to facilitate brainstorming exercises with multiple people in various locations, making the idea-sharing process more fair and democratic. However, they find the UI challenging to navigate and struggle with the zooming and sizing features.

Text: Any want an invite to the browsercompany new browser Arc Have 5 here if anyone was interested to use it
Summary: User is excited about the new browser CO, and is offering 5 invites for anyone interested in using it.

Text:
Miro gives a remote team a place to collaborate that is accessible on any device with internet access It has become as fast as writing notes by hand rather than the sometimes extensive startup required on other platforms Even rudimentary diagrams and sketches are easy to create in realtime There is an opportunity to have asynchronous discourse through the comments
It is extremely intuitive to get started as a new user It has become an essential tool for remote collaboration on my team of primarily visual thinkers It is easy to go from loose sticky note ideas to a full deliverable sketch or even the final deliverable in some cases The tool is so flexible we have had to apply some rigor as a team to use it consistently and get the most out of comments notes etc 
 
I love that the Miro team is always pushing updates and new features I also like the available training tools templates and frequent presentations hosted by Miro that feature Miro employees as well as outside users
The dislikes are more about features I wish were included such as better interoperability between Miro and Excel as well as data visualization capabilities I would like the ability to create vector symbolsshapes and add custom fonts I also wish that there were more features that catered to printed media  such as the ability to create paragraph styles and formatting templates with labels that could be adjusted on an instancebasis but still referred back to a primary layout
Summary: User finds Figjam easy to use and flexible for their needs in aligning key initiatives and brainstorming sessions. However, they face challenges in granting access to others and occasionally experience functionality issues.

Text: Any want an invite to the browsercompany new browser Arc Have 5 here if anyone was interested to use it

During workshops I mainly use it to brainstorm all together or one after the other as a desynchronized tool when we can not meet all together I encourage my team to input their ideas directly into Figjam and collaborate to organize the file as a comprehensive reference document for the future of the project
Figjam is a powerful tool for enhancing collaboration and idea visualization With its realtime collaboration feature and commenting system teamwork becomes effortless The file management system and template library are unparalleled among the competition making it a standout option

They also value the ability to comment on designs and receive feedback quickly. Figma is useful for UI design, prototyping, and testing, with powerful tools and community resources. However, the lack of offline functionality and a potentially steep learning curve for beginners are drawbacks.

Text:
Notion would be amazing if if it was easy to do easy things There is a lot of functionality that would make your life a lot easier What takes away from all of this potential is a buggy and nagging experience trying to input information
Trying to add a todo list checkbox  click the Hamburger menu with your finger iPad list comes up click To Do List menu goes away to do list item doesnt populate Try using touchpad follow the same steps to do list doesnt populate
Create a bullet point and click the hamburger menu change to to do list to do list doesnt populate
You are also able to do slash commands So I press  I see the menu open and it closes immediately The to do list is only an example There are endless nagging bugs like this throughout the experience So instead of being able to use the app to enhance workflows and life in general you are constantly fighting the app
I stopped using Notion for about 8 months and used a number of other products Because of all the data in notion and all of the things I had set up already I came back to because SURELY they had fixed the bugs Its the exact same No more consistent or stable than it was 8 months ago
What is really annoying to me is that they release new features New and shiny things like their AI tool I WOULD RATHER HAVE AN APP THAT WORKS PROPERLY and not have AI I dont care about AI I just want to be able to input data If that works AI would be amazing
It will be long and arduous but im moving to ClickUp
Summary: User finds Notion to be a great app for collaboration and brainstorming, but has experienced numerous bugs and glitches, including issues with adding checkboxes and creating to-do lists. They also mention that the app is slow and buggy, and the AI tool is not useful for their needs.

Text:
Arc browser continuous review
Tldr Im loving it So far its been a fantastic experience Arc brings a lot of fresh air to a place where innovation seemingly stopped
What is Arc Check out browsercompany 
Dive into the thread below  1n
1 Firsttime use experience
Really well done I enjoyed the semiinteractive introlearning experience The keyboard shortcuts were introduced too
Setting up the colour scheme was excellent Straight away you know these guys are trying to do something different 
2 Firsttime use contd
I wish there was a bit more practice your shortcuts the only one that stuck with me was the one I already use elsewhere T
Saying that T execution is excellent and can be used for commands very much like K in other apps
3 Split view
This is my 1 feature so far
It seems to me that the people at browsercompany invested in getting to know users
One would doubt there could be anything left to learn about using a browser in 2023 What customer problems are there left to solve
And still
4 Split view contd
Split view solves a problem many of us have when we attempt to multitask Our current workarounds include constantly rearranging windows  to you BetterSnapTool etc Its chaos
Time will tell if Split view solves this but right now Im thrilled
5 Split view contd
The microinteractions here feel just right Intuitive discoverable The onboarding helped too
6 Profiles
This is a big one for me I struggled with this on Chrome My solution was to strictly use Chrome for work stuff plus Safari for personal use
But obviously that doesnt work well
7 Ecosystem
My incumbent browsers allow me to browse across devices with one app ecosystem I can easily continue on my iPadPro Safari where I left off on my laptop and then seamlessly move to my phone
Arc needs a mobiletablet app
8 Mini Arc
I took the plunge and made Arc my default browser and suddenly links from Slack opened in Mini Arc
Great when I need to quickly check stuff and close the tab But if I need to stay longer in the context I still need to move from the Mini Arc to the full Arc
9 Sidebar
Shifting the tabs from the top bar to a sidebar was smart This suits me for a few reasons
a wide angle screen form factor
b utility of vertical space is better for Spaces history etc all coexisting in one area
10 Sidebar
However my eyes were trained to look for tabs on top of the screen for so long that having them on LHS feels weird This might change after a few more days
Id love the ability to move the sidebar between LHS and RHS depending on when I place Arc on my monitor
11 Ecosystem contd
I expected browsing on Arc wont be seamless across devices wout native iOS apps Turns out the iPadOSMacOS continuity pushes the current tab across devices on the same iCloud account
Not sure about the predictability of this but so far looks good
12 Living with Arc
 cant imagine giving up Spaces
 pinned foldersbookmarks as expected
 keep forgetting to use Favourites
 have a lovehate relationship w links opening in overlay
browsercompany I really want to change icons on pinned folders pretty please
13 The iOS app dropped
Unexpected but pleasant Cant wait to dive in 

Hey browsercompany I need your help
Is there a way to tell apps to open links in a specific space
Eg my Slack always open links in my work spaceprofile
Im logged into two different Google accounts across two spaces
JiriJerabek browsercompany Great question Not right now but this feature for link routing by Space is coming in a couple weeks 
Cant wait to hear what you think
Summary: The user is enjoying the new features in Arc, including the split view, sidebar, and the ability to pin folders. They are also impressed with the iOS app, which allows them to open links in specific spaces. However, they are concerned about the lack of a mobile app and the lack of a way to tell apps to open links in specific spaces.

Text:
It replaced physical whiteboards for discovery and brainstorming sessions It also works as an excellent icebreaker and teambuilding tool to have everyone active during meetings or learning sessions
For those who miss physical whiteboards and postits this is the solution to easily and virtually visualize projects and organize brainstorming project management and workflow visualization Its very friendly intuitive and compatible with other tools
Some toolboxes usually overlap important information and sharing options are not that easy to understand and use mainly with external not frequent users
Summary: Users find Miro to be an effective collaboration tool that helps run meetings smoothly, reduces manual work, and saves costs. They appreciate its user-friendly interface, available templates, sharing capabilities, and affordability. Miro has positively impacted their workplace, and they have no significant dislikes about the tool.

Text:
Collaboration tools are very important in this remote world that were living in FigJam provides our teams with a natural medium to collaborate with We love it for retrospectives group plannings brainstorming etc
FigJam makes it easy to collaborate with a team on a variety of different use cases From whiteboarding to retrospectives to planning meetings to organizing information
Because it is mostly unstructured you or your team is left to decide what structure works best for your use case
Summary: The product is helping the User to quickly analyse large amounts of data, identify correlations and gain new insights, all within a visually appealing format. Users appreciate the product's simplicity and intuitiveness, as well as its unlimited whiteboard space which is great for collaboration, forming new ideas, and making insights. The User finds that the product can become clunky when uploading multiple files, and some PDFs are difficult to read. Additionally, the User has to continually log in to their work account if it has been inactive for a short while.

Text:
Arc browser continuous review
Tldr Im loving it So far its been a fantastic experience Arc brings a lot of fresh air to a place where innovation seemingly stopped
What is Arc Check out browsercompany 
Dive into the thread below  1n
1 Firsttime use experience
Really well done I enjoyed the semiinteractive introlearning experience The keyboard shortcuts were introduced too
Setting up the colour scheme was excellent Straight away you know these guys are trying to do something different 
2 Firsttime use contd
I wish there was a bit more practice your shortcuts the only one that stuck with me was the one I already use elsewhere T
Saying that T execution is excellent and can be used for commands very much like K in other apps
3 Split view
This is my 1 feature so far
It seems to me that the people at browsercompany invested in getting to know users
One would doubt there could be anything left to learn about using a browser in 2023 What customer problems are there left to solve
And still
4 Split view contd
Split view solves a problem many of us have when we attempt to multitask Our current workarounds include constantly rearranging windows  to you BetterSnapTool etc Its chaos
Time will tell if Split view solves this but right now Im thrilled
5 Split view contd
The microinteractions here feel just right Intuitive discoverable The onboarding helped too
6 Profiles
This is a big one for me I struggled with this on Chrome My solution was to strictly use Chrome for work stuff plus Safari for personal use
But obviously that doesnt work well
7 Ecosystem
My incumbent browsers allow me to browse across devices with one app ecosystem I can easily continue on my iPadPro Safari where I left off on my laptop and then seamlessly move to my phone
Arc needs a mobiletablet app
8 Mini Arc
I took the plunge and made Arc my default browser and suddenly links from Slack opened in Mini Arc
Great when I need to quickly check stuff and close the tab But if I need to stay longer in the context I still need to move from the Mini Arc to the full Arc
9 Sidebar
Shifting the tabs from the top bar to a sidebar was smart This suits me for a few reasons
a wide angle screen form factor
b utility of vertical space is better for Spaces history etc all coexisting in one area
10 Sidebar
However my eyes were trained to look for tabs on top of the screen for so long that having them on LHS feels weird This might change after a few more days
Id love the ability to move the sidebar between LHS and RHS depending on when I place Arc on my monitor
11 Ecosystem contd
I expected browsing on Arc wont be seamless across devices wout native iOS apps Turns out the iPadOSMacOS continuity pushes the current tab across devices on the same iCloud account
Not sure about the predictability of this but so far looks good
12 Living with Arc
 cant imagine giving up Spaces
 pinned foldersbookmarks as expected
 keep forgetting to use Favourites
 have a lovehate relationship w links opening in overlay
browsercompany I really want to change icons on pinned folders pretty please
13 The iOS app dropped
Unexpected but pleasant Cant wait to dive in 

Hey browsercompany I need your help
Is there a way to tell apps to open links in a specific space
Eg my Slack always open links in my work spaceprofile
Im logged into two different Google accounts across two spaces
JiriJerabek browsercompany Great question Not right now but this feature for link routing by Space is coming in a couple weeks 
Cant wait to hear what you think
Summary: The user is enjoying the new features in Arc, including the split view, sidebar, and the ability to pin folders. They are also impressed with the iOS app, which allows them to open links in specific spaces. However, they are concerned about the lack of a mobile app and the lack of a way to tell apps to open links in specific spaces.

Users also value the ongoing updates that improve usability, performance, and speed, but suggest additional customization options, such as background colors and styles.

Summary: The product is helping users by providing easier collaboration for remote teams, as well as giving them oversight on work and the ability to document in a single location, which increases visibility and engagement amongst team members. Users appreciate the product's oversight for projects, its intuitive design, and its ability to integrate other apps and features. Users experience fatigue when zooming in and out, and find it difficult to create visuals and diagrams that are interactive. They also find it difficult to copy and paste elements from other sources into Miro, and wish they could consolidate their personal and work accounts.

Our iOS developers rely on PDF export in order to grab assets for mobile development Without being able to export PDF from slices it requires additional and tedious workarounds for how to export assets
Id like to request PDF export from slices
Its really a heartbreaker that exporting the slices to pdf is not available in Figma Sketch has it and it was working really great for us
Some of our multinational stakeholders whom we cannot insist to install or start an account for Figma or anything else as they rely on pdf documents for design review or sharing with internal team Sketch helped to convert the slices to pdf which was very light weight and compressible When we moved to figma the internal team as well few clients worked well with figma collaboration same we did with Sketch too and but the later ones didnt And now we are forced to go back to Sketch as we understand that its the app that we could rely to accomplish all our requirements
Thanks for the feedback Weve merged your topic with an existing feature request so we can measure interest from the community
Summary: User suggests combining Design and FigJam features in one page to create a flow and add comments, making it more helpful for developers.

Text:
This is my 1 choice of tool when collaborating with clients My team uses Miro to document a strategy or wireframe and collect client feedback in realtime it helps ensure the client that we are listening to their wants and needs Instead of using a static PPT where we are just jotting down the notes clients can see the work in action In addition we use the Miro board to document processes and attach key artifacts and URLS This process documentation is exhaustive but Miro allows users to zoom in and out from a micromacro view to learn about the process which is great for leadership to see and great for onboarding It especially works for a global remote company where we can all jump in to review no matter the time zone If you are in the same time zone it works great to get everyone in the room and use as a collaboration tool For example Im located in California and my client is located in the UK We use miro to make updates on our timezone and get very detailed in specific areas of question It allows for transparency review and collaboration
In general I like the whiteboarding and mapping capabilities that allow for deep thought process documentation and pure collaboration with teams It allows me to jot my rough thoughts on paper where I then can find patterns and create a more solid process Miro is the perfect think tank environment that you use from start ideation to a finish a solid concept Its also great for inviting colleagues for feedback or collaboration Anyone can use it with a free license
Miroboards have a size capacity where if you add too many screenshots it starts to slow down It can also get extremely messy and often confusing for a new user coming in and unsure where to start Sometimes if you start your miroboard too big the details of things like adding arrow connectors can be really tiny Causing me to selecting all and sizing down my space so you can see these details I sometimes run into issues with font formatting if I copied and pasted a highlighted text in bold and then I drag in the text widget it will copy what Ive used when that is not my intention Its really just the small details that I wish were fixed that could make my experience more easier
Summary: The user appreciates Figma's ease in creating whiteboards for moodboards and presentations but finds it challenging to locate options for adding links or importing images and creating clipping masks.

Text:
1 It would be easier for all native Spanish speakers to use and understand By having the interface and content in our native language it would be easier for us to understand the application and use all its functions correctly
2 It would increase our efficiency at work By not having to constantly translate terms and concepts into Spanish it would save us time and allow us to be more efficient at work
3 We would feel more comfortable If Spanish is our main language it would be more comfortable for us to use the application in our native language
4 It would allow us to learn new technical and business terms in Spanish Using Notion in Spanish would allow us to learn new technical and business terms in our language which can be especially useful if we are working in a Spanishspeaking business environment
5 It would make us feel included and valued By having the option to use Notion in Spanish we feel included and valued as users of the application which would increase our satisfaction and loyalty to it
Summary: User suggests adding Spanish language support to Notion, as it would be easier for Spanish-speaking users to use and understand, increase efficiency at work, and make them feel more comfortable. They also suggest learning new technical and business terms in Spanish, which would be useful in a Spanish-speaking business environment.

Hi Im new to Figma and im currently struggling with this trouble
So Im trying to recreate the wwwpandaexpresscom website and im with the banner part
 
 
 
 
 
My steps are
Create the base structure
Group it
Duplicate it
Adjust the circle and image for second asset
Make it interactive from prototype tab
Create a component set
On the Design Frame i add the component and it went crazy with the line that dragged into the previous asset frame And when i present it none of my clicks works with the banner Ive cross checked the prototyped and Ive selected the on click
Can anyone please correct me on which step did I do wrong
Thankyou

Text:
The ability to quickly collaborate on user flows and audit our product with nondesigners has been made super quick with the use of FigJam We are also utilizing FigJam for sprint retros which allows other roles to become power users of FigJam benefitting our team using the tool for different purposes and not having another learning curve
I like the speed at which I can collaborate with my teammates for a variety of topics I spend most of my time using the timer for timebox ceratin conversations around audit and design decisions which we use FigJam for Additionally creating user flows within FigJam has been tremendously helpful
Currently while components are available within FigJam there isnt an easy way to visibly pull in the components without copying them over from a design file Additionally if I want to scale components Ive copied into a FigJam they can not be manipulated and thus I spend more time jumping back and forth through files rather than having a focused conversation around reviewfeedback within FigJam
Summary: The user finds Figma relatively user-friendly with a manageable learning curve and appreciates its ability to visually show ideas and thought processes using various mapping tools. However, they find it lacking in aligning formats for creating visually appealing or structured pictures and graphs, requiring manual adjustments.

Hi I believe Ive exhausted all the existing help articles on this
Im having a hard time with something that should be very basic I have 25 or so screens the ONLY interaction between them is that the user should be able to click andor press the arrow key to navigate LINEARLY between them
Sometimes it works especially if I go slowly it works every time But sometimes it doesnt sometimes it inexplicably jumps through sections pretty much only happens if I press the arrow keys quickly It appears that if I click through it goes linearly every time without skipping screens So the problem is only with the arrow keys which I cant disable so I need to understand the behavior before handing off to my client
Ive adjusted all the artboards The desired order is Row 1 Left to Right Row 2 Left to Right as described in the documentation All rows have the exact same Y coordinate All columns have the exact same X coordinate
Ive spent hours on this already and this is really basic behavior so Im not sure why its so hard I want it to act like powerpoint in presentation mode
Any help is appreciated I cant really share the prototype because Im on NDA
Or up vote the solution here
 
 
 
 Remove auto creating flow starting points Share an idea

Text:
Hi
Today during UI class I have discovered an annyoing behavior I tried to create a simple product card with a picture and a Special offer label placed inside the picture
In order to reproduce the issue
Step 1 Create a text field turn it into Auto Layout and give it a fill color just to create a label basically like FLASH SALE etc
Step 2 Add a rectangle and fill it with an image
Step 3 Turn both into an AutoLayout frame and try to adjust the label and the image so that the label sits inside While doing so you shall discover that the image covers the label and hides it even when the label layer is above the image
Despite that when merging a text and an image into AutoLayout and only then turning the text to AutoLayout as well to give if a fill color  this method works perfectly fine but at last both methods shall lead to the same result as far as I am concerned so there might be a bug here Or is it
Thanks
Summary: User faced an issue with a button not working after making changes in the preview. They provided a link to the issue and requested assistance.

Text:
I use scale tool K key to scale design for mobile version
When I literally click the instance of the nested scaled component it discards the scale and reverts the instance to the original size
CMD  Z doesnt change it back to the scaled version and the layout stays broken So I have to use version history to revert everything back or as a work around I change size of the original component and it magically rerender the scaled instance and reverts it back until the next interaction
How to stop Figma from this behavior
Summary: Users discuss the issue of autolayout frames in Figma defaulting to 10px padding, which is not suitable for all design systems. They suggest solutions like basing default padding on the big nudge amount in settings, allowing tokenization of padding/margin grids, and using alternative key commands for 0px padding. Some users share their methods for applying auto layout with 0 padding quickly.

Text: I have been using notion for the past two years and it is really helpful I started using it to organise notes for uni and keep track of my assignments Initially it is a bit difficult to navigate the service but the more you use it the more efficient you become You can borrow free templates online if creating your own is difficult I use notion to track almost everything and even without upgradation the app works reasonably well you can access the basic things which for a beginner is good enough Once i figure out how to create templates and deal with the more complex blocks they offer I will definitely be upgrading to the plus ver
Summary: User has been using Notion for two years and finds it helpful for organizing notes for university and keeping track of assignments. Initially, it is difficult to navigate the service, but with practice, it becomes more efficient. The user appreciates the free templates available online and finds the basic features sufficient for a beginner.

Text:
Arc browser continuous review
Tldr Im loving it So far its been a fantastic experience Arc brings a lot of fresh air to a place where innovation seemingly stopped
What is Arc Check out browsercompany 
Dive into the thread below  1n
1 Firsttime use experience
Really well done I enjoyed the semiinteractive introlearning experience The keyboard shortcuts were introduced too
Setting up the colour scheme was excellent Straight away you know these guys are trying to do something different 
2 Firsttime use contd
I wish there was a bit more practice your shortcuts the only one that stuck with me was the one I already use elsewhere T
Saying that T execution is excellent and can be used for commands very much like K in other apps
3 Split view
This is my 1 feature so far
It seems to me that the people at browsercompany invested in getting to know users
One would doubt there could be anything left to learn about using a browser in 2023 What customer problems are there left to solve
And still
4 Split view contd
Split view solves a problem many of us have when we attempt to multitask Our current workarounds include constantly rearranging windows  to you BetterSnapTool etc Its chaos
Time will tell if Split view solves this but right now Im thrilled
5 Split view contd
The microinteractions here feel just right Intuitive discoverable The onboarding helped too
6 Profiles
This is a big one for me I struggled with this on Chrome My solution was to strictly use Chrome for work stuff plus Safari for personal use
But obviously that doesnt work well
7 Ecosystem
My incumbent browsers allow me to browse across devices with one app ecosystem I can easily continue on my iPadPro Safari where I left off on my laptop and then seamlessly move to my phone
Arc needs a mobiletablet app
8 Mini Arc
I took the plunge and made Arc my default browser and suddenly links from Slack opened in Mini Arc
Great when I need to quickly check stuff and close the tab But if I need to stay longer in the context I still need to move from the Mini Arc to the full Arc
9 Sidebar
Shifting the tabs from the top bar to a sidebar was smart This suits me for a few reasons
a wide angle screen form factor
b utility of vertical space is better for Spaces history etc all coexisting in one area
10 Sidebar
However my eyes were trained to look for tabs on top of the screen for so long that having them on LHS feels weird This might change after a few more days
Id love the ability to move the sidebar between LHS and RHS depending on when I place Arc on my monitor
11 Ecosystem contd
I expected browsing on Arc wont be seamless across devices wout native iOS apps Turns out the iPadOSMacOS continuity pushes the current tab across devices on the same iCloud account
Not sure about the predictability of this but so far looks good
12 Living with Arc
 cant imagine giving up Spaces
 pinned foldersbookmarks as expected
 keep forgetting to use Favourites
 have a lovehate relationship w links opening in overlay
browsercompany I really want to change icons on pinned folders pretty please
13 The iOS app dropped
Unexpected but pleasant Cant wait to dive in 

Hey browsercompany I need your help
Is there a way to tell apps to open links in a specific space
Eg my Slack always open links in my work spaceprofile
Im logged into two different Google accounts across two spaces
JiriJerabek browsercompany Great question Not right now but this feature for link routing by Space is coming in a couple weeks 
Cant wait to hear what you think
Summary: The user is enjoying the new features in Arc, including the split view, sidebar, and the ability to pin folders. They are also impressed with the iOS app, which allows them to open links in specific spaces. However, they are concerned about the lack of a mobile app and the lack of a way to tell apps to open links in specific spaces.

They enjoy the ease of use, interactivity, and templates compared to PowerPoint. However, some users find certain tools, like frames and form manipulation, complex and challenging to use. Additionally, they experience occasional slow loading times, but the cause is unclear.

Text:
Arc browser continuous review
Tldr Im loving it So far its been a fantastic experience Arc brings a lot of fresh air to a place where innovation seemingly stopped
What is Arc Check out browsercompany 
Dive into the thread below  1n
1 Firsttime use experience
Really well done I enjoyed the semiinteractive introlearning experience The keyboard shortcuts were introduced too
Setting up the colour scheme was excellent Straight away you know these guys are trying to do something different 
2 Firsttime use contd
I wish there was a bit more practice your shortcuts the only one that stuck with me was the one I already use elsewhere T
Saying that T execution is excellent and can be used for commands very much like K in other apps
3 Split view
This is my 1 feature so far
It seems to me that the people at browsercompany invested in getting to know users
One would doubt there could be anything left to learn about using a browser in 2023 What customer problems are there left to solve
And still
4 Split view contd
Split view solves a problem many of us have when we attempt to multitask Our current workarounds include constantly rearranging windows  to you BetterSnapTool etc Its chaos
Time will tell if Split view solves this but right now Im thrilled
5 Split view contd
The microinteractions here feel just right Intuitive discoverable The onboarding helped too
6 Profiles
This is a big one for me I struggled with this on Chrome My solution was to strictly use Chrome for work stuff plus Safari for personal use
But obviously that doesnt work well
7 Ecosystem
My incumbent browsers allow me to browse across devices with one app ecosystem I can easily continue on my iPadPro Safari where I left off on my laptop and then seamlessly move to my phone
Arc needs a mobiletablet app
8 Mini Arc
I took the plunge and made Arc my default browser and suddenly links from Slack opened in Mini Arc
Great when I need to quickly check stuff and close the tab But if I need to stay longer in the context I still need to move from the Mini Arc to the full Arc
9 Sidebar
Shifting the tabs from the top bar to a sidebar was smart This suits me for a few reasons
a wide angle screen form factor
b utility of vertical space is better for Spaces history etc all coexisting in one area
10 Sidebar
However my eyes were trained to look for tabs on top of the screen for so long that having them on LHS feels weird This might change after a few more days
Id love the ability to move the sidebar between LHS and RHS depending on when I place Arc on my monitor
11 Ecosystem contd
I expected browsing on Arc wont be seamless across devices wout native iOS apps Turns out the iPadOSMacOS continuity pushes the current tab across devices on the same iCloud account
Not sure about the predictability of this but so far looks good
12 Living with Arc
 cant imagine giving up Spaces
 pinned foldersbookmarks as expected
 keep forgetting to use Favourites
 have a lovehate relationship w links opening in overlay
browsercompany I really want to change icons on pinned folders pretty please
13 The iOS app dropped
Unexpected but pleasant Cant wait to dive in 

Hey browsercompany I need your help
Is there a way to tell apps to open links in a specific space
Eg my Slack always open links in my work spaceprofile
Im logged into two different Google accounts across two spaces
JiriJerabek browsercompany Great question Not right now but this feature for link routing by Space is coming in a couple weeks 
Cant wait to hear what you think
Summary: The user is enjoying the new features in Arc, including the split view, sidebar, and the ability to pin folders. They are also impressed with the iOS app, which allows them to open links in specific spaces. However, they are concerned about the lack of a mobile app and the lack of a way to tell apps to open links in specific spaces.

Text:
Im not a big planner to begin with probably due to my lack of enjoyment for more mainstream planners like Google calendar and traditional paper planners Google while claiming to be userfriendly had too many tools and GUIs to navigate through which felt overwhelming to me while still lacking the flexibility I desired Paper planners I encountered in the store didnt do the job either because they were not formatted exactly how I wanted and of course a regular old notebook didnt provide the online accessibility I wanted
Notion is everything you wanted in a planner and truly helped bring the planning side of me back to reality It provided helpful templates I could use to give an overall format for what I wanted to write checklists boxes etc which were incredibly customizable The tool is simple yet powerful without any unnecessary visual effects or special features you are forced to learn I love that Notion can be accessed on any device via the website or app and my plans look the exact same in any format without shifting its orientation or completely uphauling the website layout I would recommend this to anyone
Summary: User finds Notion helpful for organizing their daily tasks and planning their week, as it provides templates and customizable tools for organizing their tasks. They appreciate the flexibility and ease of use, and find it helpful for their daily tasks.

Text:
Miro allows multiple users to simultaneously share ideas as visuals within the same space without disruption This feature makes it very helpful for any roadmap planning session A team can always return to a Miro board after to recap what has been shared or continue the work

Text: I have been using notion for the past two years and it is really helpful I started using it to organise notes for uni and keep track of my assignments Initially it is a bit difficult to navigate the service but the more you use it the more efficient you become You can borrow free templates online if creating your own is difficult I use notion to track almost everything and even without upgradation the app works reasonably well you can access the basic things which for a beginner is good enough Once i figure out how to create templates and deal with the more complex blocks they offer I will definitely be upgrading to the plus ver
Summary: User has been using Notion for two years and finds it helpful for organizing notes for university and keeping track of assignments. Initially, it is difficult to navigate the service, but with practice, it becomes more efficient. The user appreciates the free templates available online and finds the basic features sufficient for a beginner.

Text:
Announcements in the world of AI today
Anthropic expands Claudes context window to 100000
Stability AIs new texttoanimation tool
Meta introduces the AI sandbox
Airtable unveils Airtable AI
Heres the rundown on everything you need to know
1 Anthropic revolutionizes Claude AI
Anthropic is boosting Claude their AI model by expanding its context window from a mere 9000 tokens to a whopping 100000 tokens
Claude can now analyze and interpret not just a few pages but hundreds 
The model could digest and analyze the entire text of The Great Gatsby in less than a minute 
This puts OpenAIs GPT4 and its 32k context window currently in beta in the dust 
2 Stability AIs texttoanimation tool
Stability AI just unveiled a powerful texttoanimation tool called Stable Animation SDK
Users can generate animations from text images or video combined with text 
3 Meta unveils generative AI for advertisers
Meta just introduced the AI Sandbox a playground for advertisers to try new generative AIpowered ad tools 
badimon photoroom_app figma Have you approached Meta

Text:
Helps to visually explain complex systems in a simple way Provides value to our consultancy
FigJams simplicity and ease of use enables fast mapping and sharing of complex systems and dependencies Ive recently created several sprawling figjam charts that outline marketing programs from beginning to end for our clients They have been so helpful keeping the team informed at a high level and are a great reference to regularly huddle around 
 
This is just one kind of use  because of its flexibility you can begin to discover ways to think and present ideas large or small Create fast design mockups review and provide feedback on designs create storyboards  the list can go on and on Easily shareable to anyone with little to no trouble with login attempts or dealing with incompatible file types 
 
It feels so freeing to break from the clunky confines of a ppt slide with its bad clip art and boring bullet points Expanding across an endless canvas allows us to combat any confusion or anxiety that tends to show up around building complex marketing campaigns 
 
Figjam has become one the most valuable tools in my arsenal and is one of the best Ive seen after almost 2 decades of working with these types of apps 
 
Highly recommended
Cant think of any at the moment I need to spend more time exploring all the templates to expand my usage
Summary: Users find Figma easy to use for collaboration between design and development teams, and appreciate its features for creating design systems, libraries, and reusable projects. They suggest adding tutorials and help guidelines for further assistance.

Text:
With Miro we can now use one system with endless space to build upon We dont run into space issues anymore and everyone can easily access and edit it whereas before that was more difficult
I am a merchant who uses Miro to collaborate with design when building our seasonal assortment I love how intuitive and visual it is
It has difficulty loading once the boards are built I create and build on lots of boards but it needs to be able to withstand lots of boards and images to be a collaborative visual platform
Summary: The user finds Miro excellent for facilitating collaboration during workshops and team-based activities, praising its real-time collaboration capabilities, wide range of tools and templates, and rich media integration. However, they experience performance issues with large boards or many simultaneous users and feel that customization options can be restrictive.

Text: I really think this app is great for everything The only problem I have is when you have too many workspaces then you have to pay up
Summary: User finds the app great for organizing their work, but mentions the need to pay for additional workspaces if they have too many open.

Text:
It has provided a platform for us to collaborate and convey our ideas more creatively from a productive perspective it saves teams time as people can continually chime in and add to a board at any point during their day we dont all have to be present or working on it together for it to work
I like the group collaboration features I think it is fantastic how everyone can get into working on an idea all at once being a visual tool also helps I think its great
If I were to mention something it would be getting used to moving around the boards its a slightly different mindset its not a showstopper but a slight twist
Summary: Users find Miro to be a collaborative and user-friendly tool with helpful templates and community support. However, they face challenges in locating work on the canvas due to varying zoom levels and placement by team members. They suggest marking the center of the canvas and starting at 100% zoom for consistency.

Text:
FigJam has helped solve the problem of realtime collaboration with my team in a virtual setting
What is most helpful with FigJam is the ability to layout work in a whiteboard style and make editscomments with your team in realtime
What can sometimes be an issue with FigJam is that the designs can be more limited on FigJam vs Figma
Summary: Users appreciate Miro for collaboration and personal project planning, as it consolidates multiple tools into one platform. However, finding the right template can be challenging, requiring users to try multiple options before settling on one.

Text:
We needed a tool to effectively whiteboard remotely and to retain the information in an easily accessible channel
Miro has replaced our inperson whiteboarding sessions with easytouse options for our marketing teams Nontechnical users pick up on the postit style boards super quick allowing what used to be meetings in the office to be very productive regardless of where our staff is located
For new users Miro can be overwhelming at first Otherwise its been hard to think of anything that jumps out as needing improvement
Summary: Users appreciate Miro for its usability, flexibility, and powerful tools like sticky notes, mapping, and brainstorming. It is suitable for remote teams and supports multiple devices. However, some users face challenges with navigation, particularly when zooming in and out or browsing boards with a lot of content.

Text:
Think its impossible to create a successful solo business without coding and an audience Think again I did it and heres how I did it to earn my first dollars here  a gift is waiting for you in the last tweet 
Before we begin
When I won 2500 here
 I had an audience of 500 followers
 I didnt know how to code
 I didnt know anything about Twitter
I did
So did you
Now heres how I did it 
 First you need a brilliant idea It doesnt have to be groundbreaking just something youre passionate about Remember youre building this solo so youll need that passion to fuel your journey
 Once you have your idea its time to build without coding I used webflow to create my website and app without any coding knowledge Its incredibly userfriendly with a plethora of customizable templates to suit your business
webflow  Organize your thoughts and plan your content using NotionHQ As a solopreneur I found this to be the perfect tool for managing my tasks jotting down ideas and creating content outlines Plus its super easy to use
webflow NotionHQ  Find your niche and target audience You dont need a massive audience to succeedjust a group of dedicated engaged followers who love your work Focus on connecting with them and providing value
webflow NotionHQ  Share your work and gather feedback Join communities like IndieHackers ProductHunt and relevant Facebook groups to find likeminded people who can give you insights and encouragement
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Set up a business model that works for you From subscriptions and memberships to onetime purchases find a revenue stream that fits your goals and caters to your audiences needs
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Educate yourself Attend webinars read articles and listen to podcasts to stay uptodate with the latest trends and strategies You dont need a formal education to succeed just a curious mind
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Iterate improve and grow Be open to change and adapt to your audiences needs Remember building a business is an ongoing process and theres always room for improvement
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Track your progress and celebrate your wins Set measurable goals analyze your metrics and appreciate your achievements This is your journey and every small victory matters
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Believe in yourself and your idea As a solopreneur selfconfidence is crucial Keep pushing forward even when things get tough Youve got this
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Found this thread helpful Share it with fellow indie makers and solopreneurs who could use these tips Lets support each other on our solo business journeys

1 Firsttime use experience
Really well done I enjoyed the semiinteractive introlearning experience The keyboard shortcuts were introduced too
Setting up the colour scheme was excellent Straight away you know these guys are trying to do something different 
2 Firsttime use contd
I wish there was a bit more practice your shortcuts the only one that stuck with me was the one I already use elsewhere T
Saying that T execution is excellent and can be used for commands very much like K in other apps
3 Split view
This is my 1 feature so far
It seems to me that the people at browsercompany invested in getting to know users
One would doubt there could be anything left to learn about using a browser in 2023 What customer problems are there left to solve
And still
4 Split view contd
Split view solves a problem many of us have when we attempt to multitask Our current workarounds include constantly rearranging windows  to you BetterSnapTool etc Its chaos
Time will tell if Split view solves this but right now Im thrilled
5 Split view contd
The microinteractions here feel just right Intuitive discoverable The onboarding helped too
6 Profiles
This is a big one for me I struggled with this on Chrome My solution was to strictly use Chrome for work stuff plus Safari for personal use
But obviously that doesnt work well
7 Ecosystem
My incumbent browsers allow me to browse across devices with one app ecosystem I can easily continue on my iPadPro Safari where I left off on my laptop and then seamlessly move to my phone
Arc needs a mobiletablet app
8 Mini Arc
I took the plunge and made Arc my default browser and suddenly links from Slack opened in Mini Arc
Great when I need to quickly check stuff and close the tab But if I need to stay longer in the context I still need to move from the Mini Arc to the full Arc
9 Sidebar
Shifting the tabs from the top bar to a sidebar was smart This suits me for a few reasons
a wide angle screen form factor
b utility of vertical space is better for Spaces history etc all coexisting in one area
10 Sidebar
However my eyes were trained to look for tabs on top of the screen for so long that having them on LHS feels weird This might change after a few more days
Id love the ability to move the sidebar between LHS and RHS depending on when I place Arc on my monitor
11 Ecosystem contd
I expected browsing on Arc wont be seamless across devices wout native iOS apps Turns out the iPadOSMacOS continuity pushes the current tab across devices on the same iCloud account
Not sure about the predictability of this but so far looks good
12 Living with Arc
 cant imagine giving up Spaces
 pinned foldersbookmarks as expected
 keep forgetting to use Favourites
 have a lovehate relationship w links opening in overlay
browsercompany I really want to change icons on pinned folders pretty please
13 The iOS app dropped
Unexpected but pleasant Cant wait to dive in 

Hey browsercompany I need your help
Is there a way to tell apps to open links in a specific space
Eg my Slack always open links in my work spaceprofile
Im logged into two different Google accounts across two spaces
Summary: The user is enjoying the Arc browser and appreciates the new features, but is experiencing some lag when using it. They are also concerned about the lack of a mobile app and the lack of a desktop app for Windows. The user is also concerned about the lack of a desktop app for Windows and the lack of a mobile app for iOS.

Text:
Everyone Use googledocs its simple  No use evernote and NotionHQ its shared  No do RoamResearch its serious  No use Apple Notes and Google Keep
Me They ALL run INSIDE my obsdmd  
Be a rebel  
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd Obsidian is built on a technology called Electron
Electron is just a Chrome browser that runs like an app on your desktop
So essentially Obsidian  Snazzy Browser for your notes
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd This allows us  in theory  to browse any website
In practice it works 80 of the time hence I couldnt get it to work with tana_inc or logseq 
While Obsidian does not support that out of the box  with a plugin its easy Lets get to it
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq Go to Settings gt Community Plugins Search for Custom Frames
Install it 
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq In the Obsidian settings there will be now a new entry Custom Frames towards end of your list
Find the New Frame button and click it A Frame is such a browser window that we can use to access all of the services
The new entry will appear in the list above the button 
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq Configure your Frame
1 Set the URL   or   copy amp paste from Browser
2  open in center to open the service like a tab otherwise its in the sidebar
3  Add Ribbon Icon to display a side icon 
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq Specify the icon you want to use
Go to  and find an icon you like
Copy paste its name into the icon textfield in previous step 
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq RESTART OBSIDIAN
Your new ribbon icon should now appear on the left
You will have to log in to GoogleAppleEvernote the first time But then it will remember you Just like in a browser
On the top right you find a few buttons to reload the page 
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq Summary
 Download Custom Frames plugin
 Add frames to any website as Obsidian is technically a browser
 This technique works with ANY website So you can integrate google calendar facebook or a todo app into obsidian
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq Obsidian is THE notetaking app to rule them all I focus on helping Academics amp Knowledge Workers to leverage its capacities to the max If you want to propel your academic career join my seminar this week and become an Effortless Academic

Artifexx googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq SaveToNotion Thread Study
Summary: The user is excited about the new features in Obsidian, including the ability to add custom frames and customize the ribbon icon. They are also excited about the new features in the Notion app, including the ability to add custom frames and customize the ribbon icon.

Text:
Were working on a larger Component library that includes nonpublished components components with the prefix _ or  as base components in order to simplify large complex components We intended  in some specific cases  to offer regular components as templates that a designer would then have to detach and work with a bunch of base components to build the desired design
What we have come to realize with this approach however is that these nonpublished components dont receive updates from the library when they are updated in the main library
Is this intended behaviour
We basically have the option to simply publish these base components as regular components but that of course would mean cluttering up the assets overview with a bunch of modular components
hi Raphael our team is also facing the same issue for a while Have you or your team figured out the workaround for this issue I wish Figma can solve this issue fundamentally Josh thank you
Summary: User experienced issues with a button they created in class, where the color in the preview changed, but the button didn't work in the final product. They are seeking help to resolve the issue.

Text:
I really enjoy using notion for note taking and syncing between devices works flawlessly Also lots of options to structure your notes embed different components create small databases for recipies and such etc
There are a few flaws though there is no offline mode the AI features that I dont use cannot be deactivated is is not as fast as a native app like apple notessimplenoteetc there is no real pensupport for drawing and sketching the app logs me out frequently and that feeling of having too many eggs in one basket
One improvement that would be great on iOS when I share a youtube video to a notion database via share sheet the URL is the title It would be great if the title was the video title and the URL was an embedded video in the content Adding Tags when sharing would also be helpful
Summary: User enjoys using Notion for note-taking and syncing between devices, but has issues with the lack of offline mode, AI features not being deactivated, and the app logging them out frequently. They suggest adding offline mode, pen support for drawing and sketching, and a better sharing experience for iOS users.
