Text: Dont subscribe through an in app purchase Their product naming is misleading The Personal Pro is their free offering with limited ai requests 20 but through an in app purchase they will gladly sell you the same product for a 47 annual subscription Just like the free product it stops working at 20 ai requests Id say that this product without the ai feature is crap You can do better with any number of free products on the market Google docs etc And the product without the ai is free anyways so why offer an upgrade link when all you are doing is paying for something they offer for free Im angry but glad I subscribed through Apple there is a chance I can get a refund The ai is pretty good but I am wary at the shady deal they tried to pull over me Who know who else made the same mistake
Summary: User is unhappy with the product name and misleading subscription pricing, as the free version is limited to 20 requests and stops working after 20. They also mention that the ai feature is not as good as other free products, and the upgrade link is misleading. They are considering a refund and are wary of other users making the same mistake.

Text:
I use it for several things private documents to guide my thinking and notes collaborative whiteboards sharing diagrams with colleagues and documentation
As far as Im aware Miro is unique in its ability to enable a user to rapidly build diagrams in realtime while other users observe or contribute simultaneously I can create flow charts and diagrams so quickly And its easy to make the results look great
The tables feature is lackluster but its still an experiment Other than that the licensing model has been slightly annoying to deal with If I want a colleague to contribute to a board they need a full license even if they use it for 30 minutes and never use it again This arrangement doesnt feel optimal from a fairness and value pointofview but I still find the tool to be worth the money
Summary: The user finds Figma helpful for designing and creating diagrams, making requirements easily understandable for developers and testers. However, they face an issue with different UI versions getting minimized and reflecting other versions when maximized.

Text:
Think its impossible to create a successful solo business without coding and an audience Think again I did it and heres how I did it to earn my first dollars here  a gift is waiting for you in the last tweet 
Before we begin
When I won 2500 here
 I had an audience of 500 followers
 I didnt know how to code
 I didnt know anything about Twitter
I did
So did you
Now heres how I did it 
 First you need a brilliant idea It doesnt have to be groundbreaking just something youre passionate about Remember youre building this solo so youll need that passion to fuel your journey
 Once you have your idea its time to build without coding I used webflow to create my website and app without any coding knowledge Its incredibly userfriendly with a plethora of customizable templates to suit your business
webflow  Organize your thoughts and plan your content using NotionHQ As a solopreneur I found this to be the perfect tool for managing my tasks jotting down ideas and creating content outlines Plus its super easy to use
webflow NotionHQ  Find your niche and target audience You dont need a massive audience to succeedjust a group of dedicated engaged followers who love your work Focus on connecting with them and providing value
webflow NotionHQ  Share your work and gather feedback Join communities like IndieHackers ProductHunt and relevant Facebook groups to find likeminded people who can give you insights and encouragement
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Set up a business model that works for you From subscriptions and memberships to onetime purchases find a revenue stream that fits your goals and caters to your audiences needs
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Educate yourself Attend webinars read articles and listen to podcasts to stay uptodate with the latest trends and strategies You dont need a formal education to succeed just a curious mind
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Iterate improve and grow Be open to change and adapt to your audiences needs Remember building a business is an ongoing process and theres always room for improvement
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Track your progress and celebrate your wins Set measurable goals analyze your metrics and appreciate your achievements This is your journey and every small victory matters
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Believe in yourself and your idea As a solopreneur selfconfidence is crucial Keep pushing forward even when things get tough Youve got this
Summary: The user is a freelance writer and has been using Notion for a year. They are currently working on a book and are looking for a publisher. They are also looking for a design team to work with on their book cover.

Text:
Sharing ideas knowlede and developing solutions  mostly interactivelty and with collaboration
Easy to use intuitive diagramming which covers most business scenarios you could wish for  Really easy to work collaboratively and simultaneously
Not much  sharing is a bit confusing at times but other than than cant think of anything significant
Summary: User is benefiting from Miro's range of templates, diagrams, and sticky notes which make it easy to share complex ideas visually, resulting in improved collaboration and a more efficient workflow. The User finds Miro to be an incredibly powerful tool for collaborating with teams, due to its easy-to-use interface and real-time collaboration features. Additionally, the platform's extensive range of features are highly customizable, allowing for greater flexibility when working on projects. Users may find the pricing structure of Miro to be expensive for smaller teams or individuals, and the extensive range of features can be overwhelming for new users. However, Miro provides helpful support resources such as video tutorials and a user community to help users get up to speed quickly.

Text:
Arc browser continuous review
Tldr Im loving it So far its been a fantastic experience Arc brings a lot of fresh air to a place where innovation seemingly stopped
What is Arc Check out browsercompany 
Dive into the thread below  1n
1 Firsttime use experience
Really well done I enjoyed the semiinteractive introlearning experience The keyboard shortcuts were introduced too
Setting up the colour scheme was excellent Straight away you know these guys are trying to do something different 
2 Firsttime use contd
I wish there was a bit more practice your shortcuts the only one that stuck with me was the one I already use elsewhere T
Saying that T execution is excellent and can be used for commands very much like K in other apps
3 Split view
This is my 1 feature so far
It seems to me that the people at browsercompany invested in getting to know users
One would doubt there could be anything left to learn about using a browser in 2023 What customer problems are there left to solve
And still
4 Split view contd
Split view solves a problem many of us have when we attempt to multitask Our current workarounds include constantly rearranging windows  to you BetterSnapTool etc Its chaos
Time will tell if Split view solves this but right now Im thrilled
5 Split view contd
The microinteractions here feel just right Intuitive discoverable The onboarding helped too
6 Profiles
This is a big one for me I struggled with this on Chrome My solution was to strictly use Chrome for work stuff plus Safari for personal use
But obviously that doesnt work well
7 Ecosystem
My incumbent browsers allow me to browse across devices with one app ecosystem I can easily continue on my iPadPro Safari where I left off on my laptop and then seamlessly move to my phone
Arc needs a mobiletablet app
8 Mini Arc
I took the plunge and made Arc my default browser and suddenly links from Slack opened in Mini Arc
Great when I need to quickly check stuff and close the tab But if I need to stay longer in the context I still need to move from the Mini Arc to the full Arc
9 Sidebar
Shifting the tabs from the top bar to a sidebar was smart This suits me for a few reasons
a wide angle screen form factor
b utility of vertical space is better for Spaces history etc all coexisting in one area
10 Sidebar
However my eyes were trained to look for tabs on top of the screen for so long that having them on LHS feels weird This might change after a few more days
Id love the ability to move the sidebar between LHS and RHS depending on when I place Arc on my monitor
11 Ecosystem contd
I expected browsing on Arc wont be seamless across devices wout native iOS apps Turns out the iPadOSMacOS continuity pushes the current tab across devices on the same iCloud account
Not sure about the predictability of this but so far looks good
12 Living with Arc
 cant imagine giving up Spaces
 pinned foldersbookmarks as expected
 keep forgetting to use Favourites
 have a lovehate relationship w links opening in overlay
browsercompany I really want to change icons on pinned folders pretty please
13 The iOS app dropped
Unexpected but pleasant Cant wait to dive in 

Hey browsercompany I need your help
Is there a way to tell apps to open links in a specific space
Eg my Slack always open links in my work spaceprofile
Im logged into two different Google accounts across two spaces
JiriJerabek browsercompany Great question Not right now but this feature for link routing by Space is coming in a couple weeks 
Cant wait to hear what you think
Summary: The user is enjoying the new features in Arc, including the split view, sidebar, and the ability to pin folders. They are also impressed with the iOS app, which allows them to open links in specific spaces. However, they are concerned about the lack of a mobile app and the lack of a way to tell apps to open links in specific spaces.

Text:
Im not a big planner to begin with probably due to my lack of enjoyment for more mainstream planners like Google calendar and traditional paper planners Google while claiming to be userfriendly had too many tools and GUIs to navigate through which felt overwhelming to me while still lacking the flexibility I desired Paper planners I encountered in the store didnt do the job either because they were not formatted exactly how I wanted and of course a regular old notebook didnt provide the online accessibility I wanted
Notion is everything you wanted in a planner and truly helped bring the planning side of me back to reality It provided helpful templates I could use to give an overall format for what I wanted to write checklists boxes etc which were incredibly customizable The tool is simple yet powerful without any unnecessary visual effects or special features you are forced to learn I love that Notion can be accessed on any device via the website or app and my plans look the exact same in any format without shifting its orientation or completely uphauling the website layout I would recommend this to anyone
Summary: User finds Notion helpful for organizing their daily tasks and planning their week, as it provides templates and customizable tools for organizing their tasks. They appreciate the flexibility and ease of use, and find it helpful for their daily tasks.

Text:
Everyone Use googledocs its simple  No use evernote and NotionHQ its shared  No do RoamResearch its serious  No use Apple Notes and Google Keep
Me They ALL run INSIDE my obsdmd  
Be a rebel  
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd Obsidian is built on a technology called Electron
Electron is just a Chrome browser that runs like an app on your desktop
So essentially Obsidian  Snazzy Browser for your notes
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd This allows us  in theory  to browse any website
In practice it works 80 of the time hence I couldnt get it to work with tana_inc or logseq 
While Obsidian does not support that out of the box  with a plugin its easy Lets get to it
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq Go to Settings gt Community Plugins Search for Custom Frames
Install it 
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq In the Obsidian settings there will be now a new entry Custom Frames towards end of your list
Find the New Frame button and click it A Frame is such a browser window that we can use to access all of the services
The new entry will appear in the list above the button 
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq Configure your Frame
1 Set the URL   or   copy amp paste from Browser
2  open in center to open the service like a tab otherwise its in the sidebar
3  Add Ribbon Icon to display a side icon 
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq Specify the icon you want to use
Go to  and find an icon you like
Copy paste its name into the icon textfield in previous step 
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq RESTART OBSIDIAN
Your new ribbon icon should now appear on the left
You will have to log in to GoogleAppleEvernote the first time But then it will remember you Just like in a browser
On the top right you find a few buttons to reload the page 
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq Summary
 Download Custom Frames plugin
 Add frames to any website as Obsidian is technically a browser
 This technique works with ANY website So you can integrate google calendar facebook or a todo app into obsidian
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq Obsidian is THE notetaking app to rule them all I focus on helping Academics amp Knowledge Workers to leverage its capacities to the max If you want to propel your academic career join my seminar this week and become an Effortless Academic

Artifexx googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq SaveToNotion Thread Study
Summary: The user is excited about the new features in Obsidian, including the ability to add custom frames and customize the ribbon icon. They are also excited about the new features in the Notion app, including the ability to add custom frames and customize the ribbon icon.

Text:
How might we collaborate efficiently in a hybrid work environment 
 
Workshopping within miro means people can participate in workshops remotely regardless of where they are in the planet This has also meant that travelling for workshops has become less important  saving the business money
Obviously the pandemic force a lot of us to find new ways to collaborate and connect without being face to face Miro was clearly ahead of the game in this regard But even since were seeing more of each other in the flesh miro still seems to be adding value with how easy it ease to document workshops quickly capture ideas and bring people together to brainstorm
There are very few things to dislike about miro There are some very minor things like how tables not being incredibly userfriendly limitations in how you can modify shapes particularly for the sake of creating wireframes But all in all this stuff is nice to have and the fact that you can even do basic wire framing along side everything else that you can do is a win
Summary: Users appreciate Miro's ability to align remote meeting participants and create engaging, self-documenting workshops. The speed and fluidity of the application enhance the facilitator experience. However, the licensing model and board structure can be confusing for infrequent collaborators, and users suggest improving security by including the entire enterprise as users and charging only for power users.

Text:
Miro solves several problems for product managers including collaboration ideation and brainstorming project management prototyping and remote work It provides a centralized platform for product managers to collaborate with their team members and stakeholders regardless of their location Miros digital whiteboard allows product managers to brainstorm and ideate with their team visually organize their ideas and prioritize their tasks It also helps product managers manage their projects effectively create and manage product roadmaps user story maps and agile and Scrum methodologies
Miro is an excellent tool for collaborating and brainstorming with teams remotely Its vast canvas space extensive library of premade templates and userfriendly interface make it easy to create and share ideas visually I particularly like its realtime collaboration feature which allows team members to work together seamlessly regardless of their location Overall Miro is a robust and flexible tool that can be used for various purposes from project management to creative brainstorming sessions
Miros pricing structure could be seen as expensive especially if users only require a few of the advanced features Our enterprise license charges the same cost per user even if most staff only use it intermittently As power users our team gets great value from the product but the accountants just see 60 of the company using it a few times a month and complain loudly 
If using SSO shared boards often link to the online version rather than the native app and the constant signingin can become frustrating
Summary: Users appreciate FigJam for enabling remote whiteboarding sessions and seamless collaboration with colleagues, eliminating the need for physical office presence. However, they note that it requires an additional paid subscription separate from Figma.

Text:
Think its impossible to create a successful solo business without coding and an audience Think again I did it and heres how I did it to earn my first dollars here  a gift is waiting for you in the last tweet 
Before we begin
When I won 2500 here
 I had an audience of 500 followers
 I didnt know how to code
 I didnt know anything about Twitter
I did
So did you
Now heres how I did it 
 First you need a brilliant idea It doesnt have to be groundbreaking just something youre passionate about Remember youre building this solo so youll need that passion to fuel your journey
 Once you have your idea its time to build without coding I used webflow to create my website and app without any coding knowledge Its incredibly userfriendly with a plethora of customizable templates to suit your business
webflow  Organize your thoughts and plan your content using NotionHQ As a solopreneur I found this to be the perfect tool for managing my tasks jotting down ideas and creating content outlines Plus its super easy to use
webflow NotionHQ  Find your niche and target audience You dont need a massive audience to succeedjust a group of dedicated engaged followers who love your work Focus on connecting with them and providing value
webflow NotionHQ  Share your work and gather feedback Join communities like IndieHackers ProductHunt and relevant Facebook groups to find likeminded people who can give you insights and encouragement
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Set up a business model that works for you From subscriptions and memberships to onetime purchases find a revenue stream that fits your goals and caters to your audiences needs
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Educate yourself Attend webinars read articles and listen to podcasts to stay uptodate with the latest trends and strategies You dont need a formal education to succeed just a curious mind
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Iterate improve and grow Be open to change and adapt to your audiences needs Remember building a business is an ongoing process and theres always room for improvement
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Track your progress and celebrate your wins Set measurable goals analyze your metrics and appreciate your achievements This is your journey and every small victory matters
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Believe in yourself and your idea As a solopreneur selfconfidence is crucial Keep pushing forward even when things get tough Youve got this
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Found this thread helpful Share it with fellow indie makers and solopreneurs who could use these tips Lets support each other on our solo business journeys
Summary: The user is a freelance writer and has been using Notion for a few months. They are currently working on a project and are looking for a designer to join their team.

Text:
Today I want to give some insights into the TOOLS that we use at our agency that works with startups from around the world including Silicon Valley
Giveaway at the end 
212 First up we use NotionHQ  Its our hub for everything Tasks deadlines management  its all there It works like a charm to keep everything organised especially when working when a team its nice since everyone knows whats where
312 Next Slack We use this mainly for internal communication with the team and for communication with a few clients In the beginning we wanted to use Slack 100 for clients communication but some clients just dont like it and we dont want to force them haha
412 We also use Monday its our CRM where we track leads and conversions basically keeping our clients in the loop We used to do this in Notion but it was hard to use which made it less motivating to keep it up to date
512 zapier is our goto for automation It takes care of all the repeat stuff so we have more time to be creative Nothing special but is saves a lot of time
612 For crafting copy we use OpenAIs ChatGPT Before GPT released we were actually using a tool called Jasper a year ago it was around 100USD a month and delivered 30 of the results GPT offers for free a real game changer
712 webflow is the platform we use to built our website with which integrates seamlessly with all our other tools through Zapier
812 For designs were all about figma from UI designs to logos its our goto for making visuals
Summary: User shares their plan to write a case study on their personal website, showcasing their design ideas and implementation process. They mention using Figma, Webflow, and custom JS for designing and developing the website, which took about two months to complete.

Hi all
After the most recent update of Figma  Pushed a couple of days ago prototypes using Figmas nested component prototyping have been affected This has been cross checked on web links  alternative machines
This has new overwrites that arent included and are causing very concerning issues especially on components that use auto layouts This ultimately means if we hadnt complete a round of user testing a couple of weeks prior we would have some serious issues
Is anyone else getting anything similar
Thanks

Sorry to hear this We dont see any tickets in our system associated with the email address associated with your Forum account Did you use another email Do you have a ticket number Once we locate your ticket we can try to escalate it to the right team
Hello I did fill the form as you said and shared the file with the support team Ill do it again if its need it
Thats odd Thank you for letting us know We can now see your recent ticket 738343 and someone from our Technical Quality team will reply to you soon
Im in contact with the support team thanks

Text:
Arc browser continuous review
Tldr Im loving it So far its been a fantastic experience Arc brings a lot of fresh air to a place where innovation seemingly stopped
What is Arc Check out browsercompany 
Dive into the thread below  1n
1 Firsttime use experience
Really well done I enjoyed the semiinteractive introlearning experience The keyboard shortcuts were introduced too
Setting up the colour scheme was excellent Straight away you know these guys are trying to do something different 
2 Firsttime use contd
I wish there was a bit more practice your shortcuts the only one that stuck with me was the one I already use elsewhere T
Saying that T execution is excellent and can be used for commands very much like K in other apps
3 Split view
This is my 1 feature so far
It seems to me that the people at browsercompany invested in getting to know users
One would doubt there could be anything left to learn about using a browser in 2023 What customer problems are there left to solve
And still
4 Split view contd
Split view solves a problem many of us have when we attempt to multitask Our current workarounds include constantly rearranging windows  to you BetterSnapTool etc Its chaos
Time will tell if Split view solves this but right now Im thrilled
5 Split view contd
The microinteractions here feel just right Intuitive discoverable The onboarding helped too
6 Profiles
This is a big one for me I struggled with this on Chrome My solution was to strictly use Chrome for work stuff plus Safari for personal use
But obviously that doesnt work well
7 Ecosystem
My incumbent browsers allow me to browse across devices with one app ecosystem I can easily continue on my iPadPro Safari where I left off on my laptop and then seamlessly move to my phone
Arc needs a mobiletablet app
8 Mini Arc
I took the plunge and made Arc my default browser and suddenly links from Slack opened in Mini Arc
Great when I need to quickly check stuff and close the tab But if I need to stay longer in the context I still need to move from the Mini Arc to the full Arc
9 Sidebar
Shifting the tabs from the top bar to a sidebar was smart This suits me for a few reasons
a wide angle screen form factor
b utility of vertical space is better for Spaces history etc all coexisting in one area
10 Sidebar
However my eyes were trained to look for tabs on top of the screen for so long that having them on LHS feels weird This might change after a few more days
Id love the ability to move the sidebar between LHS and RHS depending on when I place Arc on my monitor
11 Ecosystem contd
I expected browsing on Arc wont be seamless across devices wout native iOS apps Turns out the iPadOSMacOS continuity pushes the current tab across devices on the same iCloud account
Not sure about the predictability of this but so far looks good
12 Living with Arc
 cant imagine giving up Spaces
 pinned foldersbookmarks as expected
 keep forgetting to use Favourites
 have a lovehate relationship w links opening in overlay
browsercompany I really want to change icons on pinned folders pretty please
13 The iOS app dropped
Unexpected but pleasant Cant wait to dive in 

Hey browsercompany I need your help
Is there a way to tell apps to open links in a specific space
Eg my Slack always open links in my work spaceprofile
Im logged into two different Google accounts across two spaces
JiriJerabek browsercompany Great question Not right now but this feature for link routing by Space is coming in a couple weeks 
Cant wait to hear what you think
Summary: The user is enjoying the new features in Arc, including the split view, sidebar, and the ability to pin folders. They are also impressed with the iOS app, which allows them to open links in specific spaces. However, they are concerned about the lack of a mobile app and the lack of a way to tell apps to open links in specific spaces.

Text:
Hi
Today during UI class I have discovered an annyoing behavior I tried to create a simple product card with a picture and a Special offer label placed inside the picture
In order to reproduce the issue
Step 1 Create a text field turn it into Auto Layout and give it a fill color just to create a label basically like FLASH SALE etc
Step 2 Add a rectangle and fill it with an image
Step 3 Turn both into an AutoLayout frame and try to adjust the label and the image so that the label sits inside While doing so you shall discover that the image covers the label and hides it even when the label layer is above the image
Despite that when merging a text and an image into AutoLayout and only then turning the text to AutoLayout as well to give if a fill color  this method works perfectly fine but at last both methods shall lead to the same result as far as I am concerned so there might be a bug here Or is it
Thanks

Text:
Think its impossible to create a successful solo business without coding and an audience Think again I did it and heres how I did it to earn my first dollars here  a gift is waiting for you in the last tweet 
Before we begin
When I won 2500 here
 I had an audience of 500 followers
 I didnt know how to code
 I didnt know anything about Twitter
I did
So did you
Now heres how I did it 
 First you need a brilliant idea It doesnt have to be groundbreaking just something youre passionate about Remember youre building this solo so youll need that passion to fuel your journey
 Once you have your idea its time to build without coding I used webflow to create my website and app without any coding knowledge Its incredibly userfriendly with a plethora of customizable templates to suit your business
webflow  Organize your thoughts and plan your content using NotionHQ As a solopreneur I found this to be the perfect tool for managing my tasks jotting down ideas and creating content outlines Plus its super easy to use
webflow NotionHQ  Find your niche and target audience You dont need a massive audience to succeedjust a group of dedicated engaged followers who love your work Focus on connecting with them and providing value
webflow NotionHQ  Share your work and gather feedback Join communities like IndieHackers ProductHunt and relevant Facebook groups to find likeminded people who can give you insights and encouragement
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Set up a business model that works for you From subscriptions and memberships to onetime purchases find a revenue stream that fits your goals and caters to your audiences needs
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Educate yourself Attend webinars read articles and listen to podcasts to stay uptodate with the latest trends and strategies You dont need a formal education to succeed just a curious mind
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Iterate improve and grow Be open to change and adapt to your audiences needs Remember building a business is an ongoing process and theres always room for improvement
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Track your progress and celebrate your wins Set measurable goals analyze your metrics and appreciate your achievements This is your journey and every small victory matters
Summary: The user is a freelance writer and has been using Notion for a year. They are currently working on a book and are looking for a publisher. They are also looking for a designer to help with the cover.

I really enjoy using notion for note taking and syncing between devices works flawlessly Also lots of options to structure your notes embed different components create small databases for recipies and such etc

One improvement that would be great on iOS when I share a youtube video to a notion database via share sheet the URL is the title It would be great if the title was the video title and the URL was an embedded video in the content Adding Tags when sharing would also be helpful
Summary: User enjoys using Notion for note-taking and syncing between devices, but has issues with the lack of offline mode, AI features not being deactivated, and the app logging them out frequently. They suggest adding offline mode, pen support for drawing and sketching, and a better sharing experience for iOS users.

Text:
Im not a big planner to begin with probably due to my lack of enjoyment for more mainstream planners like Google calendar and traditional paper planners Google while claiming to be userfriendly had too many tools and GUIs to navigate through which felt overwhelming to me while still lacking the flexibility I desired Paper planners I encountered in the store didnt do the job either because they were not formatted exactly how I wanted and of course a regular old notebook didnt provide the online accessibility I wanted
Notion is everything you wanted in a planner and truly helped bring the planning side of me back to reality It provided helpful templates I could use to give an overall format for what I wanted to write checklists boxes etc which were incredibly customizable The tool is simple yet powerful without any unnecessary visual effects or special features you are forced to learn I love that Notion can be accessed on any device via the website or app and my plans look the exact same in any format without shifting its orientation or completely uphauling the website layout I would recommend this to anyone
Summary: User finds Notion helpful for organizing their daily tasks and planning their week, as it provides templates and customizable tools for organizing their tasks. They appreciate the flexibility and ease of use, and find it helpful for their daily tasks.

Text:
Hi I believe Ive exhausted all the existing help articles on this
Im having a hard time with something that should be very basic I have 25 or so screens the ONLY interaction between them is that the user should be able to click andor press the arrow key to navigate LINEARLY between them
Sometimes it works especially if I go slowly it works every time But sometimes it doesnt sometimes it inexplicably jumps through sections pretty much only happens if I press the arrow keys quickly It appears that if I click through it goes linearly every time without skipping screens So the problem is only with the arrow keys which I cant disable so I need to understand the behavior before handing off to my client
Ive adjusted all the artboards The desired order is Row 1 Left to Right Row 2 Left to Right as described in the documentation All rows have the exact same Y coordinate All columns have the exact same X coordinate
Ive spent hours on this already and this is really basic behavior so Im not sure why its so hard I want it to act like powerpoint in presentation mode
Any help is appreciated I cant really share the prototype because Im on NDA
Or up vote the solution here
 
 
 
 Remove auto creating flow starting points Share an idea
 
 
 I love the new feature that allows multiple prototypes per page One issue Im having with it is it assumes I want everything to be a new flow starting point each time I dont link something from the first flow starting page 
It has a very linear mindset When I workprototype I tend to work on a section then link it back and that creates many flow starting points on accident and I have to delete them 
Itd be nice if either  it only created the first one and doesnt assume you want many o

collating many screenshots and adding notes Very useful for combining screenshots with diagrams text and offering more collaboration between viewers Fairly simple to pick up and use which is great It would be nice to have a start screen for a project to help the casual user
I use Miro for my individual work projects and to collaborate with teams For my own work Miro is great for collating screenshots creating diagrams and adding notes  commentaries The infinite canvas is great for just gettng started and getting ideas out For a team its very good for creating lightweight tables and timelines There are good tools for collaboration

Text:
Ive been working on this project but while making the dropdown menu I ran into an issue
It seems like when the dropdown menu opens it is good but when I tried to do the prototyping to close it I ran into some issues
Here is what i did
Screenshot 202305PHONE_NUMBER231 321 KB
Everything seemed good but when I tried to preview it it would keep opening and closing rapidly as I moved my mouse over the selected navigation title Shop
Here is the link to the file 
Thanks for the help guys
Hi there
So I guess whats happening is that the prototype gets stuck between a situation where its opening an overlay because the mouse is on Shop and also closing the overlay because if the mouse has left Shop then it should close This is why it seems to flicker To fix this Id recommend using interactive components instead of the Overlay feature An example of what Im talking about is in the community file
Hope this helps
Hey Gayani
This helped a lot with the issue but it started another one  So now the issue is that the dropdown now will not close after the mouse is off of it and the navigation title moves up with the dropdown making it disappear from the screen I copied pretty much everything from the figma file you sent me and tried to fix it but couldnt find a solution
image1528235 55 KB
Summary: The user discusses the concept of Placeholder components in Figma and the issue they face when trying to nest a Column instance into another Column instance, resulting in a "cycle detected" error message. They suggest possible solutions, such as creating a Main Container component with slot instances inside and using Column/Row components with variants, but these are not optimal and only work up to the 2nd level.

Text: I have been using notion for the past two years and it is really helpful I started using it to organise notes for uni and keep track of my assignments Initially it is a bit difficult to navigate the service but the more you use it the more efficient you become You can borrow free templates online if creating your own is difficult I use notion to track almost everything and even without upgradation the app works reasonably well you can access the basic things which for a beginner is good enough Once i figure out how to create templates and deal with the more complex blocks they offer I will definitely be upgrading to the plus ver

Initially, it is difficult to navigate the service, but with practice, it becomes more efficient. The user appreciates the free templates available online and finds the basic features sufficient for a beginner.

Text:
Were working on a larger Component library that includes nonpublished components components with the prefix _ or  as base components in order to simplify large complex components We intended  in some specific cases  to offer regular components as templates that a designer would then have to detach and work with a bunch of base components to build the desired design
What we have come to realize with this approach however is that these nonpublished components dont receive updates from the library when they are updated in the main library
Is this intended behaviour
We basically have the option to simply publish these base components as regular components but that of course would mean cluttering up the assets overview with a bunch of modular components
hi Raphael our team is also facing the same issue for a while Have you or your team figured out the workaround for this issue I wish Figma can solve this issue fundamentally Josh thank you
Summary: User experienced issues with a button they created in class, where the color in the preview changed, but the button didn't work in the final product. They are seeking help to resolve the issue.

Text: I have been using notion for the past two years and it is really helpful I started using it to organise notes for uni and keep track of my assignments Initially it is a bit difficult to navigate the service but the more you use it the more efficient you become You can borrow free templates online if creating your own is difficult I use notion to track almost everything and even without upgradation the app works reasonably well you can access the basic things which for a beginner is good enough Once i figure out how to create templates and deal with the more complex blocks they offer I will definitely be upgrading to the plus ver
Summary: User has been using Notion for two years and finds it helpful for organizing notes for university and keeping track of assignments. Initially, it is difficult to navigate the service, but with practice, it becomes more efficient. The user appreciates the free templates available online and finds the basic features sufficient for a beginner.

Text:
Think its impossible to create a successful solo business without coding and an audience Think again I did it and heres how I did it to earn my first dollars here  a gift is waiting for you in the last tweet 
Before we begin
When I won 2500 here
 I had an audience of 500 followers
 I didnt know how to code
 I didnt know anything about Twitter
I did
So did you
Now heres how I did it 
 First you need a brilliant idea It doesnt have to be groundbreaking just something youre passionate about Remember youre building this solo so youll need that passion to fuel your journey
 Once you have your idea its time to build without coding I used webflow to create my website and app without any coding knowledge Its incredibly userfriendly with a plethora of customizable templates to suit your business
webflow  Organize your thoughts and plan your content using NotionHQ As a solopreneur I found this to be the perfect tool for managing my tasks jotting down ideas and creating content outlines Plus its super easy to use
webflow NotionHQ  Find your niche and target audience You dont need a massive audience to succeedjust a group of dedicated engaged followers who love your work Focus on connecting with them and providing value
webflow NotionHQ  Share your work and gather feedback Join communities like IndieHackers ProductHunt and relevant Facebook groups to find likeminded people who can give you insights and encouragement
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Set up a business model that works for you From subscriptions and memberships to onetime purchases find a revenue stream that fits your goals and caters to your audiences needs
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Educate yourself Attend webinars read articles and listen to podcasts to stay uptodate with the latest trends and strategies You dont need a formal education to succeed just a curious mind
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Iterate improve and grow Be open to change and adapt to your audiences needs Remember building a business is an ongoing process and theres always room for improvement
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Track your progress and celebrate your wins Set measurable goals analyze your metrics and appreciate your achievements This is your journey and every small victory matters
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Believe in yourself and your idea As a solopreneur selfconfidence is crucial Keep pushing forward even when things get tough Youve got this
Summary: The user is a freelance writer and has been using Notion for a year. They are currently working on a book and are looking for a publisher. They are also looking for a design team to work with on their book cover.

Text:
it integrates with Trainual so we can embed flow charts into training content for clients
easy drag and drop easy edit no unecessary formatting
sometimes the zooming feature is tricky after coming from other platforms
Summary: The user appreciates the diverse and accessible whiteboard tool for use during meetings and collaboration, as well as the tagging features and drag-and-drop file features. They also appreciate the ease of creating and sharing dashboards and the integration with other apps. However, they find the organization of connected objects to be surface-level and the large boards to be slow and hard to use.

Text:
Collaborative whiteboard Ability to share thoughts on the fly wihout restriction and sharing our screenspace
Flexibility to add people into the project and no restriction of zoom in and zoom out 
Also we can restrict who can and who cant 
Ability to login using email from anywhere multiple logins
Need a bit more libraries packages to have bit more funkyier than what it is
Summary: The product is helping users by providing easier collaboration for remote teams, as well as giving them oversight on work and the ability to document in a single location, which increases visibility and engagement amongst team members. Users appreciate the product's oversight for projects, its intuitive design, and its ability to integrate other apps and features. Users experience fatigue when zooming in and out, and find it difficult to create visuals and diagrams that are interactive. They also find it difficult to copy and paste elements from other sources into Miro, and wish they could consolidate their personal and work accounts.

Text:
Im not a big planner to begin with probably due to my lack of enjoyment for more mainstream planners like Google calendar and traditional paper planners Google while claiming to be userfriendly had too many tools and GUIs to navigate through which felt overwhelming to me while still lacking the flexibility I desired Paper planners I encountered in the store didnt do the job either because they were not formatted exactly how I wanted and of course a regular old notebook didnt provide the online accessibility I wanted
Notion is everything you wanted in a planner and truly helped bring the planning side of me back to reality It provided helpful templates I could use to give an overall format for what I wanted to write checklists boxes etc which were incredibly customizable The tool is simple yet powerful without any unnecessary visual effects or special features you are forced to learn I love that Notion can be accessed on any device via the website or app and my plans look the exact same in any format without shifting its orientation or completely uphauling the website layout I would recommend this to anyone
Summary: User finds Notion helpful for organizing their daily tasks and planning their week, as it provides templates and customizable tools for organizing their tasks. They appreciate the flexibility and ease of use, and find it helpful for their daily tasks.

The overall problem that FigJam is solving is the overwhelming thoughts and ideas that some teams have It helps by taking those ideas and organizing them within the team

Text:
Think its impossible to create a successful solo business without coding and an audience Think again I did it and heres how I did it to earn my first dollars here  a gift is waiting for you in the last tweet 
Before we begin
When I won 2500 here
 I had an audience of 500 followers
 I didnt know how to code
 I didnt know anything about Twitter
I did
So did you
Now heres how I did it 
 First you need a brilliant idea It doesnt have to be groundbreaking just something youre passionate about Remember youre building this solo so youll need that passion to fuel your journey
 Once you have your idea its time to build without coding I used webflow to create my website and app without any coding knowledge Its incredibly userfriendly with a plethora of customizable templates to suit your business
webflow  Organize your thoughts and plan your content using NotionHQ As a solopreneur I found this to be the perfect tool for managing my tasks jotting down ideas and creating content outlines Plus its super easy to use
webflow NotionHQ  Find your niche and target audience You dont need a massive audience to succeedjust a group of dedicated engaged followers who love your work Focus on connecting with them and providing value
webflow NotionHQ  Share your work and gather feedback Join communities like IndieHackers ProductHunt and relevant Facebook groups to find likeminded people who can give you insights and encouragement
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Set up a business model that works for you From subscriptions and memberships to onetime purchases find a revenue stream that fits your goals and caters to your audiences needs
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Educate yourself Attend webinars read articles and listen to podcasts to stay uptodate with the latest trends and strategies You dont need a formal education to succeed just a curious mind
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Iterate improve and grow Be open to change and adapt to your audiences needs Remember building a business is an ongoing process and theres always room for improvement
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Track your progress and celebrate your wins Set measurable goals analyze your metrics and appreciate your achievements This is your journey and every small victory matters
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Believe in yourself and your idea As a solopreneur selfconfidence is crucial Keep pushing forward even when things get tough Youve got this

Summary: Flux is an open-source power tool for interacting with LLMs, allowing users to generate multiple completions per prompt in a tree structure and explore the best ones in parallel. It offers a variety of creative responses, tests different prompts with shared context, and identifies model uncertainties. Flux also features keyboard shortcuts, system message editing, autosaving, and direct use of the OpenAI API. The creators are open to collaboration and are working on an LLM collaboration tool using Ceramic Network's ComposeDB and Flux, similar to Figma for prompt design.

Text:
Up your gradient game 
Learn how to create this folded gradient effect with figma in just a few easy steps  no plugins needed
Ready Lets dive in 
sponsored 
Step 1
Create a new artboard and add a rectangle with a grey fill 
Step 2 
Go into vector edit mode and select 2 anchor points Manipulate those till you get an angle you like 
Step 3 
Repeat the first 2 steps and make sure to connect each begin of a fold with the end points of the previous one 
Step 4
Finish your composition make sure to create artboard copies for different iterations 
Step 5 
Time for some color Create a linear gradient going from light to dark and copy amp paste the style to your vectors OPTCMDC gt OPTCMDV 
Tip Use more than 2 color stops in your gradient for a unique look 
Step 6 
Nice Now we just have to change the gradient angles for every other vector to create more realistic lighting 
Step 7 
To take your gradient fold to the next level introduce some extra color combinations 
Bonus Step 
You can try to go for a top and bottom gradient effect as shown below 
Okay one more bonus step 
You can even try to split up a larger gradient in multiple stops to create an effect like shown below 
No matter what you do make sure to experiment and have fun 
Are you trying out this technique Make sure to share it by tagging figma and FonsMans See you at the next one
 Follow me FonsMans for more
 LikeRetweet this thread so more people can see it

Text:
It would be extremely useful to have raw SVG paths exposed for the PATH object type Not the path outlines just the d attribute of the path Not having this has make the api essentially unworkable for certain things like when the absolute smallest SVG possible is required
The only way to programmatically get the real path commands for a PATH type object is to go through the image rest api retrieve the svg and parse it to get the d attribute
The only way I know how to achieve this image is to outline a stroke which turns it into a shape then apply a stroke to that shape
If that is what you are doing the information represented by your purple line no longer exists for the node That loss happens when you outline the stroke and all the information we have to provide is the dashed line stroke geometry
Am I understanding that correctly Can you share a file with this node in it if not
image1152379 138 KB
image1062307 215 KB

Sorry  let me try to explain again
In your example  I want to get the path command that draws the black line but what I get out of the API is the path command that draws the outline of the path stroke as if I had clicked outline stroke
yeah sorry if what i was saying wasnt clear i had to outline the black line to get the dashed line if i didnt outline the black line i would get the code you are looking for youre saying the stroke you have isnt outlined and it is returning an outlined path that should not be happening

Text:
I have created a Creative Hack workshop template which I use to help teams and clients come up with ideas 
Ill also use Miro for other team tasks in which multiple people need to make inputs 
Its helpful for capturing a large amount of information in a little amount time and ultimately making sense of those inputs
I describe Miro as an Adobe Illustrator Group Chat I love the drag and drop flexibility of it and ease of use which allows me to capture ideas and feedback in real time Even when Im working with large groups of people the tool enables me to synthesize conversations and sharebacks in a way that captures the essence of a meeting
I have a few small feedback options for Miro 
 
1 For some reason I am forced to put a password on a board when I make it publically editable It didnt used to be like this and I find it annoying that I have to do that every time I end up just saying miroboard for everything 
 
2 When I invite outside of my org participants to join a board Via the UX they often think they have to sign up to view the board which leads to time lost in the session correcting them and getting them to the board as a guest quickly 
 
3 Not sure if this is still the case but I wish I could give people outside of my team permission to lock objects I work across teams so sometimes Im unable to lock assets on colleagues boards and vice versa
Summary: Users appreciate the simplicity of Figma's whiteboard tool for organization and find it easy to use. However, they preferred the free plan and find connecting arrows in reverse to be tricky.

No endtoend encryption  do not use this app to store and sensitive or confidential information
Summary: User finds the app clunky and slow, with finicky operation and expensive AI service, which performs poorly. They experienced difficulty unsubscribing and were charged despite stopping using the app. The user suggests avoiding the app for sensitive or confidential information.

Text:
Arc browser continuous review
Tldr Im loving it So far its been a fantastic experience Arc brings a lot of fresh air to a place where innovation seemingly stopped
What is Arc Check out browsercompany 
Dive into the thread below  1n
1 Firsttime use experience
Really well done I enjoyed the semiinteractive introlearning experience The keyboard shortcuts were introduced too
Setting up the colour scheme was excellent Straight away you know these guys are trying to do something different 
2 Firsttime use contd
I wish there was a bit more practice your shortcuts the only one that stuck with me was the one I already use elsewhere T
Saying that T execution is excellent and can be used for commands very much like K in other apps
3 Split view
This is my 1 feature so far
It seems to me that the people at browsercompany invested in getting to know users
One would doubt there could be anything left to learn about using a browser in 2023 What customer problems are there left to solve
And still
4 Split view contd
Split view solves a problem many of us have when we attempt to multitask Our current workarounds include constantly rearranging windows  to you BetterSnapTool etc Its chaos
Time will tell if Split view solves this but right now Im thrilled
5 Split view contd
The microinteractions here feel just right Intuitive discoverable The onboarding helped too
6 Profiles
This is a big one for me I struggled with this on Chrome My solution was to strictly use Chrome for work stuff plus Safari for personal use
But obviously that doesnt work well
7 Ecosystem
My incumbent browsers allow me to browse across devices with one app ecosystem I can easily continue on my iPadPro Safari where I left off on my laptop and then seamlessly move to my phone
Arc needs a mobiletablet app
8 Mini Arc
I took the plunge and made Arc my default browser and suddenly links from Slack opened in Mini Arc
Great when I need to quickly check stuff and close the tab But if I need to stay longer in the context I still need to move from the Mini Arc to the full Arc
9 Sidebar
Shifting the tabs from the top bar to a sidebar was smart This suits me for a few reasons
a wide angle screen form factor
b utility of vertical space is better for Spaces history etc all coexisting in one area
10 Sidebar
However my eyes were trained to look for tabs on top of the screen for so long that having them on LHS feels weird This might change after a few more days
Id love the ability to move the sidebar between LHS and RHS depending on when I place Arc on my monitor
11 Ecosystem contd
I expected browsing on Arc wont be seamless across devices wout native iOS apps Turns out the iPadOSMacOS continuity pushes the current tab across devices on the same iCloud account
Not sure about the predictability of this but so far looks good
12 Living with Arc
 cant imagine giving up Spaces
 pinned foldersbookmarks as expected
 keep forgetting to use Favourites
 have a lovehate relationship w links opening in overlay
browsercompany I really want to change icons on pinned folders pretty please
13 The iOS app dropped
Unexpected but pleasant Cant wait to dive in 

Hey browsercompany I need your help
Is there a way to tell apps to open links in a specific space
Eg my Slack always open links in my work spaceprofile
Im logged into two different Google accounts across two spaces
JiriJerabek browsercompany Great question Not right now but this feature for link routing by Space is coming in a couple weeks 
Cant wait to hear what you think
Summary: The user is enjoying the new features in Arc, including the split view, sidebar, and the ability to pin folders. They are also impressed with the iOS app, which allows them to open links in specific spaces. However, they are concerned about the lack of a mobile app and the lack of a way to tell apps to open links in specific spaces.

Online collaboration platform that provides a whiteboarding type experience This was crucial during the covid era lockdowns and allowed us to effectively run our workshops
Ability to run multiple collaboration initiatives including but not limited to various types of brainstorming activities product designs wireframes I have tried other whiteboarding tools from Microsoft and Google but they lack templates and experience that Miro provides
1 I would like to see a more mature library of templates around wireframes 2 Licensing cost Especially in the era of super lowcost collaboration tools from large platforms like Microsoft
Summary: Users find Figjam to be an effective collaboration tool for remote teams, enabling brainstorming and project planning in a single, consolidated space. It has successfully replaced in-person whiteboard sessions and is highly appreciated by users, with very few dislikes.

Text:
Arc browser continuous review
Tldr Im loving it So far its been a fantastic experience Arc brings a lot of fresh air to a place where innovation seemingly stopped
What is Arc Check out browsercompany 
Dive into the thread below  1n
1 Firsttime use experience
Really well done I enjoyed the semiinteractive introlearning experience The keyboard shortcuts were introduced too
Setting up the colour scheme was excellent Straight away you know these guys are trying to do something different 
2 Firsttime use contd
I wish there was a bit more practice your shortcuts the only one that stuck with me was the one I already use elsewhere T
Saying that T execution is excellent and can be used for commands very much like K in other apps
3 Split view
This is my 1 feature so far
It seems to me that the people at browsercompany invested in getting to know users
One would doubt there could be anything left to learn about using a browser in 2023 What customer problems are there left to solve
And still
4 Split view contd
Split view solves a problem many of us have when we attempt to multitask Our current workarounds include constantly rearranging windows  to you BetterSnapTool etc Its chaos
Time will tell if Split view solves this but right now Im thrilled
5 Split view contd
The microinteractions here feel just right Intuitive discoverable The onboarding helped too
6 Profiles
This is a big one for me I struggled with this on Chrome My solution was to strictly use Chrome for work stuff plus Safari for personal use
But obviously that doesnt work well
7 Ecosystem
My incumbent browsers allow me to browse across devices with one app ecosystem I can easily continue on my iPadPro Safari where I left off on my laptop and then seamlessly move to my phone
Arc needs a mobiletablet app
8 Mini Arc
I took the plunge and made Arc my default browser and suddenly links from Slack opened in Mini Arc
Great when I need to quickly check stuff and close the tab But if I need to stay longer in the context I still need to move from the Mini Arc to the full Arc
9 Sidebar
Shifting the tabs from the top bar to a sidebar was smart This suits me for a few reasons
a wide angle screen form factor
b utility of vertical space is better for Spaces history etc all coexisting in one area
10 Sidebar
However my eyes were trained to look for tabs on top of the screen for so long that having them on LHS feels weird This might change after a few more days
Id love the ability to move the sidebar between LHS and RHS depending on when I place Arc on my monitor
11 Ecosystem contd
I expected browsing on Arc wont be seamless across devices wout native iOS apps Turns out the iPadOSMacOS continuity pushes the current tab across devices on the same iCloud account
Not sure about the predictability of this but so far looks good
12 Living with Arc
 cant imagine giving up Spaces
 pinned foldersbookmarks as expected
 keep forgetting to use Favourites
 have a lovehate relationship w links opening in overlay
browsercompany I really want to change icons on pinned folders pretty please
13 The iOS app dropped
Unexpected but pleasant Cant wait to dive in 

Hey browsercompany I need your help
Is there a way to tell apps to open links in a specific space
Eg my Slack always open links in my work spaceprofile
Im logged into two different Google accounts across two spaces
JiriJerabek browsercompany Great question Not right now but this feature for link routing by Space is coming in a couple weeks 
Cant wait to hear what you think
Summary: The user is enjoying the new features in Arc, including the split view, sidebar, and the ability to pin folders. They are also impressed with the iOS app, which allows them to open links in specific spaces. However, they are concerned about the lack of a mobile app and the lack of a way to tell apps to open links in specific spaces.

Text:
Im not a big planner to begin with probably due to my lack of enjoyment for more mainstream planners like Google calendar and traditional paper planners Google while claiming to be userfriendly had too many tools and GUIs to navigate through which felt overwhelming to me while still lacking the flexibility I desired Paper planners I encountered in the store didnt do the job either because they were not formatted exactly how I wanted and of course a regular old notebook didnt provide the online accessibility I wanted
Notion is everything you wanted in a planner and truly helped bring the planning side of me back to reality It provided helpful templates I could use to give an overall format for what I wanted to write checklists boxes etc which were incredibly customizable The tool is simple yet powerful without any unnecessary visual effects or special features you are forced to learn I love that Notion can be accessed on any device via the website or app and my plans look the exact same in any format without shifting its orientation or completely uphauling the website layout I would recommend this to anyone
Summary: User finds Notion helpful for organizing their daily tasks and planning their week, as it provides templates and customizable tools for organizing their tasks. They appreciate the flexibility and ease of use, and find it helpful for their daily tasks.

Text:
Notion would be amazing if if it was easy to do easy things There is a lot of functionality that would make your life a lot easier What takes away from all of this potential is a buggy and nagging experience trying to input information
Trying to add a todo list checkbox  click the Hamburger menu with your finger iPad list comes up click To Do List menu goes away to do list item doesnt populate Try using touchpad follow the same steps to do list doesnt populate
Create a bullet point and click the hamburger menu change to to do list to do list doesnt populate
You are also able to do slash commands So I press  I see the menu open and it closes immediately The to do list is only an example There are endless nagging bugs like this throughout the experience So instead of being able to use the app to enhance workflows and life in general you are constantly fighting the app
I stopped using Notion for about 8 months and used a number of other products Because of all the data in notion and all of the things I had set up already I came back to because SURELY they had fixed the bugs Its the exact same No more consistent or stable than it was 8 months ago
What is really annoying to me is that they release new features New and shiny things like their AI tool I WOULD RATHER HAVE AN APP THAT WORKS PROPERLY and not have AI I dont care about AI I just want to be able to input data If that works AI would be amazing
It will be long and arduous but im moving to ClickUp
Summary: User finds Notion to be a great app for collaboration and brainstorming, but has experienced numerous bugs and glitches, including issues with adding checkboxes and creating to-do lists. They also mention that the app is slow and buggy, and the AI tool is not useful for their needs.

Text:
How might we collaborate efficiently in a hybrid work environment 
 
Workshopping within miro means people can participate in workshops remotely regardless of where they are in the planet This has also meant that travelling for workshops has become less important  saving the business money
Obviously the pandemic force a lot of us to find new ways to collaborate and connect without being face to face Miro was clearly ahead of the game in this regard But even since were seeing more of each other in the flesh miro still seems to be adding value with how easy it ease to document workshops quickly capture ideas and bring people together to brainstorm
There are very few things to dislike about miro There are some very minor things like how tables not being incredibly userfriendly limitations in how you can modify shapes particularly for the sake of creating wireframes But all in all this stuff is nice to have and the fact that you can even do basic wire framing along side everything else that you can do is a win
Summary: Users appreciate Miro's ability to align remote meeting participants and create engaging, self-documenting workshops. The speed and fluidity of the application enhance the facilitator experience. However, the licensing model and board structure can be confusing for infrequent collaborators, and users suggest improving security by including the entire enterprise as users and charging only for power users.

Text:
FigJam lets me my allremote team and our stakeholders quickly and easily collaborate to collect and organize ideas Its incredibly simple and works well for people of all technical skillsets I use it for hours every day
FigJam is simple and flexible  my team and I have used it for everything from workflow diagramming to stakeholder workshops on product vision Weve also trained nondesigners to use the tool in under 2 minutes They love it and even use it when we arent around
The ability to collaborate with nonauthenticated users is incredible but resetting the 24hour timer is a bit tedious I understand there has to be some inconvenience to push for more paid accounts but I wish there was a way to extend those timers I also wish there was a vertical alignment option in the menu bar for moving text to the top or bottom of shapes in addition to horizontal alignment But other than small feature requests like this I have no complaints
Summary: User praises Miro as a comprehensive collaboration tool that is intuitive and easy to use, with a valuable freemium version. However, they find the account and security hierarchy confusing at times.

Text:
Hi
Today during UI class I have discovered an annyoing behavior I tried to create a simple product card with a picture and a Special offer label placed inside the picture
In order to reproduce the issue
Step 1 Create a text field turn it into Auto Layout and give it a fill color just to create a label basically like FLASH SALE etc
Step 2 Add a rectangle and fill it with an image
Step 3 Turn both into an AutoLayout frame and try to adjust the label and the image so that the label sits inside While doing so you shall discover that the image covers the label and hides it even when the label layer is above the image
Despite that when merging a text and an image into AutoLayout and only then turning the text to AutoLayout as well to give if a fill color  this method works perfectly fine but at last both methods shall lead to the same result as far as I am concerned so there might be a bug here Or is it
Thanks
Summary: User faced an issue with a button not working after making changes in the preview. They provided a link to the issue and requested assistance.

Text:
We work in a way that encourages loads of idea sharing and being able to jot ideas down on postits and then move them around and have the board evolve as our ideas do makes the process collaborative and creative even when we are not all in the same room
I love that we are able to collaborate in a creative playful way even when we are not physically in the same room Having the option to create individual workspaces on the same board and then come together to review each others ideas works so well for my team
Id love to see more colours available in the postits  sometimes we run out of unique colours and that restricts our ability to theme information
Summary: Users appreciate Figma for its collaboration tools and auto-layout feature, which simplifies the design process and effectively implements flexbox. However, they find the image manipulation tools lacking, particularly in setting focal points and background positions. Some users are also concerned about the recent acquisition by Adobe.

Text:
Miro helps me work remotely and more efficiently It provides an online realtime workspace for my entire team that helps us collaborate efficiently no matter where were located
My favorite thing about Miro is how it simplifies remote collaboration with its comprehensive collection of features including collaboration text editing and visual effects It has an easy learning curve that allows all users to be up and running quickly with no more than a few minutes of training In addition I appreciate having access to the library of prebuilt templates that save me countless hours when coordinating geographically dispersed teams These benefits make Miro an industry standard for enabling effective communication between remote workers on collaborative projects
I find that the complexity of MIROs features can make it difficult to learn but once you understand its capabilities and features there is no limit to the tasks you can accomplish Although a free account does not have all the same options as a paid account  such as private boards  with careful collaboration between team members using different accounts your project will still be successful
Summary: Users appreciate Figma's ability to create beautiful CX artifacts and its features, usability, Miroverse, templates, and support. However, they find it pricey and suggest allowing free guest access for the first 24 hours.

Text:
Everyone Use googledocs its simple  No use evernote and NotionHQ its shared  No do RoamResearch its serious  No use Apple Notes and Google Keep
Me They ALL run INSIDE my obsdmd  
Be a rebel  
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd Obsidian is built on a technology called Electron
Electron is just a Chrome browser that runs like an app on your desktop
So essentially Obsidian  Snazzy Browser for your notes
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd This allows us  in theory  to browse any website
In practice it works 80 of the time hence I couldnt get it to work with tana_inc or logseq 
While Obsidian does not support that out of the box  with a plugin its easy Lets get to it
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq Go to Settings gt Community Plugins Search for Custom Frames
Install it 
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq In the Obsidian settings there will be now a new entry Custom Frames towards end of your list
Find the New Frame button and click it A Frame is such a browser window that we can use to access all of the services
The new entry will appear in the list above the button 
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq Configure your Frame
1 Set the URL   or   copy amp paste from Browser
2  open in center to open the service like a tab otherwise its in the sidebar
3  Add Ribbon Icon to display a side icon 
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq Specify the icon you want to use
Go to  and find an icon you like
Copy paste its name into the icon textfield in previous step 
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq RESTART OBSIDIAN
Your new ribbon icon should now appear on the left
You will have to log in to GoogleAppleEvernote the first time But then it will remember you Just like in a browser
On the top right you find a few buttons to reload the page 
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq Summary
 Download Custom Frames plugin
 Add frames to any website as Obsidian is technically a browser
 This technique works with ANY website So you can integrate google calendar facebook or a todo app into obsidian
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq Obsidian is THE notetaking app to rule them all I focus on helping Academics amp Knowledge Workers to leverage its capacities to the max If you want to propel your academic career join my seminar this week and become an Effortless Academic

Artifexx googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq SaveToNotion Thread Study
Summary: The user is excited about the new features in Obsidian, including the ability to add custom frames and customize the ribbon icon. They are also excited about the new features in the Notion app, including the ability to add custom frames and customize the ribbon icon.

Text:
Im not a big planner to begin with probably due to my lack of enjoyment for more mainstream planners like Google calendar and traditional paper planners Google while claiming to be userfriendly had too many tools and GUIs to navigate through which felt overwhelming to me while still lacking the flexibility I desired Paper planners I encountered in the store didnt do the job either because they were not formatted exactly how I wanted and of course a regular old notebook didnt provide the online accessibility I wanted
Notion is everything you wanted in a planner and truly helped bring the planning side of me back to reality It provided helpful templates I could use to give an overall format for what I wanted to write checklists boxes etc which were incredibly customizable The tool is simple yet powerful without any unnecessary visual effects or special features you are forced to learn I love that Notion can be accessed on any device via the website or app and my plans look the exact same in any format without shifting its orientation or completely uphauling the website layout I would recommend this to anyone
Summary: User finds Notion helpful for organizing their daily tasks and planning their week, as it provides templates and customizable tools for organizing their tasks. They appreciate the flexibility and ease of use, and find it helpful for their daily tasks.

Text:
The company I work at has little to no documentation regarding processes and strategy With Miro I can easily create the first draft of a diagramprocess and quickly add guests to collaborate and have a final version within 1 or 2 sessions of online collaboration 
Additionally Miro has helped me shift my problemsolving methodology from pen and paper and prose to visually abstracting the problem in a way that is easier and more efficient for my brain to process
The tools ease of use the number and diversity of templates and the resources available for support Creating visually stunning yet simple graphics is incredibly easy As I began to use Miro more and more frequently in my workflow my way of thinking and solving problems has shifted to be more visual Â I am able to abstract my problems and express them on the screen in a powerful way
I wish Miro had better tools to create modify and import vector graphics With its current set of tools its cumbersome to create vector graphics and text that would take seconds to make with the right set of tools
Summary: The user appreciates Figma's collaborative features and free layer for small teams, which helps in conducting retrospectives and discussing strategies. However, they find the limitation of three boards and the need to pay for certain components restrictive.

Text:
Collaboration tools are very important in this remote world that were living in FigJam provides our teams with a natural medium to collaborate with We love it for retrospectives group plannings brainstorming etc
FigJam makes it easy to collaborate with a team on a variety of different use cases From whiteboarding to retrospectives to planning meetings to organizing information
Because it is mostly unstructured you or your team is left to decide what structure works best for your use case
Summary: The product is helping the User to quickly analyse large amounts of data, identify correlations and gain new insights, all within a visually appealing format. Users appreciate the product's simplicity and intuitiveness, as well as its unlimited whiteboard space which is great for collaboration, forming new ideas, and making insights. The User finds that the product can become clunky when uploading multiple files, and some PDFs are difficult to read. Additionally, the User has to continually log in to their work account if it has been inactive for a short while.
