Summary: Flux is an open-source power tool for interacting with LLMs, allowing users to generate multiple completions per prompt in a tree structure and explore the best ones in parallel. It offers a variety of creative responses, tests different prompts with shared context, and identifies model uncertainties. Flux also features keyboard shortcuts, system message editing, autosaving, and direct use of the OpenAI API. The creators are open to collaboration and are working on an LLM collaboration tool using Ceramic Network's ComposeDB and Flux, similar to Figma for prompt design.

Text:
Everyone Use googledocs its simple  No use evernote and NotionHQ its shared  No do RoamResearch its serious  No use Apple Notes and Google Keep
Me They ALL run INSIDE my obsdmd  
Be a rebel  
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd Obsidian is built on a technology called Electron
Electron is just a Chrome browser that runs like an app on your desktop
So essentially Obsidian  Snazzy Browser for your notes
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd This allows us  in theory  to browse any website
In practice it works 80 of the time hence I couldnt get it to work with tana_inc or logseq 
While Obsidian does not support that out of the box  with a plugin its easy Lets get to it
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq Go to Settings gt Community Plugins Search for Custom Frames
Install it 
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq In the Obsidian settings there will be now a new entry Custom Frames towards end of your list
Find the New Frame button and click it A Frame is such a browser window that we can use to access all of the services
The new entry will appear in the list above the button 
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq Configure your Frame
1 Set the URL   or   copy amp paste from Browser
2  open in center to open the service like a tab otherwise its in the sidebar
3  Add Ribbon Icon to display a side icon 
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq Specify the icon you want to use
Go to  and find an icon you like
Copy paste its name into the icon textfield in previous step 
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq RESTART OBSIDIAN
Your new ribbon icon should now appear on the left
You will have to log in to GoogleAppleEvernote the first time But then it will remember you Just like in a browser
On the top right you find a few buttons to reload the page 
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq Summary
 Download Custom Frames plugin
 Add frames to any website as Obsidian is technically a browser
 This technique works with ANY website So you can integrate google calendar facebook or a todo app into obsidian
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq Obsidian is THE notetaking app to rule them all I focus on helping Academics amp Knowledge Workers to leverage its capacities to the max If you want to propel your academic career join my seminar this week and become an Effortless Academic

Artifexx googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq SaveToNotion Thread Study
Summary: The user is excited about the new features in Obsidian, including the ability to add custom frames and customize the ribbon icon. They are also excited about the new features in the Notion app, including the ability to add custom frames and customize the ribbon icon.

Announcements in the world of AI today
Anthropic expands Claudes context window to 100000
Stability AIs new texttoanimation tool
Meta introduces the AI sandbox
Airtable unveils Airtable AI
Heres the rundown on everything you need to know
1 Anthropic revolutionizes Claude AI
Anthropic is boosting Claude their AI model by expanding its context window from a mere 9000 tokens to a whopping 100000 tokens
Claude can now analyze and interpret not just a few pages but hundreds 
The model could digest and analyze the entire text of The Great Gatsby in less than a minute 
This puts OpenAIs GPT4 and its 32k context window currently in beta in the dust 
2 Stability AIs texttoanimation tool
Stability AI just unveiled a powerful texttoanimation tool called Stable Animation SDK
Users can generate animations from text images or video combined with text 
3 Meta unveils generative AI for advertisers
Meta just introduced the AI Sandbox a playground for advertisers to try new generative AIpowered ad tools

Text:
Everyone Use googledocs its simple  No use evernote and NotionHQ its shared  No do RoamResearch its serious  No use Apple Notes and Google Keep
Me They ALL run INSIDE my obsdmd  
Be a rebel  
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd Obsidian is built on a technology called Electron
Electron is just a Chrome browser that runs like an app on your desktop
So essentially Obsidian  Snazzy Browser for your notes
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd This allows us  in theory  to browse any website
In practice it works 80 of the time hence I couldnt get it to work with tana_inc or logseq 
While Obsidian does not support that out of the box  with a plugin its easy Lets get to it
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq Go to Settings gt Community Plugins Search for Custom Frames
Install it 
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq In the Obsidian settings there will be now a new entry Custom Frames towards end of your list
Find the New Frame button and click it A Frame is such a browser window that we can use to access all of the services
The new entry will appear in the list above the button 
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq Configure your Frame
1 Set the URL   or   copy amp paste from Browser
2  open in center to open the service like a tab otherwise its in the sidebar
3  Add Ribbon Icon to display a side icon 
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq Specify the icon you want to use
Go to  and find an icon you like
Copy paste its name into the icon textfield in previous step 
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq RESTART OBSIDIAN
Your new ribbon icon should now appear on the left
You will have to log in to GoogleAppleEvernote the first time But then it will remember you Just like in a browser
On the top right you find a few buttons to reload the page 
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq Summary
 Download Custom Frames plugin
 Add frames to any website as Obsidian is technically a browser
 This technique works with ANY website So you can integrate google calendar facebook or a todo app into obsidian
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq Obsidian is THE notetaking app to rule them all I focus on helping Academics amp Knowledge Workers to leverage its capacities to the max If you want to propel your academic career join my seminar this week and become an Effortless Academic

Artifexx googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq SaveToNotion Thread Study
Summary: The user is excited about the new features in Obsidian, including the ability to add custom frames and customize the ribbon icon. They are also excited about the new features in the Notion app, including the ability to add custom frames and customize the ribbon icon.

Text:
Before Figma I had a hard time meeting up with customer requirements for Prototyping and Wireframing of mobile apps and web landing pages I was using Photoshop and it was quite tasking With Figma my designs are easier I complete them faster and I have access to more methods specifically meant for UIUX
It is not as restrictive as other design applications It is very free easy incorporation of external files that contribute to the general design and an interface that even a beginner can get around with ease

I really love nested instance properties feature but it works for one component instance only It would be useful if nested instance properties were available when I select several parent instances
My example
Component structure
component Label  used for different statuses  has text property Label for text inside 2 component Table Cell  used for building tables  has variants for different types of cells
Case I create column of statuses in the table it includes cells which include label If I want to update text in one label I can use nested labels text property But when I want to update text in several cells nested instance property disappears and I need to select label instead of cells or use some plugin for bulk text update
PS thanks to figma team for your incredible work I would also love to see support for this

Text:
Hi I believe Ive exhausted all the existing help articles on this
Im having a hard time with something that should be very basic I have 25 or so screens the ONLY interaction between them is that the user should be able to click andor press the arrow key to navigate LINEARLY between them
Sometimes it works especially if I go slowly it works every time But sometimes it doesnt sometimes it inexplicably jumps through sections pretty much only happens if I press the arrow keys quickly It appears that if I click through it goes linearly every time without skipping screens So the problem is only with the arrow keys which I cant disable so I need to understand the behavior before handing off to my client
Ive adjusted all the artboards The desired order is Row 1 Left to Right Row 2 Left to Right as described in the documentation All rows have the exact same Y coordinate All columns have the exact same X coordinate
Ive spent hours on this already and this is really basic behavior so Im not sure why its so hard I want it to act like powerpoint in presentation mode
Any help is appreciated I cant really share the prototype because Im on NDA
Or up vote the solution here
 
 
 
 Remove auto creating flow starting points Share an idea
 
 
 I love the new feature that allows multiple prototypes per page One issue Im having with it is it assumes I want everything to be a new flow starting point each time I dont link something from the first flow starting page 
It has a very linear mindset When I workprototype I tend to work on a section then link it back and that creates many flow starting points on accident and I have to delete them 
Itd be nice if either  it only created the first one and doesnt assume you want many o
Summary: User appreciates the ability to use images in new and cool ways.

Text:
FigJam makes it really easy for me a copywriter whos also very visual to map out my thoughts and get organized Honestly I dont use it often but when I need help figuring out my thoughts in a visual way I cant think of a better tool
Im a copywriter and using Figma was a big learning curve for me to work with my companys designers FigJam on the other hand was super easy to learn I use it for even the simplest things like group brainstorming sessions and just mapping out my thoughts I would say that its a key tool in our team
I cant say that I have a specific problem with FigJam Its a great tool I guess my only callout would be that Id like to have more features Its easy to use but Im sure there are additional features you could add to make it more fun and interactive

When we need a meeting we always decide to use Miro And this is a standard in our way of working even if we are all in the same room The reason is that Miro has been instrumental in brainstorming until we reach agreements that we all like The methodology has made the meetings less timeconsuming and more effective
The fluidity of the application is out of this world Thanks to it we can create structures while meeting without waiting for changes In addition its easy to use so anyone can master it and get a lot out of it to express their ideas
Miro works perfectly thanks to the fact that it is online but this is a drawback if the connection is unstable Therefore I would like some measures so that the unstable connection does not affect the experience so much

Text:
FigJam impose a collaborative and creative environment 
It allows teams to work together visually 
The interactive nature of the tool encourages active participation engagement and cocreation It promotes the sharing of diverse perspectives sparking creativity and innovation within teams
It offers a range of features like sticky notes shapes freehand drawing etc 
FigJam is versatile for different types of projects and teams as it also provides various templates and customisable options
FigJam works great with Figma but when you need to integrate it with other design tools rather than Figma it is not easy and more of a manual task 
It gets really hard to cooperate when using different design tools than Figma
Summary: User appreciates the flexibility and endless canvas for organizing ideas with colleagues, but finds images to be slow and low-res, and struggles to keep organized between multiple boards.

Text:
A diverse and easily accessible whiteboard tool for use during meetings or to collaborate on earlystage ideas 
Collaborative brain dump before meeting to introduce topics or after meetings to record toughts
Easy to create and share dashboards 
Tagging features are nice 
Drag and drop file features work well 
Live sessions are easy to start and work well as a collaborative space to work during meetings
Integrations with other apps are surfacelevel 
There is no bakedin intelligence to the organization of connected objects 
Large boards become very slow and hard to use
Summary: Users appreciate Miro's flexibility, functionality, and ability to visually communicate inefficiencies to internal clients. They also enjoy the collaboration features. However, they find copying graphics between boards frustrating, as it doesn't always maintain the original formatting.

Text:
Continuing the discussion from Dynamic number of nested component instances
I have components that might include a number of instances of another component eg rows or columns in a table options in a selectdropdown etc To accomplish this I have to either create a separate variant for each potential number of nested instances or create the component with the maximum possible number of nested instances and make the instances hideable Neither is optimalthe first could lead to a crazy number of variants and the second could result in a large number of hidden layers which hits performance pretty hard
It would be great to be able to specify a component instance to be nested in a parent component then allow an arbitrary number of the nested child instances in instances of the parent component
Summary: User discovered a way to transform individual elements in Figma by selecting multiple objects and changing their pixel size in the right panel, similar to Illustrator's "transform each" option.

Text: The app itself is so amazing that Im always thankful to use it very well However for users who work on documents and general tasks poor Bluetooth keyboard connectivity is too fatal Even if I try to type text from the iPad to the Bluetooth keyboard the cursor disappears and I cant write at all So in the end I have to use a separate laptop which is such a fatal flaw that makes my personal reason for buying an iPad and starting to use Notion come to nothing Please improve the Bluetooth keyboard connectivity By the way I mainly use Cyclones K3 model If only keyboard connectivity were improved it could be recognized as the best app that could not be expressed even with five stars The fact that I cant use an external keyboard is so decisive for me
Summary: User is satisfied with the app but has issues with Bluetooth keyboard connectivity, making it difficult to use on the iPad. They suggest improving the keyboard connectivity to make the app more useful for their needs.

Text:
Arc browser continuous review
Tldr Im loving it So far its been a fantastic experience Arc brings a lot of fresh air to a place where innovation seemingly stopped
What is Arc Check out browsercompany 
Dive into the thread below  1n
1 Firsttime use experience
Really well done I enjoyed the semiinteractive introlearning experience The keyboard shortcuts were introduced too
Setting up the colour scheme was excellent Straight away you know these guys are trying to do something different 
2 Firsttime use contd
I wish there was a bit more practice your shortcuts the only one that stuck with me was the one I already use elsewhere T
Saying that T execution is excellent and can be used for commands very much like K in other apps
3 Split view
This is my 1 feature so far
It seems to me that the people at browsercompany invested in getting to know users
One would doubt there could be anything left to learn about using a browser in 2023 What customer problems are there left to solve
And still
4 Split view contd
Split view solves a problem many of us have when we attempt to multitask Our current workarounds include constantly rearranging windows  to you BetterSnapTool etc Its chaos
Time will tell if Split view solves this but right now Im thrilled
5 Split view contd
The microinteractions here feel just right Intuitive discoverable The onboarding helped too
6 Profiles
This is a big one for me I struggled with this on Chrome My solution was to strictly use Chrome for work stuff plus Safari for personal use
But obviously that doesnt work well
7 Ecosystem
My incumbent browsers allow me to browse across devices with one app ecosystem I can easily continue on my iPadPro Safari where I left off on my laptop and then seamlessly move to my phone
Arc needs a mobiletablet app
8 Mini Arc
I took the plunge and made Arc my default browser and suddenly links from Slack opened in Mini Arc
Great when I need to quickly check stuff and close the tab But if I need to stay longer in the context I still need to move from the Mini Arc to the full Arc
9 Sidebar
Shifting the tabs from the top bar to a sidebar was smart This suits me for a few reasons
a wide angle screen form factor
b utility of vertical space is better for Spaces history etc all coexisting in one area
10 Sidebar
However my eyes were trained to look for tabs on top of the screen for so long that having them on LHS feels weird This might change after a few more days
Id love the ability to move the sidebar between LHS and RHS depending on when I place Arc on my monitor
11 Ecosystem contd
I expected browsing on Arc wont be seamless across devices wout native iOS apps Turns out the iPadOSMacOS continuity pushes the current tab across devices on the same iCloud account
Not sure about the predictability of this but so far looks good
12 Living with Arc
 cant imagine giving up Spaces
 pinned foldersbookmarks as expected
 keep forgetting to use Favourites
 have a lovehate relationship w links opening in overlay
browsercompany I really want to change icons on pinned folders pretty please
13 The iOS app dropped
Unexpected but pleasant Cant wait to dive in 

Hey browsercompany I need your help
Is there a way to tell apps to open links in a specific space
Eg my Slack always open links in my work spaceprofile
Im logged into two different Google accounts across two spaces
JiriJerabek browsercompany Great question Not right now but this feature for link routing by Space is coming in a couple weeks 
Cant wait to hear what you think
Summary: The user is enjoying the new features in Arc, including the split view, sidebar, and the ability to pin folders. They are also impressed with the iOS app, which allows them to open links in specific spaces. However, they are concerned about the lack of a mobile app and the lack of a way to tell apps to open links in specific spaces.

Text:
Arc browser continuous review
Tldr Im loving it So far its been a fantastic experience Arc brings a lot of fresh air to a place where innovation seemingly stopped
What is Arc Check out browsercompany 
Dive into the thread below  1n
1 Firsttime use experience
Really well done I enjoyed the semiinteractive introlearning experience The keyboard shortcuts were introduced too
Setting up the colour scheme was excellent Straight away you know these guys are trying to do something different 
2 Firsttime use contd
I wish there was a bit more practice your shortcuts the only one that stuck with me was the one I already use elsewhere T
Saying that T execution is excellent and can be used for commands very much like K in other apps
3 Split view
This is my 1 feature so far
It seems to me that the people at browsercompany invested in getting to know users
One would doubt there could be anything left to learn about using a browser in 2023 What customer problems are there left to solve
And still
4 Split view contd
Split view solves a problem many of us have when we attempt to multitask Our current workarounds include constantly rearranging windows  to you BetterSnapTool etc Its chaos
Time will tell if Split view solves this but right now Im thrilled
5 Split view contd
The microinteractions here feel just right Intuitive discoverable The onboarding helped too
6 Profiles
This is a big one for me I struggled with this on Chrome My solution was to strictly use Chrome for work stuff plus Safari for personal use
But obviously that doesnt work well
7 Ecosystem
My incumbent browsers allow me to browse across devices with one app ecosystem I can easily continue on my iPadPro Safari where I left off on my laptop and then seamlessly move to my phone
Arc needs a mobiletablet app
8 Mini Arc
I took the plunge and made Arc my default browser and suddenly links from Slack opened in Mini Arc
Great when I need to quickly check stuff and close the tab But if I need to stay longer in the context I still need to move from the Mini Arc to the full Arc
9 Sidebar
Shifting the tabs from the top bar to a sidebar was smart This suits me for a few reasons
a wide angle screen form factor
b utility of vertical space is better for Spaces history etc all coexisting in one area
10 Sidebar
However my eyes were trained to look for tabs on top of the screen for so long that having them on LHS feels weird This might change after a few more days
Id love the ability to move the sidebar between LHS and RHS depending on when I place Arc on my monitor
11 Ecosystem contd
I expected browsing on Arc wont be seamless across devices wout native iOS apps Turns out the iPadOSMacOS continuity pushes the current tab across devices on the same iCloud account
Not sure about the predictability of this but so far looks good
12 Living with Arc
 cant imagine giving up Spaces
 pinned foldersbookmarks as expected
 keep forgetting to use Favourites
 have a lovehate relationship w links opening in overlay
browsercompany I really want to change icons on pinned folders pretty please
13 The iOS app dropped
Unexpected but pleasant Cant wait to dive in 

Hey browsercompany I need your help
Is there a way to tell apps to open links in a specific space
Eg my Slack always open links in my work spaceprofile
Im logged into two different Google accounts across two spaces
JiriJerabek browsercompany Great question Not right now but this feature for link routing by Space is coming in a couple weeks 
Cant wait to hear what you think
Summary: The user is enjoying the new features in Arc, including the split view, sidebar, and the ability to pin folders. They are also impressed with the iOS app, which allows them to open links in specific spaces. However, they are concerned about the lack of a mobile app and the lack of a way to tell apps to open links in specific spaces.

This on figma makes no sense Who decided rgba is the default color notation for cssweb Today we have so many color spaces available but designers are stuck with hexrgb

After the most recent update of Figma  Pushed a couple of days ago prototypes using Figmas nested component prototyping have been affected This has been cross checked on web links  alternative machines
This has new overwrites that arent included and are causing very concerning issues especially on components that use auto layouts This ultimately means if we hadnt complete a round of user testing a couple of weeks prior we would have some serious issues
Is anyone else getting anything similar
Thanks
Alex

Thanks man works for me after renaming Doesnt work after reseting name back Still better than nothing but it is a real pain as thats part of our design system and i should provide some guideance how to use that component

Text:
Im not a big planner to begin with probably due to my lack of enjoyment for more mainstream planners like Google calendar and traditional paper planners Google while claiming to be userfriendly had too many tools and GUIs to navigate through which felt overwhelming to me while still lacking the flexibility I desired Paper planners I encountered in the store didnt do the job either because they were not formatted exactly how I wanted and of course a regular old notebook didnt provide the online accessibility I wanted
Notion is everything you wanted in a planner and truly helped bring the planning side of me back to reality It provided helpful templates I could use to give an overall format for what I wanted to write checklists boxes etc which were incredibly customizable The tool is simple yet powerful without any unnecessary visual effects or special features you are forced to learn I love that Notion can be accessed on any device via the website or app and my plans look the exact same in any format without shifting its orientation or completely uphauling the website layout I would recommend this to anyone
Summary: User finds Notion helpful for organizing their daily tasks and planning their week, as it provides templates and customizable tools for organizing their tasks. They appreciate the flexibility and ease of use, and find it helpful for their daily tasks.

Text:
Collaborating with people in different locations and timezones 
Repository  bringing multimedia assets related to a single project into one space 
Collaborating without a tool like this would be incredibly difficult
As a UX researcher Ive been using Miro for years It helped me collaborate remotely before the pandemic forced everyone to go remote Ive used it for project management research synthesis collaboration and feedback and even lightweight design The templates help save time when putting together something like a Gantt or Kanban board An absolute must for remove workshops love the timer background musing voting Follow me mode Very easy to learn
The UI has gotten a bit busy with controls in all 4 corners of the screen I supposed its expected for a tool that does so many jobs
Summary: User appreciates the ease of collaboration and sharing information with remote whiteboarding sessions facilitated by FigJam, and mentions that non-designers have started to adopt it in their workflows. They also suggest adding more visual options to the platform to create more customized and visually exciting files.

Text:
Think its impossible to create a successful solo business without coding and an audience Think again I did it and heres how I did it to earn my first dollars here  a gift is waiting for you in the last tweet 
Before we begin
When I won 2500 here
 I had an audience of 500 followers
 I didnt know how to code
 I didnt know anything about Twitter
I did
So did you
Now heres how I did it 
 First you need a brilliant idea It doesnt have to be groundbreaking just something youre passionate about Remember youre building this solo so youll need that passion to fuel your journey
 Once you have your idea its time to build without coding I used webflow to create my website and app without any coding knowledge Its incredibly userfriendly with a plethora of customizable templates to suit your business
webflow  Organize your thoughts and plan your content using NotionHQ As a solopreneur I found this to be the perfect tool for managing my tasks jotting down ideas and creating content outlines Plus its super easy to use
webflow NotionHQ  Find your niche and target audience You dont need a massive audience to succeedjust a group of dedicated engaged followers who love your work Focus on connecting with them and providing value
webflow NotionHQ  Share your work and gather feedback Join communities like IndieHackers ProductHunt and relevant Facebook groups to find likeminded people who can give you insights and encouragement
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Set up a business model that works for you From subscriptions and memberships to onetime purchases find a revenue stream that fits your goals and caters to your audiences needs
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Educate yourself Attend webinars read articles and listen to podcasts to stay uptodate with the latest trends and strategies You dont need a formal education to succeed just a curious mind
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Iterate improve and grow Be open to change and adapt to your audiences needs Remember building a business is an ongoing process and theres always room for improvement
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Track your progress and celebrate your wins Set measurable goals analyze your metrics and appreciate your achievements This is your journey and every small victory matters
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Believe in yourself and your idea As a solopreneur selfconfidence is crucial Keep pushing forward even when things get tough Youve got this

Text:
Everyone Use googledocs its simple  No use evernote and NotionHQ its shared  No do RoamResearch its serious  No use Apple Notes and Google Keep
Me They ALL run INSIDE my obsdmd  
Be a rebel  
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd Obsidian is built on a technology called Electron
Electron is just a Chrome browser that runs like an app on your desktop
So essentially Obsidian  Snazzy Browser for your notes
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd This allows us  in theory  to browse any website
In practice it works 80 of the time hence I couldnt get it to work with tana_inc or logseq 
While Obsidian does not support that out of the box  with a plugin its easy Lets get to it
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq Go to Settings gt Community Plugins Search for Custom Frames
Install it 
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq In the Obsidian settings there will be now a new entry Custom Frames towards end of your list
Find the New Frame button and click it A Frame is such a browser window that we can use to access all of the services
The new entry will appear in the list above the button 
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq Configure your Frame
1 Set the URL   or   copy amp paste from Browser
2  open in center to open the service like a tab otherwise its in the sidebar
3  Add Ribbon Icon to display a side icon 
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq Specify the icon you want to use
Go to  and find an icon you like
Copy paste its name into the icon textfield in previous step 
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq RESTART OBSIDIAN
Your new ribbon icon should now appear on the left
You will have to log in to GoogleAppleEvernote the first time But then it will remember you Just like in a browser
On the top right you find a few buttons to reload the page 
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq Summary
 Download Custom Frames plugin
 Add frames to any website as Obsidian is technically a browser
 This technique works with ANY website So you can integrate google calendar facebook or a todo app into obsidian
googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq Obsidian is THE notetaking app to rule them all I focus on helping Academics amp Knowledge Workers to leverage its capacities to the max If you want to propel your academic career join my seminar this week and become an Effortless Academic

Artifexx googledocs evernote NotionHQ RoamResearch obsdmd tana_inc logseq SaveToNotion Thread Study
Summary: The user is excited about the new features in Obsidian, including the ability to add custom frames and customize the ribbon icon. They are also excited about the new features in the Notion app, including the ability to add custom frames and customize the ribbon icon.

Text:
Hi all I am working on a Figma plugin that needs to import style from our team library Through research I think the way is to first use Figma REST API to get the keys of styles from our library file and the use figmaimportStyleByKeyAsync to import the style However the issue is this requires me to put my Access token in the plugin and I dont want to Is there a way for plugin to authenticate when making REST API calls on behalf of the person who uses the plugin
Or are there any other easier ways to importaccess styles from team library file in plugin Thanks a lot
You have several ways
Users will create their own personal access tokens which will be inserted into the input field of your plugin
Users will open the necessary library files run the plugin there to get the necessary keys return to another file to continue working
Hardcode the keys in the plugin
31 Or add these keys to for example a JSON file that you or anyone else can keep updating as needed

Text:
Hi I believe Ive exhausted all the existing help articles on this
Im having a hard time with something that should be very basic I have 25 or so screens the ONLY interaction between them is that the user should be able to click andor press the arrow key to navigate LINEARLY between them
Sometimes it works especially if I go slowly it works every time But sometimes it doesnt sometimes it inexplicably jumps through sections pretty much only happens if I press the arrow keys quickly It appears that if I click through it goes linearly every time without skipping screens So the problem is only with the arrow keys which I cant disable so I need to understand the behavior before handing off to my client
Ive adjusted all the artboards The desired order is Row 1 Left to Right Row 2 Left to Right as described in the documentation All rows have the exact same Y coordinate All columns have the exact same X coordinate
Ive spent hours on this already and this is really basic behavior so Im not sure why its so hard I want it to act like powerpoint in presentation mode
Any help is appreciated I cant really share the prototype because Im on NDA
Or up vote the solution here
 
 
 
 Remove auto creating flow starting points Share an idea
 
 
 I love the new feature that allows multiple prototypes per page One issue Im having with it is it assumes I want everything to be a new flow starting point each time I dont link something from the first flow starting page 
It has a very linear mindset When I workprototype I tend to work on a section then link it back and that creates many flow starting points on accident and I have to delete them 
Itd be nice if either  it only created the first one and doesnt assume you want many o

I am working on a large project across multiple teams in different locations Miro has helped us collaborate and work jointly on material that otherwise would have been more challenging to do in other tools This is a quick real time way of working with others even when youre not in the same room

Text: I have been using notion for the past two years and it is really helpful I started using it to organise notes for uni and keep track of my assignments Initially it is a bit difficult to navigate the service but the more you use it the more efficient you become You can borrow free templates online if creating your own is difficult I use notion to track almost everything and even without upgradation the app works reasonably well you can access the basic things which for a beginner is good enough Once i figure out how to create templates and deal with the more complex blocks they offer I will definitely be upgrading to the plus ver
Summary: User has been using Notion for two years and finds it helpful for organizing notes for university and keeping track of assignments. Initially, it is difficult to navigate the service, but with practice, it becomes more efficient. The user appreciates the free templates available online and finds the basic features sufficient for a beginner.

Text: I have been using notion for the past two years and it is really helpful I started using it to organise notes for uni and keep track of my assignments Initially it is a bit difficult to navigate the service but the more you use it the more efficient you become You can borrow free templates online if creating your own is difficult I use notion to track almost everything and even without upgradation the app works reasonably well you can access the basic things which for a beginner is good enough Once i figure out how to create templates and deal with the more complex blocks they offer I will definitely be upgrading to the plus ver

Text:
Arc browser continuous review
Tldr Im loving it So far its been a fantastic experience Arc brings a lot of fresh air to a place where innovation seemingly stopped
What is Arc Check out browsercompany 
Dive into the thread below  1n
1 Firsttime use experience
Really well done I enjoyed the semiinteractive introlearning experience The keyboard shortcuts were introduced too
Setting up the colour scheme was excellent Straight away you know these guys are trying to do something different 
2 Firsttime use contd
I wish there was a bit more practice your shortcuts the only one that stuck with me was the one I already use elsewhere T
Saying that T execution is excellent and can be used for commands very much like K in other apps
3 Split view
This is my 1 feature so far
It seems to me that the people at browsercompany invested in getting to know users
One would doubt there could be anything left to learn about using a browser in 2023 What customer problems are there left to solve
And still
4 Split view contd
Split view solves a problem many of us have when we attempt to multitask Our current workarounds include constantly rearranging windows  to you BetterSnapTool etc Its chaos
Time will tell if Split view solves this but right now Im thrilled
5 Split view contd
The microinteractions here feel just right Intuitive discoverable The onboarding helped too
6 Profiles
This is a big one for me I struggled with this on Chrome My solution was to strictly use Chrome for work stuff plus Safari for personal use
But obviously that doesnt work well
7 Ecosystem
My incumbent browsers allow me to browse across devices with one app ecosystem I can easily continue on my iPadPro Safari where I left off on my laptop and then seamlessly move to my phone
Arc needs a mobiletablet app
8 Mini Arc
I took the plunge and made Arc my default browser and suddenly links from Slack opened in Mini Arc
Great when I need to quickly check stuff and close the tab But if I need to stay longer in the context I still need to move from the Mini Arc to the full Arc
9 Sidebar
Shifting the tabs from the top bar to a sidebar was smart This suits me for a few reasons
a wide angle screen form factor
b utility of vertical space is better for Spaces history etc all coexisting in one area
10 Sidebar
However my eyes were trained to look for tabs on top of the screen for so long that having them on LHS feels weird This might change after a few more days
Id love the ability to move the sidebar between LHS and RHS depending on when I place Arc on my monitor
11 Ecosystem contd
I expected browsing on Arc wont be seamless across devices wout native iOS apps Turns out the iPadOSMacOS continuity pushes the current tab across devices on the same iCloud account
Not sure about the predictability of this but so far looks good
12 Living with Arc
 cant imagine giving up Spaces
 pinned foldersbookmarks as expected
 keep forgetting to use Favourites
 have a lovehate relationship w links opening in overlay
browsercompany I really want to change icons on pinned folders pretty please
13 The iOS app dropped
Unexpected but pleasant Cant wait to dive in 

Hey browsercompany I need your help
Is there a way to tell apps to open links in a specific space
Eg my Slack always open links in my work spaceprofile
Im logged into two different Google accounts across two spaces
JiriJerabek browsercompany Great question Not right now but this feature for link routing by Space is coming in a couple weeks 
Cant wait to hear what you think
Summary: The user is enjoying the new features in Arc, including the split view, sidebar, and the ability to pin folders. They are also impressed with the iOS app, which allows them to open links in specific spaces. However, they are concerned about the lack of a mobile app and the lack of a way to tell apps to open links in specific spaces.

Text:
Hi
Turning off snap to pixel grid in a Figma Design file no longer changes snapping behavior when dragging frames around
Whether this feature is turned on or off a dragged frame still snaps to each pixel no matter how zoomedin Note that some other objects eg vector objects still respect this setting Its just an issue with frames components and component instances Note that If I group the frame I then can drag the group to any subpixel location
Ive restarted my machine restarted Figma checked for updates reloaded tabs tried it in other design files Tried it in the client in Chrome and in Safari Same problem
Can anyone else replicate this
Uff This is a huge issue for creating illustrations and configuring logos vector graphics etc Please fix this

Text:
MIRO helps me manage a project schedule with complex deliverables timeline swimlane owners and key crossfunctional dependencies It also helps with basic product roadmap and innovation planning The visual appeal is also helpful as it can serve as a presentation board for senior management presentations
MIRO is an ideal tool for facilitating collaboration across teams or large groups I use it with my teams for a variety of applications including planning project schedules brainstorming ideas mapping out solutions and process flow diagrams It is highly flexible allowing the user to define the structure and content I really like the ease of use and the infinite space which allows you to constantly be adding to existing boards There are many existing templates that help provide a good starting point for collaboration
One of the challenges that weve seen is integration with other software Id like to see a more seamless integration with MS Excelfor instance the ability to capture live Excel spreadsheets in MIRO that are autoupdates as the underlying Excel sheet changes
Summary: The user appreciates the collaboration features of Miro, which allow team members to work together regardless of location. They also appreciate the digital whiteboard, which allows teams to capture ideas, organize information, and make decisions in real-time. The user finds the tool easy to use and appreciates the zoom in/zoom out feature. However, they find it challenging to use from mobile internet due to the high-speed internet requirement.

Text:
I use Miro for mind maps team whiteboard sessions sprint and product retrospectives collaborative wireframing with Experience designers and could go on with this list It has application with a number of product management tasks
I use Miro for a long list of important product management activities It has a nice set of wireframing tools and is easy for someone who wants to sketch out ideas without using advanced design tools like Figma of Invision I also use it to collaborate with stakeholders within the company when framing problems The team there regularly makes product enhancements that make the tool even better
The organizational structure of the tool leaves a bit to be desired This may be user error more than anything but sometimes after creating several different boards on a similar topic its hard to organize them into a folder structure that makes it easy to find the board Im looking for
Summary: Users appreciate Miro for its easy navigation, customizable templates, and visually appealing interface. They find it effective for client meetings and project planning, and believe it fulfills its intended purpose without any significant weaknesses.

Text:
Before starting each project I meet with my clients to know what they want To do this we connect through Miro and create a dashboard to facilitate these explanations so that what is most important is recorded 
The result of this session is what I use as a basis for the approach of the project in question virtual office
Miros navigation was the reason why I decided to use it It is so good that anyone can adapt to the software with a couple of simple directions 
I love that the templates can be modified with a few clicks to suit the moments needs 
And their visuals are lovely complete and easy to understand
Miro has no fundamental weaknesses It is software that does what it is supposed to do If it is necessary to use other apps it is because Miro is not designed for it
Summary: Users appreciate Figma's remote collaboration capabilities, Jira card integration, canvas design, and various features such as templates, app integrations, presentation tools, and AI components. However, they experience issues when sharing boards with free license users who need to actively collaborate.

I really love nested instance properties feature but it works for one component instance only It would be useful if nested instance properties were available when I select several parent instances
My example
Component structure
component Label  used for different statuses  has text property Label for text inside 2 component Table Cell  used for building tables  has variants for different types of cells
Case I create column of statuses in the table it includes cells which include label If I want to update text in one label I can use nested labels text property But when I want to update text in several cells nested instance property disappears and I need to select label instead of cells or use some plugin for bulk text update
PS thanks to figma team for your incredible work I would also love to see support for this

Text:
All our team can access the boards either independently or together 
This enables everyone to work on items when it is best for them 
 
Having everyone able to provide input or comments directly in the Miro boards means that there is less indirect  administrative load
Great compatibility with other programs Microsoft Teams and Office tie ins work well 
Duplicated copied in data means no location links to maintain 
Large number of templates that can be leveraged to kick start your layouts
Sometimes you want to preserve links to the data and be able to automatically update 
This is not a strength of the platform as generally speaking the data become separate from the source when pulled in
Summary: The user appreciates the ability to organize their project in one place and share it with collaborators, as well as the ability to add comments and sticky notes. They also appreciate the endless board feature and the ability to follow themselves around the board for critiques. The user finds the platform easy to use and appreciates the hidden features.

Text:
Im not a big planner to begin with probably due to my lack of enjoyment for more mainstream planners like Google calendar and traditional paper planners Google while claiming to be userfriendly had too many tools and GUIs to navigate through which felt overwhelming to me while still lacking the flexibility I desired Paper planners I encountered in the store didnt do the job either because they were not formatted exactly how I wanted and of course a regular old notebook didnt provide the online accessibility I wanted
Notion is everything you wanted in a planner and truly helped bring the planning side of me back to reality It provided helpful templates I could use to give an overall format for what I wanted to write checklists boxes etc which were incredibly customizable The tool is simple yet powerful without any unnecessary visual effects or special features you are forced to learn I love that Notion can be accessed on any device via the website or app and my plans look the exact same in any format without shifting its orientation or completely uphauling the website layout I would recommend this to anyone
Summary: User finds Notion helpful for organizing their daily tasks and planning their week, as it provides templates and customizable tools for organizing their tasks. They appreciate the flexibility and ease of use, and find it helpful for their daily tasks.

Text:
Miro has the power to aggregate what has been shared among multiple tools In addition it has the potential to allow multiple people to work at the same time without any problems and it has been used in seminars and training sessions and has been very popular In the training that I participate in training using miro is increasing and it is very useful to visualize the result of the discussion in a short time
Miro is easier to use than an actual whiteboard In particular its easy to attach write move and connect sticky notes and it automatically corrects the connection lines so you can use it more efficiently than an actual whiteboard So you can focus on the discussion Also miro is great for sharing information you create online ensuring that the same image information is conveyed As a comparison to other similar tools its nice to have reaction features icons and formatting that you cant use up
The disadvantage of miro is that the access can be quite slow depending on the board When you first open a board with a lot of information on it you often have to wait a few 10 seconds I hope that this problem will be solved by devising means such as image processing centered on the area where the display priority is being determined Also if you just use it you dont have a chance to see new or useful functions so I think it would be good if you were shown it by a popup This feature may already exist and you may have turned it off yourself but it is true that it does not appear at this time
Summary: The user appreciates Figma for its ease of use in remote and hybrid teams, allowing for asynchronous problem-solving and accessible designs. However, they find the flow charting feature challenging when referencing other boards.

Text:
Arc browser continuous review
Tldr Im loving it So far its been a fantastic experience Arc brings a lot of fresh air to a place where innovation seemingly stopped
What is Arc Check out browsercompany 
Dive into the thread below  1n
1 Firsttime use experience
Really well done I enjoyed the semiinteractive introlearning experience The keyboard shortcuts were introduced too
Setting up the colour scheme was excellent Straight away you know these guys are trying to do something different 
2 Firsttime use contd
I wish there was a bit more practice your shortcuts the only one that stuck with me was the one I already use elsewhere T
Saying that T execution is excellent and can be used for commands very much like K in other apps
3 Split view
This is my 1 feature so far
It seems to me that the people at browsercompany invested in getting to know users
One would doubt there could be anything left to learn about using a browser in 2023 What customer problems are there left to solve
And still
4 Split view contd
Split view solves a problem many of us have when we attempt to multitask Our current workarounds include constantly rearranging windows  to you BetterSnapTool etc Its chaos
Time will tell if Split view solves this but right now Im thrilled
5 Split view contd
The microinteractions here feel just right Intuitive discoverable The onboarding helped too
6 Profiles
This is a big one for me I struggled with this on Chrome My solution was to strictly use Chrome for work stuff plus Safari for personal use
But obviously that doesnt work well
7 Ecosystem
My incumbent browsers allow me to browse across devices with one app ecosystem I can easily continue on my iPadPro Safari where I left off on my laptop and then seamlessly move to my phone
Arc needs a mobiletablet app
8 Mini Arc
I took the plunge and made Arc my default browser and suddenly links from Slack opened in Mini Arc
Great when I need to quickly check stuff and close the tab But if I need to stay longer in the context I still need to move from the Mini Arc to the full Arc
9 Sidebar
Shifting the tabs from the top bar to a sidebar was smart This suits me for a few reasons
a wide angle screen form factor
b utility of vertical space is better for Spaces history etc all coexisting in one area
10 Sidebar
However my eyes were trained to look for tabs on top of the screen for so long that having them on LHS feels weird This might change after a few more days
Id love the ability to move the sidebar between LHS and RHS depending on when I place Arc on my monitor
11 Ecosystem contd
I expected browsing on Arc wont be seamless across devices wout native iOS apps Turns out the iPadOSMacOS continuity pushes the current tab across devices on the same iCloud account
Not sure about the predictability of this but so far looks good
12 Living with Arc
 cant imagine giving up Spaces
 pinned foldersbookmarks as expected
 keep forgetting to use Favourites
 have a lovehate relationship w links opening in overlay
browsercompany I really want to change icons on pinned folders pretty please
13 The iOS app dropped
Unexpected but pleasant Cant wait to dive in 

Hey browsercompany I need your help
Is there a way to tell apps to open links in a specific space
Eg my Slack always open links in my work spaceprofile
Im logged into two different Google accounts across two spaces
JiriJerabek browsercompany Great question Not right now but this feature for link routing by Space is coming in a couple weeks 
Cant wait to hear what you think
Summary: The user is enjoying the new features in Arc, including the split view, sidebar, and the ability to pin folders. They are also impressed with the iOS app, which allows them to open links in specific spaces. However, they are concerned about the lack of a mobile app and the lack of a way to tell apps to open links in specific spaces.

Text:
10 tools I use every week as a product manager
1 asana 
This is our tool of choice when it comes to organizing work throughout the company
Simple but powerful it does everything we need to keep our teams organized and our work visible
2 MiroHQ 
Ive been using Miro for everything lately product briefs data analyses brainstorming mockups 
Its a tool that can do a ton of things well and helps make visuals much easier to consume vs a document
3 Looker
Weve used Looker for several years and its our goto spot for building reports and dashboards
Our core team dashboard and pricingconversion dashboards both live here and I check each daily
4 Amplitude_HQ 
For product analytics we use Amplitude Looker gives me highlevel business metrics Amplitude gives me the details
We use this for understanding the user behavior behind the metrics
5 CrazyEgg amp hotjar 
Two tools that do similar things we use one for our website and one for our app
These give us even more qualitative data behind our metrics with things like heat maps and screen recordings
6 SlackHQ 
I barely use email any more and while the Slack overload is real it does enable fast async communication among our teams wherever we are
Its also great for consolidating notifications from other tools Asana Google Docs etc if you set up the integrations
7 Officevibe 
Our HR team implemented this tool and as PM it gives me a bunch of metrics about how my team is doing
It gives me some data backing for how the team is feeling and shows me when I might need to spend time on morale
8 figma 
Miro is great for lofi prototypes and brainstorming but at some point it moves to Figma
This is where we build prototypes for user testing comment on designs and ultimately deliver the final spec to developers
Summary: User's design for an ad poster for Orijin Nigeria was featured on the list of awesome works on JoinTabulio, thanks to @joinTabulio for spotlighting it.

Text:
Think its impossible to create a successful solo business without coding and an audience Think again I did it and heres how I did it to earn my first dollars here  a gift is waiting for you in the last tweet 
Before we begin
When I won 2500 here
 I had an audience of 500 followers
 I didnt know how to code
 I didnt know anything about Twitter
I did
So did you
Now heres how I did it 
 First you need a brilliant idea It doesnt have to be groundbreaking just something youre passionate about Remember youre building this solo so youll need that passion to fuel your journey
 Once you have your idea its time to build without coding I used webflow to create my website and app without any coding knowledge Its incredibly userfriendly with a plethora of customizable templates to suit your business
webflow  Organize your thoughts and plan your content using NotionHQ As a solopreneur I found this to be the perfect tool for managing my tasks jotting down ideas and creating content outlines Plus its super easy to use
webflow NotionHQ  Find your niche and target audience You dont need a massive audience to succeedjust a group of dedicated engaged followers who love your work Focus on connecting with them and providing value
webflow NotionHQ  Share your work and gather feedback Join communities like IndieHackers ProductHunt and relevant Facebook groups to find likeminded people who can give you insights and encouragement
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Set up a business model that works for you From subscriptions and memberships to onetime purchases find a revenue stream that fits your goals and caters to your audiences needs
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Educate yourself Attend webinars read articles and listen to podcasts to stay uptodate with the latest trends and strategies You dont need a formal education to succeed just a curious mind
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Iterate improve and grow Be open to change and adapt to your audiences needs Remember building a business is an ongoing process and theres always room for improvement
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Track your progress and celebrate your wins Set measurable goals analyze your metrics and appreciate your achievements This is your journey and every small victory matters
Summary: The user is a freelance writer and has been using Notion for a year. They are currently working on a book and are looking for a publisher. They are also looking for a designer to help with the cover.

Text:
Arc browser continuous review
Tldr Im loving it So far its been a fantastic experience Arc brings a lot of fresh air to a place where innovation seemingly stopped
What is Arc Check out browsercompany 
Dive into the thread below  1n
1 Firsttime use experience
Really well done I enjoyed the semiinteractive introlearning experience The keyboard shortcuts were introduced too
Setting up the colour scheme was excellent Straight away you know these guys are trying to do something different 
2 Firsttime use contd
I wish there was a bit more practice your shortcuts the only one that stuck with me was the one I already use elsewhere T
Saying that T execution is excellent and can be used for commands very much like K in other apps
3 Split view
This is my 1 feature so far
It seems to me that the people at browsercompany invested in getting to know users
One would doubt there could be anything left to learn about using a browser in 2023 What customer problems are there left to solve
And still
4 Split view contd
Split view solves a problem many of us have when we attempt to multitask Our current workarounds include constantly rearranging windows  to you BetterSnapTool etc Its chaos
Time will tell if Split view solves this but right now Im thrilled
5 Split view contd
The microinteractions here feel just right Intuitive discoverable The onboarding helped too
6 Profiles
This is a big one for me I struggled with this on Chrome My solution was to strictly use Chrome for work stuff plus Safari for personal use
But obviously that doesnt work well
7 Ecosystem
My incumbent browsers allow me to browse across devices with one app ecosystem I can easily continue on my iPadPro Safari where I left off on my laptop and then seamlessly move to my phone
Arc needs a mobiletablet app
8 Mini Arc
I took the plunge and made Arc my default browser and suddenly links from Slack opened in Mini Arc
Great when I need to quickly check stuff and close the tab But if I need to stay longer in the context I still need to move from the Mini Arc to the full Arc
9 Sidebar
Shifting the tabs from the top bar to a sidebar was smart This suits me for a few reasons
a wide angle screen form factor
b utility of vertical space is better for Spaces history etc all coexisting in one area
10 Sidebar
However my eyes were trained to look for tabs on top of the screen for so long that having them on LHS feels weird This might change after a few more days
Id love the ability to move the sidebar between LHS and RHS depending on when I place Arc on my monitor
11 Ecosystem contd
I expected browsing on Arc wont be seamless across devices wout native iOS apps Turns out the iPadOSMacOS continuity pushes the current tab across devices on the same iCloud account
Not sure about the predictability of this but so far looks good
12 Living with Arc
 cant imagine giving up Spaces
 pinned foldersbookmarks as expected
 keep forgetting to use Favourites
 have a lovehate relationship w links opening in overlay
browsercompany I really want to change icons on pinned folders pretty please
13 The iOS app dropped
Unexpected but pleasant Cant wait to dive in 

Hey browsercompany I need your help
Is there a way to tell apps to open links in a specific space
Eg my Slack always open links in my work spaceprofile
Im logged into two different Google accounts across two spaces
JiriJerabek browsercompany Great question Not right now but this feature for link routing by Space is coming in a couple weeks 
Cant wait to hear what you think
Summary: The user is enjoying the new features in Arc, including the split view, sidebar, and the ability to pin folders. They are also impressed with the iOS app, which allows them to open links in specific spaces. However, they are concerned about the lack of a mobile app and the lack of a way to tell apps to open links in specific spaces.

Text:
It replaced physical whiteboards for discovery and brainstorming sessions It also works as an excellent icebreaker and teambuilding tool to have everyone active during meetings or learning sessions
For those who miss physical whiteboards and postits this is the solution to easily and virtually visualize projects and organize brainstorming project management and workflow visualization Its very friendly intuitive and compatible with other tools
Some toolboxes usually overlap important information and sharing options are not that easy to understand and use mainly with external not frequent users
Summary: Users find Miro to be an effective collaboration tool that helps run meetings smoothly, reduces manual work, and saves costs. They appreciate its user-friendly interface, available templates, sharing capabilities, and affordability. Miro has positively impacted their workplace, and they have no significant dislikes about the tool.

Text:
I use NotionHQ for capturing ideas and insights throughout the day I review them later and transform them into actionable tasks or projects
What do you most use Notion for on a daily basis
grigor_k NotionHQ Writing poetry
hornemountain1 NotionHQ And why do you prefer to use notion for your poetry
Summary: User is using Notion for their daily work and appreciates the ability to create and share ideas with others.

Text:
Another problem that Miro solves is the challenge of sharing complex ideas in a simple way Miros range of templates diagrams and sticky notes make it easy to share ideas visually which can be especially helpful for projects that require a lot of detail or complexity This has allowed me to communicate my ideas more effectively with my team members resulting in better collaboration and a more efficient workflow
I have found Miro to be an incredibly powerful tool for collaborating with teams One of the things I like best about Miro is how easy it is to use The interface is intuitive and userfriendly making it simple to get started even for those who are not particularly techsavvy 
The realtime collaboration features in Miro are also incredibly helpful Multiple team members can work on a board simultaneously which helps to streamline the collaborative process and ensure that everyone is on the same page Additionally the platforms extensive range of features such as templates sticky notes and diagrams are highly customizable allowing for greater flexibility when working on projects
One thing that I have found to be a drawback of Miro is its pricing structure While the platform offers a free plan its more advanced features are only available with paid plans which may be expensive for smaller teams or individuals Additionally the platforms extensive range of features can be overwhelming for new users and it may take some time to learn how to use everything effectively However Miros support resources including video tutorials and a user community are quite helpful in getting up to speed quickly
Summary: The user loves FigJam for its ease of use and prefers it over multiple apps for conceptualizing ideas and storyboards. They have not used any other whiteboarding app and cannot identify any limitations.

Text:
Miro solves two huge problems for me 
 
1 Remote working and having collaborative sessions with other team members Before I found Miro having these sessions was incredibly hard 
2 When you write on a whiteboard at some stage it gets rubbed off Miro you can have endless whiteboards that you never need to delete
Miro is incredibly helpful for a number of reasons The best way to look at it is like a whiteboard with all the relevant tools online You can use it for brainstorming sessions mapping customer journeys comparing notes and heaps more It feels like I have only just scraped the surface with what is possible on Miro
Honestly there arent many downsides to using Miro The hardest part is probably getting use to it and understanding what you should use for certain things Maybe some more tutorials would be helpful
Summary: The user finds Figma helpful for design creation, review, and QA purposes, appreciating its easy-to-understand UI and simple commenting system. However, they find sharing content challenging, as it requires sharing the entire board, leading to confusion and difficulty in accessing specific content.

Text: I have been using notion for the past two years and it is really helpful I started using it to organise notes for uni and keep track of my assignments Initially it is a bit difficult to navigate the service but the more you use it the more efficient you become You can borrow free templates online if creating your own is difficult I use notion to track almost everything and even without upgradation the app works reasonably well you can access the basic things which for a beginner is good enough Once i figure out how to create templates and deal with the more complex blocks they offer I will definitely be upgrading to the plus ver
Summary: User has been using Notion for two years and finds it helpful for organizing notes for university and keeping track of assignments. Initially, it is difficult to navigate the service, but with practice, it becomes more efficient. The user appreciates the free templates available online and finds the basic features sufficient for a beginner.

Text:
Miro helps me create a mindmap for a product share it with clients and other stakeholders get feedback and work collaboratively Miro also allows me to make the initial sketch for a product to give the clients a basic flow of the product so we can solve the problems before the development and keep the product consistent this also helps in efficiency and reducing costs
The upside of Miro is brainstorming can be done collaboratively with all the stakeholders including clients this helps in coming up with solutions quickly and even testing out the ideas in the initial stages of development
Miro is a good app overall but it can sometimes be overwhelming and cluttered Miro cannot be used offline Navigating on a larger gets a little tedious and occasionally inaccurate lags at times
Summary: Users appreciate Miro's collaborative features for gaining consensus among product team members and its ability to replace conference room whiteboards. However, they face challenges with importing Excel tables and HTML content and desire more robust editing options for post-it note styles.

Text:
Miro allows multiple users to simultaneously share ideas as visuals within the same space without disruption This feature makes it very helpful for any roadmap planning session A team can always return to a Miro board after to recap what has been shared or continue the work
I find Miro helpful in brainstorming sessions prototyping new digital products or mapping a flow chart It is easy to share and export a Miro file to different formats
I wouldnt say I like that there is no integration between Miro and Microsoft PowerPoint yet and I believe many users have raised the same request Since graphic and drawing tools on Miro are better we want to have the ability to work between the two platforms to present any idea better
Summary: Users find Miro valuable for enabling real-time collaboration among distributed teams and appreciate its adaptability for various meetings and workshops. They also like the continuous development of new features. However, some users may need basic training or resources to get accustomed to the navigation and features of the online whiteboarding tool.

Text:
Think its impossible to create a successful solo business without coding and an audience Think again I did it and heres how I did it to earn my first dollars here  a gift is waiting for you in the last tweet 
Before we begin
When I won 2500 here
 I had an audience of 500 followers
 I didnt know how to code
 I didnt know anything about Twitter
I did
So did you
Now heres how I did it 
 First you need a brilliant idea It doesnt have to be groundbreaking just something youre passionate about Remember youre building this solo so youll need that passion to fuel your journey
 Once you have your idea its time to build without coding I used webflow to create my website and app without any coding knowledge Its incredibly userfriendly with a plethora of customizable templates to suit your business
webflow  Organize your thoughts and plan your content using NotionHQ As a solopreneur I found this to be the perfect tool for managing my tasks jotting down ideas and creating content outlines Plus its super easy to use
webflow NotionHQ  Find your niche and target audience You dont need a massive audience to succeedjust a group of dedicated engaged followers who love your work Focus on connecting with them and providing value
webflow NotionHQ  Share your work and gather feedback Join communities like IndieHackers ProductHunt and relevant Facebook groups to find likeminded people who can give you insights and encouragement
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Set up a business model that works for you From subscriptions and memberships to onetime purchases find a revenue stream that fits your goals and caters to your audiences needs
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Educate yourself Attend webinars read articles and listen to podcasts to stay uptodate with the latest trends and strategies You dont need a formal education to succeed just a curious mind
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Iterate improve and grow Be open to change and adapt to your audiences needs Remember building a business is an ongoing process and theres always room for improvement

Summary: Flux is an open-source power tool for interacting with LLMs, allowing users to generate multiple completions per prompt in a tree structure and explore the best ones in parallel. It offers a variety of creative responses, tests different prompts with shared context, and identifies model uncertainties. Flux also features keyboard shortcuts, system message editing, autosaving, and direct use of the OpenAI API. The creators are open to collaboration and are working on an LLM collaboration tool using Ceramic Network's ComposeDB and Flux, similar to Figma for prompt design.

Text:
We want to start using versioning in our projects and we are trying to figure out the best way to do it
The approach that makes more sense to us is to create a new branch on each file for the new version
Our issue is that we have team members working on each version 1 and 2 but we cant create a new feature branch for the version 2 branch we dont have this issue for version 1 because that is the main branch
Our question is if does exist an official way to work with different versions in the same file in order to handle versioning or if there is a better way to do this
Example of what we need
Button v1 branch main
a new feature for Button v1 a new branch from the main branch
Button v2 branch version 2 branch
a new feature for Button v2 a new branch from version 2 branch
The second question is how to handle major minor and patch updates into Figma following semantic versioning definition
Our idea is to handle major changes with branches and minorpatches with version history What do you think
There is a recommended way to handle versioning
Summary: User experiences frequent errors when opening files in team projects and struggles to return to them after closing. The issue was resolved with a solution provided by another user.

Text:
Think its impossible to create a successful solo business without coding and an audience Think again I did it and heres how I did it to earn my first dollars here  a gift is waiting for you in the last tweet 
Before we begin
When I won 2500 here
 I had an audience of 500 followers
 I didnt know how to code
 I didnt know anything about Twitter
I did
So did you
Now heres how I did it 
 First you need a brilliant idea It doesnt have to be groundbreaking just something youre passionate about Remember youre building this solo so youll need that passion to fuel your journey
 Once you have your idea its time to build without coding I used webflow to create my website and app without any coding knowledge Its incredibly userfriendly with a plethora of customizable templates to suit your business
webflow  Organize your thoughts and plan your content using NotionHQ As a solopreneur I found this to be the perfect tool for managing my tasks jotting down ideas and creating content outlines Plus its super easy to use
webflow NotionHQ  Find your niche and target audience You dont need a massive audience to succeedjust a group of dedicated engaged followers who love your work Focus on connecting with them and providing value
webflow NotionHQ  Share your work and gather feedback Join communities like IndieHackers ProductHunt and relevant Facebook groups to find likeminded people who can give you insights and encouragement
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Set up a business model that works for you From subscriptions and memberships to onetime purchases find a revenue stream that fits your goals and caters to your audiences needs
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Educate yourself Attend webinars read articles and listen to podcasts to stay uptodate with the latest trends and strategies You dont need a formal education to succeed just a curious mind
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Iterate improve and grow Be open to change and adapt to your audiences needs Remember building a business is an ongoing process and theres always room for improvement
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Track your progress and celebrate your wins Set measurable goals analyze your metrics and appreciate your achievements This is your journey and every small victory matters
webflow NotionHQ IndieHackers ProductHunt  Believe in yourself and your idea As a solopreneur selfconfidence is crucial Keep pushing forward even when things get tough Youve got this
Summary: The user is a freelance writer and has been using Notion for a year. They are currently working on a book and are looking for a publisher. They are also looking for a design team to work with on their book cover.

Text:
Its the goto design tool in our team It responds to all wireframing prototyping and design requirements and facilitates team collaboration It also comes with Figjam and eliminates need for other whiteboarding tools
Its easy to get started with Figma and its robust community means there are tons of resources and plugins to inspire and help speed up your design process and there are some incredible plugins out there
There isnt much to dislike but there are a few inconveniences First everything is online so you need a strong internet connection especially when dealing with large files Second the way plugins are handled can feel a bit clunky you have to look for it saverun it and it opens as a separate window  wish there was a way to anchor it Third it might just be me but I always get confused navigating within the community section but again these are just minor inconveniences and the pros far outweigh the cons
Summary: User appreciates Figma's seamless screen creation and cloud collaboration features, but requests an increase in the number of pages available in the free version.
